loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng, 47 year old, is a cake seller. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $7 per day. They have six children; three are studying and the other three are working as laborers. Every month, she has to spend $42 on food, $40 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy farmland to have a field. She wants to get a small shop to sell groceries at home and repair her house. More than that, she hopes to send all of her family to study until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy farmland to have a field

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the past 13 years and employs three farmhands. Mary sells her produce of bananas, nappier grass, and maize at the local market. She earns additional income from her tailoring shop in the same location.

With this loan of 45,000 Kes, Mary intends to purchase a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra proceeds from this loan will be invested in the education of her children. 

Mary's primary challenges have been lack of proper market for farm produce and the fluctuating weather conditions that affect her production.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mize

texts.en:
Mize is a married woman with one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

For 10 years she has operated a fried potatoes selling business, selling door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes hard to operate her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase four sacks of potatoes and five bundles wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of potatoes and five bundles wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwangaluka Group

texts.en:
Sango is in her early thirties and has been running a pharmacy for the past six years. She works from 7:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. She has two children, the older of whom goes to school.  

This will be Sango's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy medicines that were out of stock. With the proceeds, she attended to her children's needs and her household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to open another small pharmacy in the same area but on a different street. Her dream is eventuA. to build a bigger house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mwangaluka," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of medicines

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 26 years old, married, and has five children. She has been selling vegetables for two years and makes around 6,000 KES a month. Teresa plans to use her loan to purchase more vegetables that she plans on reselling. 


She would like to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s education. This is Teresa’s first loan with KADET. She hopes to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables that she plans on reselling.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Monica has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy coconuts & bananas.

Monica has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Monica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four sacks of potatoes, twenty crates of soda, and ten crates of beer.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is 40 years old and has two children, aged 15 and 9. He is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 11 years now.

His average income from doing his business is PhP 10,000 per month. He utilizes his income to provide his family with their basic needs. Receiving a loan would help him buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Joel hopes to manage a bigger farm and be able to send both his children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo, 46 years old, is a married man from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He has 3 children. He is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 15  years now.

His average income from doing his business is PhP 13,000 per month. He utilizes his income to provide his family with their basic needs. Receiving a loan would help him buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Nilo hopes to be able to send all his children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Edito

texts.en:
Edito is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with 3 children. 

Edito has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts.  He  had this business for 5 years.  He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy green bananas & coconuts for copra.

Edito has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Edito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy green bananas & coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hens and 30 sacks of chicken feed and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth, sewing thread and cotton threads for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 48 years old and is a married man with 5 children. The oldest child is 24 while the youngest is 13. 

Noel is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato.  He has been growing rice for 16 years. Noel earns about 13,000 PHP per month doing this farming. He works hard to support his family and send his children to school.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  In the future, Noel hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Necitas has a retail shop that sells biscuits, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Necitas is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Necitas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto, age 58, lives with his wife in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is a farmer and tills his own land. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Norberto works hard to support his family and to improve their living conditions.

Norberto will use his loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. He is confident that this loan will help increase his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for planting and also to buy a cow in order to support her in the farm field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Emelinda has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emelinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emelinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Pio

texts.en:
Pio is 52 years old and is a married man from the town of Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. He has four children. He is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 22 years now.

Pio utilizes his income to provide his family with their basic needs. Receiving a loan would help him buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. Pio hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest. He hopes to continue supporting his family financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Jessilyn

texts.en:
Jessilyn is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Jessilyn has a retail shop that sells "hypo" (cleansing agent). She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making hypo.

Jessilyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jessilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making "hypo" (cleansing agent).

loans.name: Romelita

texts.en:
Romelita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Romelita has a retail shop that sells rugs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for rug making.

Romelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Romelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for rug making.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Hing, 25 year old, is a factory worker in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a security guard in Takeo province, and their income is $5.50 per day. They have one child who is two years old. 

Every month, Hing has to spend $25 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh City so that he can stay with her and also make more income. Hing also plans to sell vegetables, having her husband transport them from the province to sell in the city to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is age 33 and married with four school-age children who all attend school. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years in his hometown in western Kenya. His mixed farm produces sugarcane, nappier grass and bananas which he sells locally. He is also a businessman.

With this loan of 40,000 KES, he intends to purchase and insure a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood. 

He faces the challenges of insufficient animal feeds and fluctuating weather conditions which affects his production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 31-year-old businesswoman.  She is married and has no children.   In 2000, the borrower   established her business selling  Maggi cubes, cooking oil, canned tomato sauce, rice, and sugar. She began her business because she  started to help her mother in the market and her mother  encouraged her to start selling  for herself. 

Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. The borrower requires a loan in order to improve her  business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, she plans to improve herself and the income of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy  Maggi cubes, cooking oil, canned tomato sauce, rice, and sugar for her business inventory.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a married man from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He has nine children. His youngest  child is 12 years old.

Roberto is a farmer and tills his own load. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns about 13,000 PHP per month from farming. Roberto utilizes his income to provide his family with their basic needs. Receiving a loan would help him buy farm supplies he needs like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Roberto hopes to uplift his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a tailoring business for the past five years, selling in a shop and from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other tailors in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase four rolls of cotton and repair her sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase four rolls of cotton and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase twenty plates, cooking pots, three bags of beans and four bags of maize. She decided to join Yehu to access loans because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase twenty plates, cooking pots, three bags of beans and four bags of maize.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, age 48, owns and operates a retail shop that sells "ukay-ukay" (used clothing). She has had this business for five years. She is widowed and has three children.

Anita has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy new stocks of used clothing. She is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of "ukay-ukay" (used clothing)

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak is a 29-year-old, married woman who works as a salaried masseuse for a hotel in Siem Reap Province. She has another financial earner in her husband who has been planting crops on his fertile farm. This couple has three school-aged children. 

In order to address increasing expenses, Mrs. Prak’s husband wants to run a motor taxi service for additional income. Mrs. Prak hopes to encourage her husband with this, but she has no cash to make that possible. So she would like to request a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to begin a taxi service business.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to begin a taxi service business

loans.name: Aliakbar

texts.ru: Алиакбар проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он более 6 лет занимается животноводством и одновременно растениеводством. Он покупает несколько голов бычков, откармливает и продает по более выгодной цене. Еще он сеет пшеницу, дыню и арбуз. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить количество скот и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Aliakbar lives in the A. Jomi region. He's twenty-nine years old, married and has two children. His wife takes care of their home. Aliakbar raises animals and crops for a living: He buys a couple bulls, fattens and then sells them with profit. He also grows wheat, melons and watermelons. Aliakbar has been in this business for six years and he's requesting a loan in order to acquire some more cattle, increase his herd and profits.

loans.use: to purchase large cattle

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang, age 36, raises pigs, earning an income of $2.30 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $40 on other necessary expenses. Sang resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products.

Sang is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. This will be her sixth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, age 32, owns and operates a food shop where she makes and sells taho. She has had this business for four years. She and her husband have two children.

She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy the raw ingredients for making taho. 

Nancy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients for making taho

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Joséphine est  salariée, né au Rwanda. Elle est veuve, âge de  49 ans, Elle a 4 enfants entre 15 ans et 28 ans, tous 4 enfants vont  à l’école,  elle n’a aucune personne en charge. Elle  a le niveau des études universitaire de licence en Science économique. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des peintures, des portes, les frais d’installation électriques   et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son affaire est d’agrandir sa maison pour augmenter sa valeur en vue de gagner les frais de location plus élevé. Sa vision est de construire d’autres  maisons. Pour sa famille, elle voudrait assure l’éducation de ses enfants et payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille. Elle fait aussi les études des projets.
texts.en:
Joséphine is salaried and was born in Rwanda. She is a widow and 49 years old. She has four children, aged 15 to 28 years of age, and all four go to school. She has no dependents. She has a university education in economics. This loan cycle is her second one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy some paint and gates or doors and to pay for electrical work, as well as labor. She expects no problems at all repaying her loan. 

Her strategy for business growth is to expand her house in order to increase its value with the aim of earning higher rent income. Her vision is to build other houses. For her family, she would like to ensure her children’s education and to cover the medical costs for her family. She also does planning.

loans.use: to buy paint and doors, and to cover the cost of electrical installations and of labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sewing thread and 50 cords for looms for embroidery business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 30 years old and single. He is a farmer and tills his own land located in Banga, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice for 4 years. He earns about 4000 PHP per month from doing this farming. Joan also raises chickens to sell.

Joan has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase seeds, fertilizers and farm equipment. He hopes for his business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and farm equipment.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 38, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Channy is employed at a factory, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

Channy is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for family use. This will be her sixth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more slippers and sandals for her business.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy has a mixed farm in his hometown in western Kenya that produces bananas, maize, sugarcane and nappier grass which are sold locally. He has been in the farming business for 13 years now and employs 3 farmhands. He earns additional income from his business of selling eggs to the local market.

Kennedy has made a loan request of 45,000 Kes in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that this loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The profits from this loan will be used to pay school fees for his children.

Kennedy is 41 years old and married with 3 children, aged between 3 and 8.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans has operated a barber shop business for the past five years. His potential customers are neighbors and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business: the number of customers visit his barber shop decreases during the rainy season. He dreams of establishing another barber shop in the future. 

Evans is unmarried and lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase four cartons of powder and two machines used in hair cutting. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase four cartons of powder and two machines used in hair cutting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers for her family farm

loans.name: Maura

texts.en: Maura, a 47-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, she has operated a retail shop that sells rugs. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for rug-making. In the future, Maura hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for rug-making.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima, a 26-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has been raising pigs to earn a living for the past three years. A member of PMPC for three years, Fatima is requesting a loan to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 39-year-old married woman with three children ranging in age from 16 to 4 years old. She and her husband are both farmers who own the land upon which they grow rice. Josephine also raises pigs in their backyard.

To help fund their farm and piggery, she is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of fertilizers, one sack of pig feed, and other farm inputs. Josephine works hard to support her family and strives for them to be happy and healthy always.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of fertilizers, one sack of pig feeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old and a business man. He is married to Jane, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling second hand clothes in an open air market as his primary business and also does land farming with the support of his wife as his secondary business. He has been in the business for the past nine years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support family members.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Peter will use the loan to add more stock of second hand clothes, purchase farm manure and seedlings.

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to educate his children up to university level and live a comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: To add more stock of second hand clothes, purchase farm manure and seedlings

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells rugs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for making rugs. Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making rugs

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en: Sopha, 55, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sopha produces traditional cakes to sell, earning an income of $2.80 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband repairs old shoes, earning an income of $6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $32 on other necessary expenses. Sopha is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more ingredients to produce cakes. This will be her sixth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to produce cakes to sell

loans.name: Lennox

texts.en:
Lennox is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a shoe-selling business, selling in a shop and from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high transportation costs from other shoes sellers in the market. Lennox dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase shoe soles and leather materials for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase shoe soles and leather materials for sale

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Daisy has a retail shop that sells rugs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials for making rugs. Daisy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making rugs

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 54-year-old businessman. He is married to Rose, who is also a businesslady. They are blessed with 4 adult children. Amos has been running a hotel as his primary business with the support of the wife. He is also in quarry mining and has also employed a worker who offers motorcycle transport as his secondary businesses. He has been in the business for the past 16 years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous loans. Amos will use the loan to pay laborers to work in the quarry and add stock in his hotel, i.e. wheat flour, cooking oil and rice. 

With the anticipated profit from his businesses he intends to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business. His hope and dream is to purchase a piece of land, construct a permanent home, and relocate his family from an urban to a rural area.

loans.use: to pay laborers to work in the quarry and add stock in his hotel

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 54-year-old married woman from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice crops to sell. Judith does her best to support her family. She also wants to be able to sustain her children's education through the income they earn from the farm.

Judith has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She plans to use it to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is hopeful that this loan will help their farm immensely.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 38, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice-producing regions in Cambodia. Chantha is a sugarcane juice seller, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 20 USD on food and 24 USD on the other necessary expenses. 

Chantha is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a plot of farmland to improve her family farming. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Arlinda has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She also sells detergents. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell. Arlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. 

In the future, Arlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Sibia

texts.en:
Sibia is the married mother of four adult children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 14 years and employs three farmhands. Sibia produces maize, beans, and milk that she sells locally. She earns additional income from her poultry farm, shop, and posho mill (which grinds maize) in her town. Sibia's main business challenges are poor market prices of farm produce, unpredictable weather conditions, and diseases that affect her production. 

Sibia is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this project will be used to expand her farming activities and improve the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 56 years old and married with six children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past eight years, Emelia has operated a shop where she sells bread, biscuits, and beverages. 

Emelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy bread, biscuits, and snacks. In the future, Emelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, biscuits, and snacks

loans.name: Lonah Nyanduko

texts.en:
Lonah is 32 years old and married to Stephen. The couple has two children. Lonah has been farming for six years and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Lonah is requesting a loan to rent more land for farming. This will be her fourth loan with KADET. She has been a good client and has a good repayment record. Lonah will use the profits from her loan to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to rent land for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 38 years old and married with four children. Her youngest child is five and the oldest is 14.  Juvy is a farmer who helps her husband till their land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Their primary crop is rice. Juvy rents a stall at the market to sell their harvest and works hard to help improve her family’s living conditions. 

Juvy is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. This will help Juvy achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old and married. She supports six people in her family. For the past three years, Margaret has been a farmer who cultivates her own piece of land. She is hardworking, and only needs resources to attain her goals.

Margaret learned about KADET through outreach by KADET staff in her area and this will be her second loan. She is planning to buy farm inputs such as seed and fertilizer. With the profits she hopes to make from her loan, she intends to plant wheat on a larger piece of land and educate her children.

Margaret’s future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land and become a commercial farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seed and fertilzer

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 44 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

Jonah has a general store and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more products for her general store. 

Jonah became a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. She is 40 years old, married to James, and they have five school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. She will sell the crop locally and hopes to have a good harvest.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor and her husband have been spending their lifetime with cultivating rice on their existing farmland in Kompong Cham Province. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. Mrs. Nhor learned to do this from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. The family also raises a few pigs at home to generate extra profit. 

Mrs. Nhor and her husband have 2 single children who are studying in public school. Mrs. Nhor will be using the loan to buy 2 cows to assist her in plowing, as her current cows are getting old and don't support her in the field.

loans.use: to buy two cows to assist in plowing

loans.name: Lailyn

texts.en:
Lailyn is 38 years old and is married. She has a 14-year-old child.

Lailyn is engaged in farming. She helps her husband grow rice at their land. According to her, they have been growing rice for seven years now. Lailyn also does some hog-raising. Lailyn works hard to help grow their ventures. She also hopes for her child to have a bright future.

Lailyn will use her loan to purchase five sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Femme d’un transitaire et maman de 02 enfants, Ablavi est à son deuxième cycle. Elle vend depuis 2005 du charbon de bois et divers à HEDRZANAWOE après achat à l’intérieur du pays.
texts.en: The wife of a forwarding agent and mother of two children,  Ablavi is on her second loan. She has been selling charcoal and various items since 2005 in HEDRZANAWOE after buying the goods in the interior of the country.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. She is 38 years old. She and her husband John have five children who go to school.

Beatrice was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be her first loan, which she plans to use to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. She will sell the potatoes locally and hopes to have a good harvest.

In the future, Beatrice hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 40 years. He is 62 years old, and married to Eunice. He normally sells his produce in Ndunyu Njeru market, as he only practices small-scale farming.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a  chicken-cleaning machine and to renovate his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy newspapers and school supplies.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has worked in his quarry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years.

He is 46 years old and married to Ruth. They have five children who all go to school.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be Francis' third loan. He paid his previous loans, which he used to boost his quarry business, well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorbike and he will employ someone to operate it.

In the future, Francis hopes to mine stones on a larger scale and sell them in bigger towns, such as Naivasha. He also wants to try his hand at farming as Ndunyu Njeru is very favorable for farming.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to boost his income.

loans.name: Ma Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma Evelyn is 54 years old and married with one child. 

She is a farmer in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice to sell. She also sells clothes such as shirts and jeans to the people in her community. She works hard to support her family financially.

Ma Evelyn has requested a loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizer and more items to sell, such as shirts and jeans. She hopes to earn more money and improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fertilizera and items to sell, such as shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Mary is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 30 years. She employs 3 farmhands and sells her produce of bananas, vegetables and maize to the local market. She is married with 7 children, two of whom are currently attending school.

She has requested a loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her meet her family's basic needs. The fluctuating weather patterns and lack of stable market for farm produce have been her greatest challenges. She plans to acquire more dairy cows in future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has worked in his in quarry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eleven years.  He is 32 years old, married to Lucy and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy new tools which he will be using to extract stones.  He normally sells the stones locally.

In future, Patrick hopes to be extracting stones on a large scale and sell them in bigger towns like Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy more tools for extracting stones

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with 10 children. Gloria is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Gloria is a farmer and grows coconut plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase coconut seed for her plantation.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase coconut seed for plantation

loans.name: Mishael

texts.en:
Mishael is 31 years old and a hardworking and faithful businessman. He is married and the proud father of two children ages 2 and 5. For the past seven years, he has been using his lorry (truck) for garbage collection. He supplements his income from the salary he earns as a driver. He wants to be a successful business man in the future.

He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him on business management.  He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to open up a metal shop and to buy tires for his lorry.

loans.use: to open up a metal shop and to buy tires for his lorry

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya and is age 39. She has been in farming for 12 years producing milk, cabbages and tea and selling all these to the local market. She is married with three children who are all in school.

Winnie has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she hopes her income will improve with the new acquisition, in addition to her poultry, and make life better for the entire family. She says she hopes to be stable enough to acquire two more dairy cows and put up a dairy unit on her farm in the next five years.

Winnie says poor land ownership is the challenge in farming.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Otelia

texts.en:
Otelia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and candies, which she has run for five years. 

Otelia has requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more products to sell in her store.

Otelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Otelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candies and beverages.

loans.name: Ma Fe

texts.en:
Ma Fe is 43 years old and married with three children aged 7, 13 and 18. 

She is a farmer in the town of Banga, South Cotabato where she grows rice and raises pigs and ducks. She does all this to help provide for her family and pay for her children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and farm equipment. Ma Fe hopes to increase her income and be better able to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and farm equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 6 children. 

Rowena has a pigpen and sells pigs and piglets. She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy animal feed for her female hogs.

Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for female hogs

loans.name: Marcely

texts.en:
Marcely is 31 years old and married.  She has 2 children ages 8 and 3 years old . She has been into the business of raising hogs for 10 years. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells items like rice and noodles to the people in her community. 

Marcely has requested a loan to fund her businesses. She plans to use it to purchase pig feeds and more items to sell such as 2 sacks of rice, noodles and canned goods.  She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and more items to sell such as 2 sacks of rice, noodles and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. To earn a living, he operates a garbage collection business. He employs four people to assist him in the business.  His business is very competitive, but he is still able to retain his customers due to good service, and he thanks Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer-care skills.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy polythene bags and service his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags and service his vehicle

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim, 58, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice-producing regions in Cambodia. Kim is a housewife while her husband is a driver for a private company, earning an income of $3.50 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $18 on food and $24 on other necessary expenses. Kim is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Susanbar

texts.en: Susanbar is from the village of Saratak in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with four children – two daughters (twenty-nine and thirty-seven years old) and two sons (thirty-three and thirty-five years old).  Susanbar has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for thirty-nine years.  She supports her family with the proceeds of the family farm.  She dreams of saving enough money to help her grandchildren attend university.  Susanbar is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.  She expects her investment to increase the family income by twenty-five percent.  Susanbar enjoys living in Saratak as she is close to her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gakuwebwa Mono Womens Group

texts.en: Clothing sales has been Christine's business for the last decade. Ten years down the road in this kind of highly competitive business is not an easy accomplishment. The happily married mother of 6 says she has learned to take most challenges that come with her business philosophically. Hard work, determination and prayers have been her towers of strength. This business generates profits of 320,000 shillings per month. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more new clothes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more new clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Duraliza

texts.en:
Duraliza is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Duraliza has a shop that sells candies, biscuits, breads and canned goods. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy biscuits, snacks and beverages.

Duraliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Duraliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sineoun

texts.en: Sineoun, 32, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Sineoun is a housewife while her husband is a driver for a blacksmith, earning an income of $7 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $56 USD on food and $24 USD on the other necessary expenses. Sineoun is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase more supplements to improve her husband’s blacksmith business. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more supplements to improve the blacksmith business

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem is a 26-year-old, married woman who has been living in the province of Kompong Cham Province. She always uses her fertile land to plant a few kinds of crop following the rainy season and the dry season. She makes an average income of 1.25 USD a day. Her husband also works in a similar business and earns about 2 USD each day. They are blessed with 2 children, both of whom are still learning in school. 

The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Soem doesn’t yet have capital to use on her farm. So Soem is seeking a loan to use towards hiring a machine to plow her farmland and to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, peanut seed and cucumber seed for planting.

loans.use: to hire a machine to plow her farmland and to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, peanut seed and cucumber seed for planting

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eleven years.  He is 41 years old, married to Damaris and they have five school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his 4th loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.  He will sell his produce at the local market as he does small-scale farming.

In future, David hopes to become a successful farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Evangeline has a shop that sells foods like spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy spices & food seasonings.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices & food seasonings.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is a married man with nine children; one still attends school while eight are adults. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for family. 

For over ten years, he has operated a cow and goat selling business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry season he buys cattle at higher prices then sells at a lower price. 

With the Kshs 80,000 he wants to purchase three cows and seven goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase three cows and seven goats for resale.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the town of Artik.  Her current financial means are insufficient to make the necessary investments in her business.  Therefore she is working with microfinance loans.  Alvard is a hardworking honest person who has been raising livestock for the past three years.  She is also a trained nurse which was quite helpful raising her three sons (twenty-eight, thirty and thirty-two years old).  Alvard wants a loan to purchase additional livestock.  This investment should increase her income by twenty percent.  Alvard plans to use some of the proceeds to construct a new cattle shed.  She enjoys the nature of her town and living near her relatives.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with three children. They live in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Marilou and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice and corn crops to sell.

Marilou has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and one sack of corn seeds and pay for labor. She hopes to earn better and be able to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and one sack of corn seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
Mazera is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past eight years, Mazera has operated a business buying and selling cows and goats. His potential customers are butcher shop operators. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

Mazera decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.  With a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), he plans to purchase two cows and sacks of maize.

loans.use: To purchase two cows and sacks of maize.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with nine children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbors, passersby, and school-going children. Her other source of income is from selling farm products. Seasonality is a major challenge for her. Increases in product prices decrease the number of customers she has.

Amina decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With a loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she plans to purchase wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, cooking fat oil, and bathing soaps. She dreams of expanding her retail shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, cooking fat oil, and bathing soaps.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
For the last two years, Harrison has been operating a greengrocer's shop in Naivasha town. He is 45 years old. He and his wife Grace have seven children.

Harrison was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. This will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) in full and in good time. He plans to use his new loan to buy a dairy cow in order to increase his income by selling milk.

In the future, Harrison aspires to buy a transport vehicle.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his income by selling milk.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two children – a nineteen-year-old daughter and a twenty-year-old son.  She has a high school education and special training as a hairdresser.  Karine has been engaged in raising livestock and farming for the past twenty-one years.  She hopes to continue saving money to support her children’s higher education.  Karine would like a loan to expand the size and replace the doors of her cattle shed and also put in a concrete floor.  She expects these improvements to increase her income by ten percent.  Karine is pleased with the terms of microfinance, especially the on-time service.  She enjoys the nature of Isahakyan and the quiet village life.

loans.use: to repair and expand her cattle shed

loans.name: Nzembi

texts.en:
Nzembi is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Nzembi has operated a business selling cows at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Nzembi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she plans to purchase a cow for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for sale.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, in the province of South Cotabato, with her family. 

Nonita is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops and vegetables and sells her harvest at her town's market. Nonita also runs a small sari-sari store (convenience store) where she sells items such as detergent and shampoo. Nonita plans to use her loan to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs. Nonita hopes this loan will help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan has been selling fish in Naivasha town for the last six years. She is 50 years old. She and her husband Michael have four school-going children.

Joan was introduced to KADET LTD, by a friend, and this will be her third loan. She paid her previous loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) in full and in good time. She plans to use the new loan to buy more fish from other parts of Kenya to cater to the high demand. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business by opening a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more fish from other parts of Kenya to cater to the high demand.

loans.name: Odon

texts.en:
Odon is a 62-year-old married man. He and his wife Francita have 5 children. He is presently living at Bliss, Mahayag, in the province of Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. He is a retired police officer who earns extra income as a farmer.

Odon has been farming for more than ten years. He has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 3 months and has requested a loan for farm financing. In the future, he hopes that his farm will grow and produce more crops so that he can earn more than what he needs.

loans.use: Intended for farm financing

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has been in the mining industry for 23 years in Naivasha town. He is 39 years old. He and his wife Nancy are blessed with four school-going children.

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) in full and in good time. He plans to use the new loan amount to buy another extraction site and employ workers for manpower.

In the future, Julius hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy another extraction site and employ workers for manpower.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is married with 3 children. She is 37 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City.

Luz sells dried fish to earn a living and has engaged in this business for 5 years. She earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this type of work. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years and has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza has a shop that sells candies, snacks and beverages. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. She has had her business for three years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. Liza has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Chuo

texts.en: Mr. Chuo, 36 years old, lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh. He has a small kiosk where he sells Khmer noodles to his neighbors and other people in and around his community. He generates a profit about US $3 a day to help support his family’s expenses. Mr. Chuo was married but he is divorced from his wife and now lives with his mother, a homemaker, who controls the household and the cash flow. Mr. Chuo has four teenaged children, two of whom are employed in different jobs. Mr. Chuo will be using all of this requested loan money to purchase a pumping machine and to plant lotus.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine and to plant lotus.

loans.name: Waridi

texts.en:
Waridi is a married woman with five children. Four of the children attend school; one is still too young. Waridi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Waridi has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She also earns income from her farming business. A major challenge for her is delayed payments by customers who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

Waridi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With a loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she plans to purchase sacks of sugar, rice, beans, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, rice, beans, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en: Novelita, a 43-year-old married woman with one child, has been growing rice for six years and earns about 8000 PHP per month.  Novelita plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs, and in the future hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Mariamik

texts.en: Mariamik lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Saratak.  She is a widow with a twenty-four-year-old son.  Mariamik has a high school education and has been farming her land for the past forty-three years.  She dreams of saving enough money to remodel the family home.  She is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds.  With this investment Mariamik expects her income to increase by twenty-five percent.  She is thankful that microfinance services are available in her village.  Saratak is a beautiful place to live and Mariamik enjoys living close to her relatives.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
A married mother of five, Luisa is 62 years old and lives in Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, where she has been growing rice to earn a living for 20 years. She has also been an elected Barangay Councilor for more than nine years.

A member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative for almost two years, Luisa has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her rice field, and hopes to produce even more rice in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Naftaly

texts.en:
Naftaly, has operated his motorbike for transport in Olkalou town for the last three years. He also practices small-scale farming and he wants to plant potatoes as the weather conditions in Olkalou are favorable for that crop. He is 37 years old, married to Regina and they have one school-going child. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

In the future, Naftaly hopes to become a successful farmer in Olkalou town and operate a taxi which will boost his income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
Lovella is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Lovella has a food shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy raw ingredients for barbecue.

Lovella has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lovella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for barcbecue

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 11 years. He is 39 years old, married to Esther and they have three school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to lease land where he will plant potatoes during this planting season.  He will sell his produce in the local market.

In the future, Stephen hopes to buy his own piece of land and a lorry, which he will use to transport farm produce from other farmers to Nairobi.

loans.use: To lease land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over one year, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transporting goods from town to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to wholesale in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu because of its short loan lead time, transparency and effectiveness of loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee, 42 years old, is married and has two children, 2 and 20 years old. She also takes care of five children. Immaculee sells vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes and onions. Her business is well-organized and operates from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. Immaculee has 6 years of experience.

Immaculee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more vegetables. With this profit, she will reinvest in her business and will be able to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine, 30, has two children, aged three and six. The eldest child is in school, while the youngest isn't yet. Her husband sells chicken and she sells malt (sacked sorghum). She has been doing this business for over six years and she enjoys it. This business has given Ernestine enough profit to build her own family house. She needs a loan to buy more sorghum and hence make more profit, with which she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey, 41, is a farmer from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. He is single. He tills his own land where he grows rice crops. He earns about 25,000 PHP per harvest. Rey supports his family financially. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. He hopes to be able to help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child.

Bahati has operated a fried fish selling business for the past two years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby, such as school-going children. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Due to changes in high and low tides in the sea, she experiences changes in the supply of fish for resale. Bahati dreams of expanding her fish selling business to increase her profits.

With the 10,000 Kshs loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale and to expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia, 52, is married with six children and lives in Linconan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living, which she has been doing for five years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizer for her rice field.

Florencia has been member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes that she can financially support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, aged 30, is married to Kenneth, who sells milk. They are blessed with one child who is two years old. 

Nancy does dairy farming, which she has been doing for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES.40,000.  This is her fourth loan term with KADET LTD and has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy two dairy cows for milk production, which she will, in turn, sell.
Nancy intends to use the expected profits to furnish her new home and hopes to increase her farm productivity.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en: Verginia, 52 years old, is married to a bus driver. They were blessed with 3 children. She manage a plantation business. She has been in this business for almost 20 years. Her net income is 5,400 PHP, and she's asking a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase organic fertilizers for her vegetable plantation. She wants to thank Kiva lenders for their assistance in availing the loan and hopes lenders will continue to fund her loan requests in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers for her vegetable plantation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer in Litein area, South Rift Kenya. She has been in farming for 10 years and emloys one farmhand. Her farm produces milk and tea, which she sells to the local market. She  is married and has 2 children, one of whom is still schooling.

Mary has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. This, being her second loan, will be used to purchase a dairy cow. She says the venture in dairy farming has helped her. She is focusing on increasing the number of her dairy cows consistently over the years.

Mary points out that there is need to give farmers training all the time, since lack of knowledge seems to be their main undoing.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik lives with his mother, wife and three children. He works as an engineer-mechanic at the local factory. Since the salaries are very low, making it impossible to sustain a family, Andranik also keeps cattle, has a battery farm and a fishery. Andranik also has six walnut trees, giving him additional income against the walnut sale. 

To cover the education fees of his children, as well as the family's daily costs, Andranik needs to expand his agro-business. He has applied for this loan to buy seeds for sowing. Andranik is going to cultivate land.

loans.use: to pay for seeds.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, age 43, is married to Prisca who is a tailor. They are blessed with four children. He has been doing photography for nine years. This business earns him a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This is George's third loan from Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, and he has a good credit history. He will use the loan funds to buy picture frames and some music CDs and videos for sale. George intends to use the expected profits to buy piglets and venture into pig rearing and he hopes to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy picture frames, music CDs and videos

loans.name: Amavi Chantal

texts.fr: Mariée à un retraité et maman d’01 enfant, Amavi a commencé par vendre en 2000 les charbons de bois (un combustible très utilisé par les femmes africaines). Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin d’aider son mari retraité. Elle s’approvisionne à BASSAR et à KANTE et satisfait sa demande au marché de HEDZRANAWOE.
texts.en:
Married to a husband who is retired and the mother of one child, Amavi began to sell charcoal in 2000. (This is a fuel much used by African women.) 

This loan will allow her to bolster her business so as to help her retired husband. She buys her goods in BASSAR and in KANTE and satisfies her demand at the market of HEDZRANAWOE.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Metaksi

texts.en: Metaksi is from the town of Artik in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with a high school education.  Metaksi has been engaged in farming her land for the past twenty years.  She considers herself a hardworking, honest person.  In addition to supporting her family Metaksi helps her relatives with agricultural products from the family farm.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  Metaksi expects this investment to increase her income by ten percent.  She is generally pleased with the services and terms of microfinance.  Metaksi would like to continue growing her business.  She has lived her whole life in Artik near family and friends and also plans to retire there.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and is married, with seven children between the ages of 9 and 29 years. She sells vegetables, cooking oil, water, body lotion, etc. in her store. Her business is well-organized. She has one year of experience and she works from 6 A.M. until 10 P.M. every day. Josephine currently employs one person to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase a large quantity of vegetables, cooking oil, water, and body lotion to sell. With the profits, Josephine will reinvest in her business and will be able to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables, cooking oil, water, body lotion etc. for her store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 47 years old and married with 2 children. She is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 8,500 PHP per month from this activity. Rosemarie also raises pigs in her backyard and sells them at the market. She plans to use the requested loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Zikusooka Womens Group

texts.en:
56-year-old Zaituni believes the surest way not to fail in any business undertaking is to be determined to succeed. That has been this mother of 8's philosophy for the last 15 years as she goes about her clothing sales business in Lugazi. Her humility, confidence and the fact that she is always fresh as a daisy in dealing with her clients have been her winning stocks in trade. 

Zaituni has been succeeding by a long shot and she is hoping for more success in the near future. She says the inspiration to begin this business came from her dad. Prior to that, she was running a retail shop. On the side, Zaituni also does some small scale agriculture and tailoring. She says this business generates profits totaling 200,000 shillings per month. With the requested Kiva loan, she is going to purchase more clothing to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: Mirkul's Group

texts.en:
Mirkul, 37, is the leader of this group. Mirkul resides in a town called Karabalta with her husband and three children. She possesses good organizational skills and responsibility, and therefore has been engaged in several occupations at the same time. Together with her husband, she is employed at a local gas station. Her husband is an operator, while she is a cook. 

She has a big household with livestock and she yields and sells milk and milk products every morning. She earned initial capital of 2,500 soms while working in Russia. Now every month the business generates 5,200 soms. She says the success of her business is thanks to attention to detail, keeping everything under control and hard work. Mirkul always works incessantly to achieve her goals, one of which is receiving a loan from Kiva lenders. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond is 34 years old and is married. He has a 2-year-old child and two dependent relatives. He sells drugs for healthcare. His business is well-organized. Edmond has 5 years of experience and he employees 2 people to help him.

Edmond has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase larger quantities of medicines to sell. With the profits, Edmond will reinvest in his business and build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of medicine

loans.name: Raypan Group

texts.en:
Mercedes is married with 3 children. She is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. Mercedes is a farmer and she raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase feed for her hogs. 

Mercedes has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 4 years. Mercedes is the leader of this 4-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: The photograph shows Mrs. Thy in front of her wooden house, which is located in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. Mrs. Thy is able to make a daily revenue by working as a local farmer in the village. She has a life-partner in her husband who works in the construction field. This couple has given birth to 3 children: 2 are married and live separately, and the other is single and works as a domestic construction worker. Recently, Mrs. Thy's old house was ruined because of the heavy rains and some of parts of it broke. So Mrs. Thy has decided to borrow funds from Kiva to purchase wooden poles to reconstruct the parts which are broken.

loans.use: to purchase wooden poles to reconstruct the parts of her house which are broken

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph has practiced farming in Olkalou for the last 5 years. He is 56 years old, married to Regina and they have four children. Joseph was introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET, by one of the field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer which he will plant and sell in the Olkalou market. In the future, Joseph hopes to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira, 29, is the treasurer of this group. She chose to get involved in trading vegetables and fruits, and became quite successful despite the fact that she was younger than most of her colleagues. She has her own ideas of running and promoting the business. 

When in season, she purchases strawberries wholesale from her parents who grow them in a village called Kun Tuu, and she resells them to local grocery stores and bazaars. Gradually she added other vegetables like cucumbers, tomatoes and cabbage to her assortment. She calls it a family business because when her husband is free from his main job as a security officer, he provides the transportation for the goods. At present she has 2,500 soms in circulation and is requesting a loan in order to buy more berries and vegetables. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 29 years old and a mother of two children ages two and four. Her husband is a businessman. Alphonsine owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of items including rice, sorghum and beans. Alphonsine has been operating this business for the past three years and it is going well. This business has enabled her to feed, and meet the needs of, her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell and make more profits. She plans to save her profits for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell from her store.

loans.name: Servando

texts.en: Servando, 40 years old, is married and lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has 6 children. His oldest child is 21 years old while his youngest is 12. He is a fisherman and has been working in this business for 20 years. His average income is PHP 5,000 per month. Servando is requesting a loan to support his family's livelihood. The loan will help him buy fishnets and baits. In the future, Servando hopes to send his children to college. He believes also that through God’s provision, he will be able to raise his family well.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and bait

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 21 years. He is 40 years old, widowed and has three children whom he takes care of.
