He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer, which he will plant and sell in the Olkalou town market.

In the future, Simon hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming in Olkalou.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zuurakan's Group

texts.en: Zuurakan, 51, is a leader of this group. She is a widow and has three grown kids. She pursued a profession of a dentist after studying several years in medical school. She works shorter hours due to her age, so she has time for watching the household. Zuurakan owns several heads of livestock, which keeps her busy. All of her colleagues are sure in the success of Zuurakan, because she is brave to take risks and eager to work hard and face challenges. Zuurakan addresses Kiva lenders for receiving a loan in order to purchase additional heads of livestock and broaden the business. She thanks the lenders for assistance because it helps her financially and in staying confident about the future of her business. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en: Gegham lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the city of Gyumri.  He is married and the proud father of four children – a thirty-two-year-old daughter and three sons (sixteen, twenty-nine and thirty-three years old).  Gegham has a college education with a degree in agriculture and has been working in his field as a private entrepreneur for over twenty-two years.  He is looking for a loan to purchase additional livestock and fertilizer.  Gegham expects the family income to increase by twenty-five percent with the investment.  He would like to continuing growing his business as well as saving money for his youngest son’s college education.  Gegham also provides support to some of his relatives.  He is pleased with the services and terms of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizer

loans.name: Melarda

texts.en:
Melarda is a 36-year-old married woman. She lives in the community of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She has four children and her husband is a fisherman.

Melarda runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business. She also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community.

With the loan coming from Community Economic Ventures Inc. she will be able to buy ingredients for making rice cakes such as flour and sugar and more items to sell such as shampoo and soap.

In the future, Melarda  hopes to have a bigger store and more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making rice cakes such as flour and sugar and more items to sell such as shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is married with two children. Daisy is 40 years old and lives in Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag Zambo. Sur.
 
Daisy is a farmer and grows  rice in her field to earn a living, and aside from that she has also been a community official in Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag Zambo. Sur for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers.

Daisy has been a member of PAGLAUM-MPC for almost two years. In the future, Daisy hopes that someday she can give a better future to her family, specially her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Catching fish is the main part of 53-year-old Seng’s daily work. She and her husband have been operating in this business for over 8 years. This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market for daily income. Seng and her husband support their two single children who are enrolled in school, while their 4 other children are married and live in their own houses. Seng would like to request a loan to buy a new boat and nets because most of her fishing tools are cracked.

loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca Is 41 years old and supports a family of five members.  Her children are aged between twenty-four and eight years old.  She keeps livestock in her farm in Itigo and has been in operation for a period of ten years, earning a monthly income of ksh 10,000.

She has been given a loan from KADET of ksh.40,000, this being her third loan after she repaid her previous loans successfully.  She wishes to use the money to purchase one dairy cow and dairy feed. The profit earned  will be used to improve the livestock farm.

She dreams of being the leading entrepreneur in the area and creating job opportunities for others in her farm.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow and feed.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 43 years old, her spouse is David, and she supports a family of five members. Her children are are aged twenty, seventeen, fifteen, eleven and six years old.  She does dairy farming in Itigo and has been in the farm for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000.

She has taken out a loan of KES.60,000 from KADET, this being her second loan after she repaid the previous loan successfully. She hopes to use the loan to purchase dairy feed for the animals and improve the conditions of the farm.  The profits will be used to add more dairy cattle in the farm.

Her dream is to live a better life and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feed.

loans.name: Valya

texts.en: Valya is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children – two daughters (thirty-three and thirty-six) and a thirty-year-old son.  Valya has a high school education and has been working in agriculture and retail trade for thirty-five years.  She would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, livestock and inventory for her shop.  Valya expects her income to increase by twenty percent with the investment.  She is saving some of the additional income to support her children’s families and also to enlarge her shop.  She was pleased with the loan disbursement process of microfinance and the terms of the loans.  Valya was born in Isahakyan and really likes to be surrounded by nature and her friendly neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, livestock and shop inventory

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is married and is a mother of a ten-month-old baby. She is 27 years old. She sells second-hand clothes and she has done this business for the past six years. Her business is going on well and she is proud of that. 

Her business enables her to meet the needs of her family and buy a piece of land on which she plans to build a house. She is requesting  a loan to buy more second-hand clothes in order to make more profits. She plans to reinvest all the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is married with one child, and her child goes to school. She takes care of additional family members. Teddy sells charcoal at Ndeeba. She has been in business for the last two years and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more charcoal and build her own stall. She lives in a home that she rents and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ma. Bona

texts.en:
Ma. Bona is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives in the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a small carinderia (eatery). She cooks the food that she sells. Ma. Bona also buys and resells seaweeds.

Ma. Bona plans to use her loan to buy raw ingredients for cooking meals and more seaweeds to sell. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking meals and more seaweeds to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 25-year-old business lady, married to Benson. They are happily blessed with two children, ages nine and four years.  She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of about 80,000 KES (~$890) which she uses to support her family members and also as the working capital of the business.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. Caroline will use the loan to add more stock of sugar, flour, rice, etc. for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit she will educate her children up to university level. Her hopes and dreams are to open a mini-supermarket and improve the living standard of her family members.

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar, flour, rice, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is the mother of two children who are ages six and eight years old. Her husband sells goats, while Francoise owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of items which include soap, vaseline, salt, etc. She has been doing this business for eight years and it has brought joy to her life. It has enabled her to meet the needs of her family and she is so proud of that. 

She needs a loan to purchase more items such as cooking oil, maize flour, etc. in order to make more profits. Francoise plans to beautify her house with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last ten years.  He is 50 years-old, married to Jane and they have three children.  

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.  He normally sells his produce at the local market.

In the future, Gibson hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Newton

texts.en:
Newton, aged 22, is unmarried and lives with his younger sister. He practices farming, mainly dairy farming and poultry keeping, which he has been doing for two years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES. 8,700.

This is his first loan term with Kiva partner KADET LTD.  He will use the loan funds to buy a dairy cow for milk production which he will in turn sell to customers.

Newton intends to use the expected profits to buy 50 chicks so as to increase his egg supply.  He hopes to operate a large scale farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Malikahan's Group

texts.en:
Malikahan, 56, is the leader of this group. She has been a self-starter since early childhood. In this way she found the talent of sewing in herself. An unending interest in fabric and new ways of design pushed her to pursue a profession as a seamstress and a fashion designer. 

Since all of her kids are already grown and live separately, Malikahan says she can devote herself fully to the business. The entrepreneur designs bedding for traditional Kyrgyz families.  They include quilts called “kurpa”, “tushak” and pillows of different sizes and designs. She graduated from a technical college and knows how education is important in the development of a person. The business started with an initial capital of 500 soms and now brings 1,300 soms monthly. Malikahan applied for a loan because she needs to purchase materials for sewing national souvenirs. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 44 years-old. She has four children who are aged 7-15 years old. She is very hard working and her business is going well. 

She sells different kinds of food including beans and several types of flour.  She also sells other items such as soap and candles in the same store. This business enables her to meet the needs of her family and sustain her business as well. She is requesting a loan to buy more food in order to make more sales and therefore profit. She plans to pay school fees with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: to buy food stuff such as beans to sell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 70 years-old and has a dairy farm in Itigo.  She has been in operation for the past fifteen years and earns a monthly income of KES. 12,000.

She has borrowed a loan from Kiva partner KADET of KES. 60,000 this being her fifth term loan after paying her previous loans successfully.  She hopes to use the money to purchase one dairy cow and dairy feed.  The anticipated profit amount will be used to improve the dairy farm.

She hopes to excel in her dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and dairy feed.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 21 years.  He is 51 years-old, married to Elizabeth and they have five children.  

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.  He normally sells his produce in the local market.

In the future, Anthony hopes to become a successful farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: to buy  potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sherlina Group

texts.en:
Sherlina is married with four children. Sherlina is 49 years-old and lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban.

Sherlina sells a variety of products for household chores to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other household items.

Sherlina has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other household items.

loans.name: Makhmarizo

texts.en:
Makhmarizo is a hardworking man and he has worked cultivating water-melons for 15 years. Makhmarizo works hard in order to make a good profit which allows him to keep his family in good living conditions. He would like to get a loan of $1,000 US for purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuels and lubricants. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Humi

texts.en:
Humi is 50 years old and has three children. She has been working in the business of growing vegetables and renting properties for over four years. Humi makes around 5,000 Kenyan shillings a month. She plans to use her loan to finish a house that she plans on renting out. Humi will use her profits to keep expanding her business. 

This is Humi's second loan with KADET. She has been a good client who repaid her loan well. In the future, Humi plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to finish her rental home.

loans.name: Salama Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bahati, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Salama»,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 45 ans, veuve, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient, parmi les quels, il y a des infirmiers et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle est vendeuse des ognons et ails. Bientôt 8 ans passé que son mari fut lâchement décédé suite à une courte maladie. Elle étale ses marchandises au centre commercial agricole de Birere, dans un entrepôt public. Il y a 16 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 sacs d’ognons, 2 sacs d’ails.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une seconde maison pour ses enfants orphelins. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Salama» est composé de 15 clientes.Cependant, leur collègue d’affaire a souhaité participer à la photo du groupe. D’où 16 figures visibles.
texts.en:
The customer Bahati, who is the representative for the business group "Salama", is an entrepreneur. She is 45 years old, a widow, and a mother of six. All her children attend or have attended school; some are nurses and others have their own families now.
She sells onions and garlic. Her husband sadly passed away eight years ago after a short illness. She displays her wares at the Birere agricultural sales center, in a public warehouse. She has been in this business for over 16 years. Moreover, she just went through six cycles with Hekima loans. This new loan will be used to procure two bags of onions and two bags of garlic. In addition, she ambitions to keep her children in school and to build a house for her orphaned children.
The customer thanks Hekima for its action in favor of underprivileged women excluded from traditional banking. It is worth mentioning that the "Salama" business group is composed of 15 customers, but that since their business partner wished to be part of the group picture, 16 people are visible on the photo.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of onions and two bags of garlic.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 42 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s married with three children aged 4 to 23; only two live at home, and all attend school. For the last four years, she has been selling children's clothes, men's clothes, women's clothes, etc.

Dorris has requested this loan to purchase more used clothes for adults and children. She says her problem is low inventory in the business. She started this business by helping her mother, so from that point on, she learned it. It makes her proud because it helps her to send her children to school. In the future, she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for adults and children.

loans.name: Jumagul's Group

texts.en:
Jumagul, 40 years-old, is the leader of this group. The spirit of enterprise is sparked by small business people with big ideas- people like Jumagul , who grew-up in a small town of Aravan in the South of Kyrgyzstan. 

Mol Bulak Finance, a field partner of Kiva in Kyrgyzstan, describes such women as a basic foundation for building a steady nation. Jumagul is currently the most successful entrepreneur in the area. Her small business specializes in cattle market and dairy products. At the moment she handles the reselling of at least twenty heads of cattle monthly and generates 2,000 soms. The story of Jumagul started in 1991, after the collapse of the Soviet Union. She saved just enough to purchasing sheep. Gradually she broadened the household and her business prospered. The distribution of her milk products additionally brings 3,750 soms monthly. 

Jumagul would like to use the loan from Kiva to purchase additional sheep because they have high demand. Jumagul has many plans and wishes for the future including providing an education for her children, finishing the construction of her house and the purchase of an automobile. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Nasibsho

texts.en:
Nasibsho is married and the father of five children. He is a singer and plays with a music keyboard. He works at national traditional wedding parties and other events in his region. He has many orders for different events. Each music depends on different occasions and keeps good memories. That’s why he tries to make happy his clients for a minute in order to give them good memories for many years. For this purpose Nasibsho has requested a loan of 3000$ USD for the purchase of a musical instrument KORG PA1XPRO (clavier/keyboard). 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a musical instrument KORG PA1XPRO (keyboard).

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, five of whom are in school. She does not take care of additional family members. Christine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include her children's school fees and rent

Christine has a restaurant business. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Christine sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Christine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more food items for her restaurant, such as bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and sweet potatoes. She explains that one of her major business challenges relates to transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow large so that she would own a fully stocked restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Santalat's Group

texts.en:
Santalat, 55 years old, is the treasurer of this group. The entrepreneur resides in Aravan, a small but cozy southern town situated on Silk Road. The town is a melting pot of people of various occupations such as farmers, cattle breeders, carpenters and ceramic masters. Santalat was born, got married and raised three children in this blessed place. It is a Kyrgyz wedding tradition for gifts to be made to both a bride and a groom. Santalat, according to custom, received a young colt. Over time, by re-selling already grown horses, she was able to generate capital to purchase her very first sheep and a dairy cow. She increased the number of cattle to four sheep and two cows. Every morning Santalat yields several liters of milk, which she uses to make various milk products. Her cattle breeding business was started with initial capital in the amount of 3 000 soms, while a monthly profit is typically 2 500 soms. Meanwhile, her husband’s monthly income from driving a cab is 3 000 soms. Santalat believes that  a constant flow of income into her family's budget will allow her to repay the loan, which she requests so that she can purchase a refrigerator. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen is 51 years old, and she is a married mother of 6 children. Four of her children are currently attending school. She has a mixed farm in Kisii town that produces bananas, maize and vegetables. She has been in the farming business for 15 years now and employs 2 farmhands. She sells all her farm produce at the local market. She earns additional income from her shop in the same location.

She has made a loan request of 45,000 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the proceeds that will be generated from the sale of milk will help improve her family's livelihood. She faces the challenges of insufficient capital (to expand her business) and an unstable market (to sell her farm produce). She plans to buy a motorcycle in the future to assist her in transporting her farm produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members: a brother and a sister. Prossy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and her children's school fees.

Prossy has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Prossy sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Prossy has requested a loan in the amount of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cream relaxers, braids and weaves. The main business challenges for Prossy include seasonality, thieves and ever-increasing prices of creams. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of braids, cream relaxers and weaves

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). Asiya lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Asiya has a retail shop business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Asiya sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Asiya has requested a loan in the amount of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more items for her shop, including bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. One of her main business challenges is transportation. Her business goal and aspiration is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline  is 44 years old and has two children, 13 and 16 years old. They are all in school and living happily. Jacqueline's husband is a driver. Jacqueline has owned a restaurant for the past year, selling different African dishes. The business enables her to meet her family's needs. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs and to make more profits. Jacqueline plans to reinvest the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Syvia

texts.en: Syvia lives in  Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (a brother).  Syvia has operated a retail shop for 4 years, and she works 7 days every week. Syvia has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to add stock to her business. The main business challenges for Syvia include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land. Syvia lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sugar, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Shora

texts.en: Shora is a 29-year-old single woman with three children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Shora has been in the clothing business for seven years, having started with 200,000 UGX and now having 5,000,000 UGX. Her hardship is high taxes. Her goals are to have a an improved clothing shop in the form of a boutique and a well sustained family. Shora intends to use the loan to purchase clothes to sell at her shop.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 32 years old, married and supports a family of four. He has been in the farming business for the last ten years, with a monthly income of KES 5,000. With his fifth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, he plans to purchase farm supplies for his family farm. This will help in timely land preparation. Nicholas' future plans are to continue with farming and improve his family's living standards economically.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She takes care of other additional family members (a sister) . Mariam has been selling charcoal in the Ndeeba market for the last ten years, and she works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she wants to use to buy more bags of charcoal.

Mariam sells to all categories of people but at wholesale only. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season. Mariam doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She hopes to see her business grow big so that she can get enough profits to buy a delivery van and educate her children up to university. Mariam lives in two rented rooms where the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food for the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Vanancie

texts.en: Vanancie  is 36 years old and the mother of three children who are aged 6 months to 7 years old. Her husband is a driver. Vanancie owns a shop in which she sells several items such as rice, Irish potatoes, cassava flour, beans, biscuits and soap. She has owned the shop for five years and it has enabled her to educate her children and to feed them as well. She needs a loan to buy foodstuffs and make more profits. Vanancie plans to save the profits until she can build her own family house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Phanahasi

texts.en:
Phanahasi is a 37-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Kasese, in the western part of Uganda. Phanahasi has been in agriculture for twenty years, having started with 50 stems of bananas and now having 200 stems of bananas. He does commercial farming, selling his bananas from the plantation.

Phanahasi's hardships are price fluctuations, limited capital and thieves. His goals are to have a model banana plantation and an educated family. Phanahasi says the intention of having the loan is to enable him to buy manure and mulch and to pay for labor for his plantation so as to realize better banana yields for selling.

loans.use: To buy manure and mulch and to pay for labor for his plantation.

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is 34 years old, married, and blessed with three children. His spouse is Pamela and she owns a salon.  For the last four years he has been doing dairy farming in an Itigo location and earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

He has been given a loan from KADET as his first loan and hopes to purchase a dairy cow.  The anticipated profits will be used to educate his children and improve the farm.

He hopes to improve the welfare of his family and own a large dairy farm.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. Harriet has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. She has no other income and sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Harriet has requested for  a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. The main business challenge for Harriet is transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her business. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is 50 years old and lives in Paynesville. He is married, with 2 children aged 12 and 14, who live at home and attend school. For the last 4 years, Anthony has been selling provisions, drinks, rice, soft drinks, oil, etc.  Anthony has requested this loan to purchase more goods. His major problem  is transportation. Anthony started this business by doing the table market. He has generated more money and has built two houses. In the future, Anthony plans to open two shops and send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as rice, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and to renovate his hotel

loans.name: Jael

texts.en: Jael is a 30-year-old single woman with two children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Jael has been in the salon business for ten years. She dreams of having a high class salon and educating her children. As a single mother, she says it is always a difficult task bringing up the children alone. However, through her hard work, Jael feels that she can make it. She intends to use the loan facility to buy cosmetics for her salon business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last twelve years.  He is 37 years old, married to Esther and they have two school-going children.  

Ezekiel was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals and to pay for labor.

In the future, Ezekiel hopes to become a successful farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer & spraying chemicals and pay for labour

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school.Amina has a business selling scraps.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and works 6 days out of every week. Amina sells her products in a shop by means of retail. Amina has requested  for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more scraps.  The main business challenge for Amina is seasonality.  Her goal and aspiration is to build her own house. Amina lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of scraps

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 35-year-old single mother with one child who is in secondary school.  She has been in business for ten years and makes a monthly income of 6,000 KES. Pauline will use this loan to purchase beauty products for her business. She plans to save the profits from her business to pay for her son’s education. 

This is Pauline's first loan with KADET. She hopes to develop and expand her salon to become more modern. She also hopes to continue paying for her son’s education and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard sells fruit and vegetables at one of the most popular city markets. She is renting her stall. Summer and autumn are busy seasons for fruits and vegetables. With many delicious fruits coming up, there is a big demand from customers who not only eat the fruit, but also make preserves for winter. 

Nvard has applied for this loan to be able to increase her stock and variety to meet demand and make additional profit. This is an important season for fruit and veggie retailers. The income from Nvard’s business is the main income for the family of three – Nvard’s husband, an engineer, and her daughter, a student.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to stock.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a twenty-seven-year-old single mother with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been offering secretarial services for three years, a business which she started with 1,000,000 shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings. Her hardships are debtors and high rent. Her vision is to become a big supplier of stationery supplies and secretarial services in her area, and to educate her children.  Florence intends to use this loan to buy a computer, photocopying papers, pens and envelopes for her secretarial shop.

loans.use: buy a computer and office supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: L’emprunteuse exerce depuis 2008 un commerce d’encens, d’habits, de chaussures et de colliers. Elle s’approvisionnait au marché d'une grande ville de la sous - région . Elle  revendait ses produits dans sa ville, pas loin de la capitale. Elle avait implanté un kiosque devant son domicile mais les inondations dues aux fortes pluies intervenues en 2010 ont détruit son stock et endommagé le kiosque. Cette période a  aussi coïncidé avec la maladie de sa mère  dont elle a supporté seule les frais d’hospitalisation. Les lourdes dépenses occasionnées par ces deux événements ont malheureusement provoqué la faillite de son commerce. Ceci l’a plongé dans d’énormes difficultés car elle ne pouvait plus subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux  de ses trois enfants (alimentation, frais scolaires et sanitaires) en l’absence de son mari. Pour relancer son commerce et faire face à ses difficultés, elle ouvre un compte à l’IMCEC et commence à constituer petit à petit une épargne. Ainsi, elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de 50 000FCFA pour l’achat de 2 seaux d’encens, de 20 colliers, de 20 pairs de chaussures et de 20 robes. Les bénéfices tirés de cette première opération lui permettront de diversifier ses produits, d’améliorer la situation alimentaire de ses trois enfants et  de régler certains frais de scolarité.  L’emprunteuse ambitionne dans le future de louer un magasin au marché central de sa ville pour y installer une boutique de vente d’encens et de produits vestimentaires
texts.en:
This borrower has been selling incense, clothing, shoes and necklaces since 2008. She used to get her merchandise at a big city market of the sub-region. She would resell her products in her own town, not far from the capital. She had a kiosk set up in front of her house, but the floods caused by the torrential rains that occurred in 2010 destroyed her stock and damaged her kiosk. 

During that time, she also had to pay the hospital costs for her mother who was very ill. The heavy financial burden resulting from these two events led to the bankruptcy of her business. Faced with enormous difficulties, she became unable to support herself and her three children (food, tuition fees, and healthcare) with her husband being absent. In order to restart her business and deal with the hurdles, she opened an account with IMCEC to start accumulating savings. 

She is now seeking a loan of 50,000 FCFA to buy two buckets of incense, 20 necklaces, 20 pairs of shoes, and 20 dresses. The profits from this first operation will enable her to diversify her merchandise, improve her children’s nutrition and settle some of the tuition fees. 

In the future, she wants to lease some space at the central market of her town to set up a shop where she will sell incense and clothing.

loans.use: to buy incense, necklaces, earrings, clothing and shoes in Dakar for resale in Mbour

loans.name: Joeria

texts.en:
Joweria lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school.  Joweria has a food stall business.  She has been in this business for 8 years and works 7 days out of every week. Joweria sells her products at the market by means of retail.    

Joweria has requested  for a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more items for her stall such as a basket of tomatoes, onions, pawpaws and oranges. The main business challenge for Joweria is transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to start selling on wholesale only .  

Joweria lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 27 years old, married, and has three children aged between six months and seven years old. She has been in the business of cooking chips and other foods for three years. Hellen makes 10,000 KES a month. 

This is her first loan with KADET which she plans to use to buy more stock such as flour, cooking fat, and potatoes. She hopes to use the profit from her business to expand her business and improve her family’s living standards. 

In the future, she hopes to open a big restaurant. She dreams of buying her own land so she can build a house where she can settle with her family.

loans.use: to buy more flour, cooking fat, and potatoes

loans.name: Asalgul

texts.en:
Asalgul runs a small clothing sales business in the central market of Kumsangir. She launched this business 7 years ago and has gained much  experience. Asalgul is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni to purchase seasonal inventory in order to increase her sales. She is hoping to see long-term consistent development of her venture. Asalgul used to work as a salesperson and realized how profitable this trade was. She is happy to be self-employed today, to make a profit and to generate enough savings to afford to buy her own separate (single-family) housing some day.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Lasiti

texts.en:
Lasiti is 52 years old. He is married and has seven children.  He is a farmer and has been farming on his own piece of land for the last eleven years.

Lasiti learned about KADET through marketing done by KADET staff. This will be his second loan.  He is planning to use the funds to buy farm inputs and hire machinery to prepare the land. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His dream is to buy a bigger piece of land in the future where he can plant more wheat for commercial sales, to buy his own farm machinery, and to educate his children.

Lasiti is a hardworking man who is focused to his set goals.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and hire machinery to prepare the land

loans.name: Colette

texts.en:
Colette is 30 years old.  She has three children who are between 6 and 9 years old. Her husband is a businessman. Colette owns a general store in which she sells different items such as powdered milk, sugar and soft drinks, etc. She has been running this business for the past three years. 

Colette is requesting a loan to buy more items such as sugar and a refrigerator in which to keep soft drinks.  With the profits generated, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator and stock for her store

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  is married and has five children.  All her children go to school. Annet has a business selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for five years. 

Annet has requested a loan of 200000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes and shoes. She works at the market and sells on a retail basis. She works six days a week and sells to all categories of people.   Her business challenges include transporting bales of clothes from Owino market to her stall in Kawala, defaulters, and the rainy season as she works from an open place. 

Annet is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she can start selling wholesale only, and to buy a plot of land. Annet lives in a home that she owns.  Her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more water and slippers.

loans.name: Parshami

texts.en:
Parshami is 53 years old .He is married and supports eight people.

He has been farming for the last 15 years. His farm is in a productive area that supports mixed farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, and he is planning to buy farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises and to buy livestock that he can sell to generate other income.

He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nasil

texts.en: Nasil has two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a restaurant in which she sells different kinds of foodstuffs. She has done this for three months. She has used the income to feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy plates, saucepans, and charcoal stoves. With the profits she plans to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase utensils.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 34 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom attend school.  They live in Paynesville. Her husband is a driver. For the past two years, she been selling fried fish and sausage, which she learned to do from her mother.  Her favorite part of being in this business is the compliments from her customers regarding how she prepares her food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, fish, and sausage. Gloria says in the future she would like to have her own cool storage.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, fish, and sausage.

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.en: Nasibakhon is divorced and has two children. She works hard to be able to provide for her family and pay all the bills. Nasibakhon runs a small business, selling fabrics for sewing women's national dresses in the central market of Tursunzade. She has been in the trade for over 13 years. Nasibakhon is hoping to use the loan of 6,000 Somoni to purchase better-quality merchandise at wholesale prices, which would help her increase proceeds from sales. The profit generated by the loan would help her continue saving for her own housing, which has been Nasibakhon’s dream for many years. loans.use: to buy seasonal fabrics.

loans.name: Muteleu

texts.en:
Muteleu  is 35 years old. He is married and supports four people in the family. He is a farmer and he does maize farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last four years.

He learned about KADET through another registered client. He has been a good client and this will be his third loan which he is planning to use to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, seeds and farming tools. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming and also to pay school fees for his children.

His dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a conscientious man who is determined to achieve his set goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, seeds and farming tools

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлане 51 год, замужем и проживает с мужем, средним сыном и снохой. Мать троих детей (три сына) - старший сын женат и живет отдельно, младший сын проживает и учится в Бишкеке (столица Кыргызстана).
Светлана родилась в многодетной и простой (5 детей) семье скотника. Она была младшей дочерью. По окончании школы Светлана поступила в техникум по специальности библиотекарь в городе Токмок (Чуйская область, Кыргызская Республика). Отучившись, Светлана приехала в родное село и начала работать в местной библиотеке, но в связи с трудным материальным положением, она устроилась в местном колхозе дояркой. Там же и работал ее будущий муж водителем грузового авто. Познакомились они в 1983 году и в этом же году поженились,  а год спустя у них родился первый сын. Так как муж Светланы младший сын в семье, он (согласно  традиционным кыргызским обычаям) остается с родителями. В 1987 году и 1989 году у семьи Онобасовых рождаются еще два мальчика. В первое время им было с мужем тяжело - с распадом колхоза Светлана и Сыязбек остаются без работы и решают начать свой бизнес: на выделенные ранее колхозом земле, они выращивают зерновые культуры и на прибыль, вырученную от продажи урожая,  приобретают скот. Сейчас в хозяйстве Светланы имеется три коровы, пять бычков, четыре телочки и  три лошади. Так как за последние годы у Светланы было много расходов, связанных с женитьбой старших сыновей и оплаты обучения младшего сына в университете, она обратилась за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дойной коровы. В планах Светланы – дальнейшее  увеличение поголовья скота и развитие бизнеса. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Svetlana is 51 years old, she is married and lives with her husband, middle son and her daughter-in-law. She is a mother of three sons - her oldest son is married and lives separately, her youngest son lives and studies in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan).

Svetlana was born in a large family of a cattleman with five children. She is the youngest daughter. After graduating from school Svetlana enrolled in a technical school in the town of Tokmok in they Chuysk province of the Kyrgyz Republic to become a librarian. After she finished her studies Svetlana came back to her home village and began working in the local library, but because of the financial hardship she also got a job in the local farm as a milkmaid. Her future husband was also working there as a small truck driver. They met in 1983 and had married in the same year and a year later their first son was born. Because Svetalana's husband was youngest son in their family, according to the Kyrgyz tradition he is supposed to stay with his parents.

In 1987 and 1989 in the Onobasov family two more boys were born. In the beginning it was very hard for Svetlana and her husband - because of the collapse of the farm she and Siyazbek were left without jobs and decided to start their own business. They used the plot of land which was given to them earlier by the farm to grow cereals and used the profit gained from the sale of the harvest to buy cattle. Right now in Svetlana's household there are three cows, five male and four female calves, and three horses. During the past several years Svetlana had many expenses which had to do with the weddings of her older sons and tuition fees for her youngest son's education in the university, so she has come to ask for a loan in the amount of 40,000 soms (KGS) to buy a milk cow. Svetlana plans to further increase the headcount of the cattle and developing her business.


About Bai-Tushum and Partners:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas which leads to job creation and serves the interests of its borrowers and lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and three children in their home. After purchasing his cattle, Rustam provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, Rustam sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale. Currently he wants to purchase more cattle and for this reason he is turning to IMON International to obtain a loan of 5000 Somoni. Rustam thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Lesinko

texts.en:
Lesinko is 24 years old and single. He supports his parents. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the past three years.

He learned about KADET from other men in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend to buy farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent home and expand his farming activity.

His dream is construct rental houses and educate his children in order to have a better future. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Posian

texts.en: Posian is a 25-year-old married man with one child aged 8 months. Posian rents a house and lives with two people in Hoima town in Uganda. For three years now, Posian has been a teacher and from that, he says he has been able to develop and educate his siblings. He says he likes what he does as a teacher. Posian is in need of a loan facility to pay tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Lemondoi

texts.en:
Lemondoi is 44. He is married and has seven children.

He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to settle the loan and expand his farming. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build rental houses.

He is a painstaking man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.en:
Mahmadali is a taxi driver from the city of Tursunzade, Tajikistan. He has been working as a driver for many years. About seven years ago he decided to become self-employed and started working as a taxi driver. 

Mahmadali is married and has three children. His taxi business is the main source of income for his family. Mahmadali has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni to help take care of some repairs to his taxi. We are happy for this opportunity to support him in his business and help keep him on the road making a living.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for thorough repair of his car.

loans.name: Parmusenke

texts.en:
Parmusenke is 53 years old. He is married and blessed with ten children. He  is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twenty years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. He has been a good client and this will be his third loan which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming. He is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil.

loans.name: Kulankash

texts.en:
Kulankash is 32 years old. He is married and supports three people in the family. He is a farmer and he does farming on his piece of land which he has been doing for the last ten years. 

He learned about KADET from KADET staff. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the family's living standards and for farming expansion.

His dream is to prosper in the farming and educate his kids. He does struggle to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel operates an electronic shops selling mobile phones and does repair.

He has been operating this business for the last five years with a monthly income of KES 5000. He was introduced to KADET by KADET staff.

This is his first loan of KES.40,000 which he plans to use to buy more stock, i.e., batteries and plugs. He hopes to make profit and re-invest into the business.

He is a hard-working man who struggles to achieve more.

loans.use: to buy more stock, i.e., batteries and plugs.

loans.name: Saruni

texts.en:
Saruni is 23 years old. He is single and supports four people. He is an animal trader and does also  farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last two years.

He learned about KADET through posters. This will be his first loan and he is planning to buy farm inputs and hire machinery to prepare the land. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to favorable climatic conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land so he can plant more wheat for commercial farming and buy his own farm machinery and educate his children. He is a hard-working man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and hire machinery to prepare the land.

loans.name: Maina

texts.en:
Maina is 26 years old. He is married and supports three people.

He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last three years. He learned about KADET from credit officers. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to purchase farm inputs.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

His  dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase more oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas has operated his garage in Naivasha town for the last seventeen years. He is 39 years old, married to Josephine, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of his friends and this will be his third loan. He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more auto paint and sprays for the garage.

In future, Lukas hopes to grow his garage and his income from his services.

loans.use: To buy more auto paint.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George has been sewing seat covers for vehicles in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He is 28 years old, married to Elizabeth, and they have a one-year-old child.

He was introduced to KADET by one of his friends and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kes. 15,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy new seat covers which he will sew in mini-buses.

In future, George hopes to grow his sewing shop and be getting big orders to sew seat covers for vehicles.

loans.use: To buy more seat covers for mini-buses.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has been in mixed farming for eight years and employs two farmhands in her farm which produces milk and tea which are both sold on the local market. She is married with five children, four of whom are schooling.

Joyce has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to pay for a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide her family with milk and improve their living standards, enabling even the education of the children. She is focusing on constructing a dairy unit for her animals.

Joyce however mentions drought as the potential threat to the farming business. She is appreciative of Juhudi's financial support to farmers.

loans.use: To pay for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has operated his garage in Naivasha town for the last ten years. He specializes in car panel beating and body repair. He is 29 years old, married to Mary, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to purchase fiber to be used in auto body repair.

In future, Stephen hopes open more branches of his garage in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more fiber for panel beating (auto repair).

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is married with three children and all of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (a nephew). She sells cold drinks like soda and passion juice.  She has been in business for the last four years and works seven days a week. Jamila sells in a shop on a retail basis. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of soda, sugar and passion fruit.  Her major challenges include  the rainy season and defaulters. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more new goods for his store

loans.name: Rodger

texts.en: Rodger is a 30-year-old married man with four children between 3 and 7 years old. Rodger is the breadwinner for his family who lives in a rented house in Hoima, a small town located in western Uganda. For six years, he has been running a produce business selling dry foods like beans and maize. He says the beginning was not easy as he found himself having to sell his products at home. After some time, through accumulation of profits from the sales, he shifted the business premises to a strategic trading centre. He faces a challenge of seasonal changes but he hopes to stock for the long term. He wants a loan to buy beans and maize for reselling.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Sylvan

texts.en: Sylvan is 30 years old. He has two children who are three and six years old. His wife is a tailor and Sylvan used to ride a motorcycle for a business but he started up a tailoring business as well. Sylvan has been in the tailoring business for the past eight years and his businesses are going well. He is requesting a loan to buy pieces of fabrics to sell in his tailoring shop so that his clients will buy them if they need them.

loans.use: to buy pieces of fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to cover orders

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya where she has been doing mixed farming for the last 10 years. She has employed five farmhands who help her produce maize, beans, bananas, watermelons and French beans. She is married with one child aged 11. She gets additional income from employment as a field officer by a local non-governmental organization.

Monicah has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES to enable her to purchase a dairy cow. She adds that her focus is to save her income to buy more land and expand her farming activities further. These, she says, will enable her to put up a good house for her family.

Monicah says failure of rain and an unreliable labor force are the greatest undoing to farming in the area.

loans.use: To pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more lapper (Traditional Cloth)

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He also goes around using his bicycle, selling retail goods around town.  He is 42 years old, married to Jane and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of KES. 40,000 well and in good time.  He used the previous loan to add stock to his shop.  He plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell.

In the future, Peter hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in shop

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 24-year old man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail shop business for three years. Before that, Emmanuel was a cotton farmer from which he got the capital to start the retail shop. His hardships are thieves and high trading license rates. His vision is to have a big shop ,which sells a variety of products and buy land to construct a family house. Emmanuel needs the loan facility to start the product diversification at his shop by buying clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell in his shop

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine is 24 years old and she has a one year old child.  Her husband is a driver.  

Madeleine sells second hand shoes and she has been doing this business for the past four years. This business has enabled her to buy the necessities needed at home and she is happy that she has been able afford to buy herself chairs for her resting room.  She needs a loan to buy more shoes to make more profits.  She plans to save all her profits until she can afford to build her own family house.

loans.use: Buying shoes for sale.

loans.name: Mukadaskhon

texts.en:
Mukadaskhon is 38 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children.  From the time she was young, Mukadaskhon was learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding.  

She hopes to continue growing and improving her business to offer a better future for her children and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking people.  For this reason Mukadaskhon is asking a loan of 5,000 TJS.  She wants to use this loan to buy additional sheep and cattle and she is sincerely thankful for your support. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sheep and cattle

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en:
Ayyub is 47 years old.  He is married and has two children.  He sells cattle.  As a rule, Ayyub purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

After being in this business for 6 years, he knows how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them very well.  Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them.  His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family.  With the first loan from AqroInvest Ayyub were able to purchase more animals and increase his income.

Ayyub is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase more cattle.  For this purpose, he requests 1,500 AZN loan that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a forty six year old married male with six children and lives in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the butcher business for sixteen years.  He started with very little capital but has seen it grow steadily over time.  

His hardship is lack of enough capital because his business is one of high turnover and he always needs restocking.  He says he is working hard to see his business blossom to greater heights.  Gideon needs the loan facility to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers

loans.name: Nephat

texts.en:
Nephat has been extracting stones from quarries in Naivasha town for the last nine years. He is 39 years old, married to Lydia and they have six school going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time. He used the previous loan amount to buy another quarry. He plans to use the loan amount to buy another quarry site and employ casual workers so that he may increase his production.

In future, Nephat hopes to grow and own many quarries.

loans.use: To buy another quarry site.

loans.name: Los Tulipanes 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Giorgina is the coordinator of her group, Los Tulipanes  1 & 2 (tulips). This is a group composed of 15 business women. All of them are working to improve their lives and their familys' also. They live in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city, a large community called Los Alcarrizos, which is located at the north of the city.

Giorgina makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. Giorgina is excited to be seeking her third loan with Esperanza. She successfully paid off her previous loan after using it to make a successful investment in her "Colmado" (a small grocery store, located in neighborhoods where people go to buy mostly daily meals). She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods like rice, beans, vegetables, cooking oil, canned products, sugar, coffee, etc. She provides in her business all the products a family might need to cook.

Giorgina's dreams are to develop herself as businesswoman, with an improved business and sustainable life, together with her family.  She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetables, cooking oil, canned products, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been extracting stones from quarries in Naivasha town for the last eight years.  He is 43 years old, married to Lilian and they have four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 17,000 KES well and in good time.
