He used the previous loan amount to buy another quarry. He plans to use this loan amount to buy another quarry site and employ casual workers so that he may increase his production.

In future, Daniel hopes to grow and own many quarries.

loans.use: To buy another extraction site.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en: Pascaline, a 24-year-old single woman with no children, sells new clothes, purchasing her products from Kampala in neighbouring Uganda and reselling them at home at slightly higher prices. This business has so far enabled her to renovate her house and help support some of her relatives. Pascaline is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to make additional profits with which she plans to open up a hair salon.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, who is 38 years old, married to Naomi and the father of two children, has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years. Introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, he is requesting his fourth loan, his previous ones having been repaid well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Stephen hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, a 34-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda, has operated a pub for three years; in spite of its small size it has enjoyed tremendous growth in sales over that time. Bad debtors are his major business hardship.

Felix intends to use the loan to buy crates of beer to sell at his pub, and he aspires both to venture into a wholesale business and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer to sell at his pub.

loans.name: Kholisakhon

texts.en:
An honest and hardworking woman, Kholisakhon has been processing dried fruit for three years, assisted by her family. In season she purchases about 6000-6500 kg of fresh fruits and after processing gets 1200 kg of dried fruit and 600 kg of ossicles (pits). From profits earned last year she purchased furniture for her house. Kholisakhon is now requesting a loan of 5000 TJS to purchase fresh apricots for processing.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fresh apricots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more "lapper" (lengths of traditional cloth)

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eleven years.  He is 36 years old, married to Margaret, and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. He then will sell the produce in the local market.

In future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 36 years old. She has five children who are aged 3-17 years old. Her husband is a builder. 

Beatha sells foodstuffs which include beans and Irish potatoes and also charcoal. She has done this business for the past 15 years. This business enables her to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house. 

She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs and make more profits. She plans to save the profit until she can afford to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka has practiced farming in Njabini for the last six years.  She is 53 years old, married to John, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Milka hopes to become a leading farmer in Njabini town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mashohida

texts.en:
Mashohida is a hard-working woman who is engaged in processing fruit. Her family helps in this business. She sells her dried fruit in Khujand region and the neighboring region. In the season she purchases fresh fruit, about 4500-5000 kg, and after processing she gets 1000-1300kg dried fruit and 500 kg "ossicle". Mashohida would like to get a loan of 5000 TJS to purchase fresh apricots to process.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fresh apricots.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 44 years old and married with four children: three sons and a daughter. Her first two sons are involved in a sewing business. Her youngest son is studying in 7th standard while her daughter is studying in 8th standard. 

Shahnaz is also a very talented lady. She knows the skill of sewing but only does it to support her sons in their business. Her husband works as a security guard and studied till 10th standard.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son’s business. With the loan, he will buy an over-lock machine to further improve his business. 

He has been operating his business for the past 11 years and Shahnaz hopes that her sons’ business will be established further and increases their profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy an over-lock machine.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina  is married with six children and four of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She sells bananas on a retail basis and works seven days a week. She has been in business for less than a year. 

Madina has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas.  

Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is married and has six children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. Sarah resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

She sells second-hand clothes and works six days a week. She has been in business for the last ten years. She sells her clothes on a mobile basis. Sarah generates additional income through mushroom growing. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. 

Her major challenges include seasonality.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has six children and all her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Beatrice operates a soft-drink kiosk. She has been in business for the last five years and works seven days a week. Beatrice sells her products on a retail basis. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of soda and a refrigerator. 

Her major challenges include thieves and the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and a refrigerator

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old lives in the Kakata area. He is married and has four children age 3 to 14. They all live at home and attend school. 

For the past 10 years he has been involved in the sales of used shoes. He started in business by selling cool water in a wheel barrow and learned this business from friends. What he likes about this business is that he makes new friends and meets people each and every day. It makes him proud to have money in his pocket every day.

David has requested this loan to purchase more shoes in order to have his business grow into a bigger one. 

Among his challenges is the changing of US dollars to Liberian dollars. In future he wants to open another shop near the present shop.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya where he has been farming for six years now. He employs two farmhands and sells his produce of coffee, tea, maize and vegetables locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 Kes in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. He faces the challenge of diseases which affect his crops and animals. He aspires to have a public service vehicle and expand his dairy business in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 35 years old. She has four children who are 5-13 years old and they are all in school. Her husband is a businessman. 

Francine sells meat. She has a butcher shop and she has done this business for the past four years. This business has enabled her to pay for medical insurance for her family, pay school fees and build a family house. She needs a loan to buy more cattle for slaughtering in her butcher shop in order to make more profits. She plans to reinvest in her business with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: to buy cattle to slaughter.

loans.name: Rahmattilo

texts.ru: Рахматтило житель Шахритуского района. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он вместе с семьей занимается растениеводством. При доме у него имеется большой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и дыню. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 21 год. Кредит берет для покупки минеральных удобрений, топлива и семян арбуза.  Сейчас сезон посева арбуза. Поэтому Рахматтило берет кредит, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Rahmattilo lives in the Shahrituz region. He's fifty-four years of age, married and has three children. They own a large plot of land adjacent to their home, where they have grown vegetables and melons for the past twenty-one years. He's asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and watermelon seeds. It's watermelon planting season, so Rahmattilo is requesting a loan in order to plant and receive a good harvest fro sale.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, fuel and watermelon seeds

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has practiced farming in Njabini for the last ten years.  She is 70 years old, married to Moses, and they have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Josephine hopes to become a leading farmer in Njabini town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy perfume, beauty and hair products, body lotion and natural medicine to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has operated his bakery in Njabini town for the last five years. He bakes cakes, breads and buns and then distributes them to local retailers. He is 31 years old, married to Mercy and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy cooking oil, sugar and flour in bulk to increase his production of products.

In the future, Daniel hopes to grow his business and own a big bakery.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar and flour in bulk.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene is 28 years old. She has two children who are three and seven years old. Her husband is a welder. 

Helene sells second-hand clothes and she has done this business for the past eight years. This business has enabled her meet the needs of her family. 

She needs a loan to open up a general store in which she plans to sell different kinds of items including sugar, rice, cooking oil, salt and soap. She plans to save all her profits in order to start building her own house.

loans.use: to buy various items for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret  is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also care of several other family members and earns a living by sell charcoal six days a week. Margaret has been in this line of work for the last seven years and also runs a small business on the side selling used clothing. She is applying for this loan from MCDT SACCO of 1000,000 to buy more bales of clothes to sell and build her own stall. Her biggest challenges include transportation, but she is committed to grow her current businesses, begin selling clothes imported from overseas and start a new business renting out rooms to visitors. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. One of her largest monthly expenses is school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ergash

texts.ru: Эргаш проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 61 год. Он женат. Имеет 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Эргаш предоставляет услугу. Он занимается ремонтом автомашин. В этом ему помогает его сын. В этой области он более 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых инструментов и для ремонта мастерской.
texts.en: Ergash lives in Bohtar.  He is 61 years old, married, and has five children.  His wife is a housewife. Ergash provides a service.  He repairs automobiles.  His son helps him in this.  He has been doing this work for more than ten years.  He is taking out a loan to buy necessary tools and to renovate his shop.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 41-year-old, married man and father of 2 children. He has been working in transportation since 2008. He is working hard to generate money to cover all the family and life costs. His customers are all community members.

Ahmad  is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to do necessary maintenance to his car and to buy a bedroom for his home.

Ahmad is a man with a good reputation. He enjoys his work, since he likes communicating with others. He gets introduced to different cultures through his business, which is joyful to him. Ahmad hopes to open a transportation company that prepares tourist visits all over Lebanon.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance to his car

loans.name: Riffat Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Riffat bibi is 34 years old and married with two sons. Her eldest son is eight years old while her younger one is four years old.  

Riffat is an uneducated lady. She couldn’t study because her parents couldn’t send her to school due to financial constraints. But she knows the value of education; that’s why she wants to educate her children. For that purpose, she does a livestock business. She buys young animals from the animal market, raises them up and sells to customers who require them to collect money for her children’s future.  

Her husband is involved in a construction supplies business. Her brother-in-law is also lives with her family and is an electrician by trade. He provides electricity repair services to his customers and earns an income.  

Riffat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her livestock business. With the loan, she will buy goats to resell at a profit.  She has been operating this business for the past 15 years and is hopeful that the loan investment will bring her business to a more profitable position and allow her to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy goats for livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Konoweka Zibba Womens Group

texts.en:
39-year-old Hadijah's confidence has always been sky high. The level-headed mother of five says the fact that she believes in her own worth means she does almost everything with gusto and optimism. The last 15 years' success in her retail business can bear testimony to that. 

This business which was begun with savings from her farming business grew by leaps and bounds. This growth was not only as a result of the afore-mentioned factors but also her diligence and persistence in the face of adversity. At her retail outlet, she sells a variety of general goods such as beans, soap, maize flour, cooking oil, etc. Weekly her profits total shillings 80,000. 

Hadijah says she is requesting this loan to purchase more retail goods like soap, sugar, cooking oil, jerrycans, rice, etc. to resell.

In the group photo, Hadijah  is the first lady standing on the left in the back row. By mistake, Harriet, the lady standing next to her, also raised her hand.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods like rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to resell

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en: Perpetua is 38 years old, and she has two children who are four and ten years old. They are both in school. Her husband is a builder. Perpetua sells foodstuffs and she has been selling foodstuffs for the past four years. She is proud of her business because it has enabled her to feed her family and sustain her business. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs and make more profits. With the profits she plans to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en: Leoncie is 33 years old, and she has three children who are aged six to nine years old. Her husband is a driver. Leoncie sells second-hand clothes and she has been selling these clothes for the past ten years. This business has enabled her to buy a piece of land on which she plans to build a house. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to buy another piece of land.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta has operated her fruit shop in Njabini town for the last 2 years. She is 52 years old, married to John and they have 2 children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more fruit to sell in her shop.

In the future, Jecinta hopes to grow her shop to a big grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Yassine

texts.en: Yassine is a 56-year-old married man and the father of four children. Yassine has owned a grocery store for 26 years and is working hard to expand it. That’s why he has requested a second loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner. He needs to buy an engine for his van which he uses to go and buy necessary goods for his shop. His  previous loan helped a lot in improving his business, and he is a borrower in good standing. He is working hard to expand by adding new products to his shop, which will increase his family’s income and cover most of their expenses.

loans.use: To buy an engine for the van used for his business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has operated her fruit shop in Njabini town for the last 4 years. She is 44 years old, married to Mwangi and they have 3 children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her shop.

In the future, Patricia hopes to grow her shop to a big grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 18 sacks of rice, ten bags of sugar, ten cartons of peanut oil, and ten 10 kg sacks of corn flour

loans.name: Vyizigiro Ii Group

texts.fr:
Vianne est une commerçante âgée de 25ans qui habite la commune Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke située à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de sel de cuisine depuis 3ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 10e année des études secondaires. Elle est mariée à Jean de Dieu, lui-même commerçant. Ils ont ensemble 1enfants de 2ans 6 mois.

Elle obtient le crédit Kiva de 500,000francs burundais qui lui permet  d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de sel de cuisine à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle espère que son business va se développer et lui permettre d’acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison. 
Elle  est membre  du groupe  solidaire « VYIZIGIRO II»
texts.en:
Vianne  is a petty trader of 25 who lives in the Commune of Rugombo in the province of Cibitoke, located in the west of Burundi. She has been selling cooking salt for three years. She got through the 10th grade in secondary school. She is married to Jean de Dieu, who is also a petty trader. They have one child, two and a half years old.

She is getting a Kiva loan of 500,000 Burundi francs which will allow her to grow her working capital so as to buy big quantities of cooking salt for resale so that she can make more profit. She hopes that her business will expand and permit her to buy a plot of land to build her very own house on. 

Vianne is a member of the solidarity group « VYIZIGIRO II»

loans.use: to add to her working capital to buy big quantities of cooking salt for resale.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en: Marie Gorette is 58 years old. She has 6 children who are ages 20-37 years old. Her husband works in peoples' homes. M. Gorette has been a tailor for the past 43 years. This business enabled her to bring up her children and to continuously meet their needs. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and other tailoring materials, such as thread, in order to reinvest in her business. With the profits, she plans renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sell

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat is 42 years old and involved in an animal sales business. She does this work at her home. Presently, she has two cows. She takes care of them by providing timely food & water. Her business gives her good profit which helps her husband financially. Her husband also does the same business. He has a good number of business contacts who prefer buying animals  from him because of his good knowledge about animal breeds. 

They are parents of five children: two daughters and three sons. Her eldest son is a mason and the next to him is a salesman while her youngest son is studying in 9th standard. Her elder daughter is in 12th standard and also doing a diploma in nursing. Her younger daughter is also studying in 9th standard. 

Farhat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animal food & some goats to be able to earn a good income. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Farhat is hopeful that the loan investment will bring better profits to her husband’s business and improve the financial condition of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farhat.

loans.use: To buy animal food & some goats.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old. She has two children who are ages 4 and 11 years old. Both her children are in school. Her husband works with a security organization. 

Fatuma owns a general store in which she sells different kind of items such as Irish potatoes, green bananas, etc. Selling food items has enabled her to feed her children and meet their other needs as well. Fatuma needs a loan to invest in her grocery business by buying more food items. She plans to reinvest in her business with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: to buy food items for sale

loans.name: Sagyn

texts.en:
Sagyn is 56 years old. He is married and has one son. In order to support his family, he works as a taxi driver near the local market. 

In 2004, Sagyn decided to start his business in selling foodstuffs, which has become good source of income for his family. He rented a small shop and to maintain that shop, he obtained his first loan from Bai Tushum. This loan was used as intended and repaid without any delay. 

Now, Sagyn plans to use this loan of 30,000 KGS to broaden his assortment of goods. With the revenues, he plans to pay for the education of his son and further development of this business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that aim to increase employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of food items he sells

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse is a poultry farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for four years now and employs three farmhands. He is 31 years old and single.

Jesse has made his third loan request from Juhudi Kilimo of 100,000 Kes in order to purchase additional chickens and chicken feed. The proceeds from this loan will enable him to expand his farming activities. He says that his biggest challenge has been the expenses incurred in raising the chicks from the time they are hatched to the time they are sold and diseases which cause a massive death of chickens.

He currently owns two dairy cows and would like to venture into dairy farming as well and be the sole supplier of milk in his division.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on more bags and clothes.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista  is a widow with four children .She has one additional family member .She sells second-hand clothes  and works six days a week. She has been in business for the last eight years. She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. 

Teopista has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes .Her major business challenge is seasonality and ever increasing prices of clothes. Teopista resides in her own house and  the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Malian

texts.en:
Malian is 30 years old. She has one ten-year-old child who is in school and is married to man who sells second-hand clothes. Malian sells second-hand clothes too and she has been selling these clothes for the past seven years. She works with her husband. They built their own house from this business. 

Malian is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en: Anitha is the mother of two children who are two and four years old. She is 31 years old and has enrolled her older child in school. For the last four years, she has made a living by selling second-hand clothes, and has used her income to educate her children and set aside money to expand her business. She is applying for this loan to buy more clothing to sell and to expand her business. She plans to save the additional profit she earns as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is 55 years old and sells buffalo milk to share the financial burden with her husband. She has four buffaloes whose milk she sells. She gets up early in the morning every day and milks her buffaloes. Her milk prices are very reasonable, and that’s why she has a good number of clients in the region. 

Her husband operates an animal feed business. Because he is operating his business in the place where many people are involved in milk selling businesses, he makes good sales from his business. 

Manzooran is the mother of three sons. The eldest one is a laborer while the other two are tailors by trade. Manzooran also gives full-time attention to her home and does her household responsibilities very well.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animal feed in larger quantity to be able to sell more and increase his profits. He has been operating this business for the past three years and Manzooran hopes that an investment will be a productive one for him. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Manzooran.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for resale.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 37 years old, and she has a nine-year-old child. Her child goes to school. Vestine sells used shoes and it’s her husband who introduced her to this business, and they work together. They have run this business together for the past three years. This business has enabled them to meet their needs and expand it as well. They have also managed to buy themselves a television set. 

Vestine is requesting a loan to buy more used shoes and make more profits because she wishes to buy a piece of land with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco es chofer  taxista de transporte libre ya que no es socio en ningún sindicato. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de calaminas, vigas y puertas, esto para la construcción de una habitación. Vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Francisco is an independent taxi driver; he is not the member of any syndicate.  He needs the loan to buy corrugated iron, beams and doors.  This is to build a room.  

He lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children.

This is his first loan with Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron, beams and doors to build a room in his house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members .She operates a retail shop in Nsooba, a Kampala suburb, and works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last ten years.

Josephine wants to buy more sugar, rice, and soap for her shop. She sells to all categories, both retail and wholesale .Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Josephine has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO of 400,000 UGX to buy more stock and own her own retail shop. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 45 years old. She has four children who are aged 10-25 years old, and they are all in school. She is a widow. Speciose sells charcoal and she has been selling charcoal for the past eight years. This charcoal business has enabled her to bring up her children, meet their needs and feed them as well. She needs a loan to reinvest in her charcoal business by buying more charcoal.With the profits she plans to install water pipes in her house and have water come to her house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La señora Catalina se dedica a la venta de chocolates y golosinas en el puesto de venta que tiene. El crédito lo requiere para  el aumento de capital y así podrá adquirir mayor de dulces y galletas para su venta. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada y tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
Catalina sells chocolates and sweets at a stand that she has.  The loan she needs is to increase her capital.  That way she will be able to get more sweets and cookies to sell.

She lives in her own house in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto.

She is married and has one child.

loans.use: to buy sweets and cookies wholesale to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: is 51 years old and has eight children who range in age from 9 to 23 years old. Her husband makes a living by selling shoes, and Immaculate sells plastic products such as buckets, soda and beer crates and other items. She has been in this line of work for 16 years, and has used her income her to feed her family and meet the needs of her children. She is applying for this loan to increase her profits by buying more plastic products to sell. She plans to use the additional profit made possible by this loan to begin building a house for her family. In the future, she plans to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy plastic items such as buckets to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, a resident of Litein, South Rift Kenya, has been a dairy farmer for 14 years, employing one farmhand and producing millk which she sells to the local Kabianga Dairy plant. She is married with five children, three adults and the other two still attending school.

Catherine has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says she will first use the extra income arising from the purchase to repay the loan and thereafter pay for her children's education. She also wants to purchase more land in the future.

Catherine sees insufficient land as her major farming impediment.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo, vive con su esposa y una hija de 17 años de edad, él es agricultor, se ha dedicado a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace 40 años, aprendió el oficio por herencia de su padre, su trabajo inicia a las 4:00am hasta las 11:00am, todos los días de la semana.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la siembra de maíz y frijol, como lo son el abono y fertilizantes, con esta compra de materiales él espera que sus cultivos produzcan lo necesario, también espera que el invierno sea moderado para no perder su trabajo.
Para Mateo su aspiración es su familia, por quienes se esfuerza cada para sacarlos adelante, sin que les falte nada.
texts.en:
Mateo lives with his wife and his 17 year old daughter.  He is a farmer.  He has been growing corn and beans for 40 years.  He learned this trade as an inheritance from his father.  His work starts at 4:00 a.m., and he works until 11:00 a.m. every day of the week.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for planting corn and beans.  He will buy things like natural and chemical fertilizers.  With this purchase of materials he hopes his crops will produce what he needs.  He also hopes that the winter is moderate so that he does not lose his work.

To Mateo his family is the air he breathes.  He puts forth effort every day to get them ahead and so that they do not need anything.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El señor Leonardo trabaja como empleado de mantenimiento en un edificio además que realiza trabajos de instalación de radio en la compañía HANSA, además en el transcurso de la semana trabaja como voceador de minibús. El crédito lo requiere para la compra  de una computadora. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco  de la ciudad de El Alto, es soltero y tiene un hijo. Leonardo es cliente de IMPRO desde el año  2008.
texts.en:
Leonardo works as a janitor in a building.  He also carries out radio installations for the company HANSA.  In addition, during the week, he works as a minibus stop announcer.

Leonardo needs this loan to buy a computer.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in Rio Seco district, in the city of El Alto.  He is single and has one son.  Leonardo has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his personal use

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolás es productor lechero y también se realiza trabajos de albañil. El crédito lo requiere para comprar un terreno que lo utilizara para sembrar el forraje para alimentar a sus vacas lecheras. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi del departamento de  La Paz; es casado  y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is a milk producer and also, works as a brick mason.  He lives in his own house, located in Achacachi, in the department of La Paz.  He is married and has 3 children.

The loan he requests is for buying farm land that he needs for sowing forage crops to feed his milk cows.

loans.use: buy farm land to sow forage crops to feed his milk cows.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very caring and supportive lady by nature. She spends most of her time at home and manages the household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Besides her household work, she also supports her husband in his dairy business. She takes care of his buffalo by providing food and water as needed. 

Her husband is a very hardworking person. He gets up early in the morning, gets milk from the buffalo and then goes to clients in the community and to milk shops to sell it. In this way, their financial circle goes. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business because now his milk demand is increasing day by day and a single buffalo is looking insufficient to meet the requirement. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo to increase the milk production to take care of his new clients. 

Nasreen is hopeful that the loan investment will prove a productive one for her husband. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is the founder of a social bike project in partnership with an urban school in Detroit.  While Nick’s office is in his home, the bikes are built by students at a Detroit high school. The partnering school has a great deal of existing capacity for building, as well as a network for the next generation of cyclists, mechanics, and machinists. Founded in March, this bike project entails designing and manufacturing handmade bicycle trailers. Sales are generated in the neighborhood through open houses, in the city through retail outlets, and nationally through Nick’s website.  In Detroit there is a huge demand for public transportation as it is minimal and unreliable; expanding the capacity of bikes is an opportunity to impact change in the community. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Nick will purchase materials for the bikes and advertise the project. Nick hopes to cultivate the positive relationship with the school, allow students to continue working on the project and spread the word about the great need for transportation in Detroit. 


Additional Information About This Loan 

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps.  Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit

loans.use: to purchase materials for the bikes and advertise the project

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr:
Alice est une commerçante âgée de 37ans qui habite la commune Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke située à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de sorgho depuis 2ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Elle est mariée à Emmanuel, lui-même cultivateur. Ils ont ensemble 7 enfants dont 3 étudient.
Elle demande le crédit Kiva dans le but d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de sorgho à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle préfère le crédit de Turame parce que c’est très utile pour les petits commerçants et la garantie matérielle n’est pas exigée. 
Elle espère que son business va se développer et lui permettre d’acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison. Elle souhaite que ses enfants terminent leurs études avec succès.

Elle  est membre  du groupe  communautaire « MAOMBI».
texts.en:
Alice is a petty trader of 37 who lives in the commune of Rugombo in the province of Cibitoke, situated in the west of Burundi. She has been selling sorghum for two years. She is also a farmer. She went to primary school up to the fifth year. She is married to Emmanuel, who is also a farmer. They have seven children together; three of them are enrolled in school. 

She is requesting a Kiva loan in order to grow her working capital and buy big quantities of sorghum for resale so as to make more profit. 

She prefers Turame loans because they are very useful for small-scale business people and no collateral is necessary. 

She hopes that her business will develop and permit her to buy a plot of land to build a house on. She hopes that her children will graduate from school successfuly. 

She is a member of the community solidarity group « MAOMBI».

loans.use: to add to her working capital to buy big quantities of sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is aged 35 and married with 3 children, two of whom are currently attending school. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last fifteen years in his hometown in western Kenya. His farm produces maize, beans, vegetables and eggs which are all sold locally. He earns additional income from his business of making and selling bricks locally. His primary challenges have been insufficient animal feed and diseases which affect his production.

Eliud has made a loan request of 62,400 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that with the dairy cow, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from this project will help him support his family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, es madre soltera de un hijo de 2 años de edad, ella vive con sus padres, y tiene el negocio desde hace un año, estos cerdos los compra pequeños, los alimenta  para comercializarlos en la zona.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado para alimentar a los cerdos, también comprara medicinas y vitaminas para ellos,  esta compra le ayudara a tener suficiente alimento para los cerdos, garantizándose de poder venderlos a un buen precio.
El sueño de ella es instalar una tienda de productos domésticos, aumentar el número de cerdos en la granja y velar por las necesidades de su hijo.
texts.en:
Milagro raises pigs and is the mother of a 2-year-old son. She lives with her parents and has had her business for 1 year.  Milagro buys the pigs when they are small, feeds them, then sells them in the zone.

At present, Milagro is requesting a loan to buy feed concentrate to feed the pigs, and also to buy medicines and vitamins for them.  These purchases will help her have sufficient feed for her pigs, and guarantee that they can be sold at a good price.

Milagro's dream is to establish a domestic products store, increase the number of pigs she has, and to provide necessities for her son.

loans.use: buy feed, medicines, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mirtha Grisel

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha  esta solicitando un préstamo para poder reparar los acabados del exterior de su casa. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material que es cemento, pintura y la impermeabilización de techo. 

Doña Mirtha es madre soltera y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, quien esta estudiando. Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mirtha is requesting a loan to carry out some repair work on the outside of her home.  She does not have the money she needs to buy materials: cement, paint and waterproofing for the roof.

Mirtha is a single mother.  She has one child in her care who is in school.  She plans to repay her loan with the income she makes in her job.

loans.use: to do some work on the outside of her home.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José, tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 15 años, los trabajos los realiza por las tardes, ya que en las mañanas trabaja para una empresa eléctrica.
Él iniciara la siembra de maíz para lo cual necesita invertir el abono y fertilizantes, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de estos, obteniendo así mejores ingresos.
Las aspiraciones de José, son que a través de su esfuerzo lograr la construcción de su casa, para vivir con su familia, además de ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children.  He has been growing corn for 15 years.  He does this work in the afternoons since he works for an electricity company in the mornings.

José is about to start sowing his corn and needs to invest in manure and fertilizers.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy these products.  He will thereby be able to earn more income.

José's aspiration is to work hard so that he can build his home and live in it with his family.  He would also like to help his children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies (manure and fertilizers)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive en compañía de su esposa, tienen casa propia, su trabajo es la agricultura, siembra maíz desde hace mucho tiempo, y este trabajo le ha ayudado para solventar sus necesidades familiares.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes, con estos materiales estará preparando el terreno para que el maíz se desarrolle y pueda producir, aunque siempre existe el riesgo con el invierno, el cual afecta al cultivo.
Para José el recibir buenas cosechas, es una manera de lograr objetivos, pues siempre al inicio de este trabajo su objetivo es tener una buena producción, abundante y sana para poder comercializarla y consumir con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer who lives with his wife in their own house. His work is in agriculture: he has sown corn for some time, and this work has helped him pay for family necessities.

At present, he needs a loan to buy manure and fertilizers. With these supplies he will be able to prepare his farm land so that the corn can grow and produce, although there is always the risk that comes with winter which can affect the crop

For Jose, obtaining good harvests is a means of achieving his objectives, because always upon initiating this job, his goal is to have a good production, abundant and healthy, so that he can sell it and share it with his family.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio, tiene tres hijos de 20, 16 y 11 años de edad, él vive en familia y se dedica a la ganadería, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, la realiza desde hace 4 años, además de trabajar realizando viajes en su microbús escolar, trabaja todos los días iniciando muy temprano para ordeñar las vacas.
Por el momento el necesita comprar más ganado y también sembrar maíz, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra el gasto del ganado y los insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, esta compra es muy importante para Porfirio, pues aumenta el número de reces y aprovechara para cosechar maíz.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ofrecerles la oportunidad de estudio y una vida más confortable.
texts.en: Porfirio has three children, ages 20, 16 and 11, and has been working as a livestock farmer for four years, having learned the trade from his father.  He also drives a school microbus.  He works every day from very early in the morning milking his cows.  Currently he is in need of buying more livestock and planting corn, for which he has requested a loan to cover the cattle purchase and farm supplies such as fertilizer.  This purchase is important to Porfirio since it will increase the number of cattle and enable him to plant corn.  His goal is to work hard so his children can get ahead, have the opportunity to get an education and lead a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more livestock and fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Fasha Group

texts.fr:
Irène est une commerçante âgée de 26ans qui habite la commune Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke située à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique depuis 3ans. Elle a fait ses études secondaires et obtenu le Diplôme de fin des études secondaires. Elle est mariée à Elysée, lui-même commerçant. Ils ont ensemble 2enfants âgés respectivement de 4 et 9 mois.

Elle obtient le crédit Kiva de 100,000francs burundais qui lui permet  d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles de boutique à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle espère que son business va se développer et lui permettre d’acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison, s’acheter un moyen de déplacement et se voit devenir une grande commerçante de sa région. 
Elle  est membre  du groupe  Communautaire « FASHA».
texts.en:
Irène is a merchant aged 26 who lives in the commune of Rugombo in the province of Cibitoke located in the west of Burundi. She has been selling various grocery items for three years. She got her leaving certificate in secondary school. She is married to Elysée, who is also a merchant. They have two children, ages four and nine months. 

She is receiving a Kiva loan of 100,000 Burundi francs which will allow her to grow her working capital so as to buy big quantities of groceries for resale so as to earn more profit. 

She hopes that her business will expand and permit her to buy a plot of land on which to build a house, to buy some sort of means of transport, and to see herself become a big merchant in her region. 
 
She is a member of the community group « FASHA».

loans.use: to add to her working capital to buy large quantities of groceries for resale.

loans.name: Jose Emilio

texts.es:
José, tiene casa propia y vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, él es agricultor desde pequeño se dedica a esta labor, cuando ayudaba a su padre.
Él está iniciando la siembra de maíz, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprarse insumos y abonar el terreno, también insecticidas, ya que con estos materiales podrá dar el cuido necesario a la milpa, librándola de cualquier plaga que pueda llegarle, aunque los daños en ocasiones lo origina el invierno, cuando es muy fuerte o muy débil.
Su objetivo es tener una fuente de trabajo que le ayude a mejorar su vida, manteniendo a su familia en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
José has his own house and lives with his wife and two children, ages 7 and 3.  His has been a farmer since he was young and used to help his father.

He is starting to plant corn and needs a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide.  With these supplies he will be able to care for the cornfield properly, preventing insect plagues, although sometimes damage can be due to extreme weather in the winter season.

His goal is to have a souce of income to improve his lifestyle and maintain his family in good living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to plant corn.

loans.name: Jorge Mario

texts.es: La cría de cerdos para la venta es un negocio de tradición familiar, pues Jorge Mario de origen campesino del municipio de Titiribí en Antioquia aprendió desde pequeño al lado de su padre las actividades propias del campo. Su negocio es la fuente de sustento de este emprendedor su esposa y sus dos hijos. Jorge actualmente necesita de un préstamo para pagar los cerdos que hace poco adquirió y para comprar concentrado que le permita engordarlos más rápidamente y generar ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Raising pigs to sell is the family’s traditional occupation because Jorge Mario is a farmer from Titiribí in Antioquia.  He learned farming chores alongside his father while still a little boy.  His business is his source of support for this entrepreneur, his wife and their two children.  

Jorge currently needs a loan to pay for some pigs he acquired recently and to buy feed that will make it possible for him to fatten them up more quickly and generate income to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for acquired pigs and to buy feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic material, decorative fabric, glue and other materials.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 49 años de edad, es una mujer sencilla y muy trabajadora, esta casada con Amadeo de 47 años y tienen 04 hijos en etapa escolar y juntos residen en su propia morada donde reina la armonía. Marina trabaja arduamente desde hace 25 años, en aquellos años ella se dedicaba tan solo a la agricultura lo cual le servía solo para sostener a su familia. Con sus ahorros acumulados abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, desde entonces su negocio le genera buenas ganancias económicas. Menciona que la clave de captar consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lleva seis años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie  todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien ya que gracias a ello pudo adquirir más espacio de terreno para cultivar donde trabaja su amado esposo. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar  su  bodega. Este será su 17avo crédito, y esta muy contenta de saber que contara una vez más con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia participe y muy puntual en las reuniones. Con el crédito comprará mercadería como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes.
texts.en:
Marina, 49, is from the city of Quimbiri and is a simple, hard-working woman.  She has been married to Amadeo for 47 years and they have four school-aged children.  They all live together in their own house in a harmonious environment.  Marina has been working hard for 25 years.  She used to work in agriculture to support the famly.  With the money she was able to save she opened a grocery store and offers a variety of basic needs products.  Her business generates a good income.  She claims the key to attracting customers is kindess and support when they are shopping.

She has been involved in this business for six years and feels that the hardest part of it is having to stand all day long.  But business is going very well and thanks to this she was able to buy more crop-land for her husband to farm.  In the future she would like to expand the house and the store.  This will be her 17th loan and she is happy knowing that she can count on lenders to help her keep growing.  In her communal bank she is an active member and very punctual for meetings.  She plans to use the loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, oils and detergents.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sugar, oils and detergents.

loans.name: Martha Ligia

texts.es: Llegar a tener un taller de confección que le permita generar empleo es el sueño de Martha Ligia, quien a sus 42 años de edad se dedica a la confección a terceros de camisas y blusas, esta emprendedora desde pequeña aprendió este oficio al lado de su madre y por la falta de oportunidades para estudiar decidió dedicarse a su propio negocio.
texts.en: Martha Ligia's dream is to have a workshop that allows her to employ people.  Martha, who is 42 years old, works making shirts and blouses for third parties.  She is an enterprising woman who learned this trade at her mother's side, and because of the lack of opportunities for studying she has decided to start her own business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is the father of seven between the ages of 23 and 6 and lives with his family in his hometown area of Nyamira, North Rift, Kenya. He has two farmhands and his farm produces tea, coffee, bananas and maize. He makes additional income from his trade in animals within the local market.

Jackson has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to pay for the education of his children and raise their living standards. He plans to own five cows and construct a modern dairy unit for his animals.

Jackson is grateful for the loans provided by Juhudi Kilimo but says animal diseases and rampant theft of cows are great threats to dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy black clay, nacazcol plant and firewood.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Rubina owns & operates an embroidery business at her home. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which attract many customers towards her. Her clientele base is her community ladies and also boutique owners.  

She finishes each dress in 3 to 4 days time period and earns a good profit. Her earned income helps her to manage the household expenses. She can also sew dresses but her primary business is her embroidery business. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and cloth in bulk to be able to complete orders on time and earn good profits. 

She is hopeful that the loan investment will be proved a profitable one for her business.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with three children, and all go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon and works six days a week. She has been in business for the last seven years. She operates on a retail basis only. Josephine has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more braids, cream relaxers and oils. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of creams and braids. She resides in a rented house where her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married with four children who all go to school. She does not have additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes in Bwaise, a Kampala suburb. She has been in business for the last 8 years and works six days a week. She sells her clothes at the market.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality. Jalia resides in her own house where her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: Olimpia, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 28 años de edad, ella es una mujer alegre y laboriosa y esta casada con Mauth de 31 años y fruto de ello  tienen 04 hijos y viven en su propia casa. Olimpia, es muy empeñosa en sus labores y con ese optimismo que tiene decidió tener su propio negocio. Desde hace 08 años lleva vendiendo ropa nacional e importada al gusto del cliente y lo realiza con mucha vigorosidad, porque es de su agrado. Para ella es más fácil tener su negocio cerca de su casa, porque le ahorra tiempo para realizar el desayuno y el almuerzo para toda su familia. Ella considera que lo dificultoso es no contar el apoyo necesario de su pareja, porque él se encarga a realizar otras labores por ello realiza sus ventas independientemente. El éxito de su negocio radica en el buen trato y la variedad de mercadería que ofrece y a precios módicos. Con el apoyo del crédito viajará a la ciudad de lima para comprar variedad de prendas al por mayor. Posteriormente para el buen ingreso de su economía piensa abrir una tienda en un centro comercial. Este será su octavo crédito con MFP, y por lo cual se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas y esta vez  espera contar con el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir progresando. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará variedad de ropa de verano debido a las altas temperaturas que se da en la región de la selva.
texts.en:
Olimpia is a cheerful and hard-working woman from the town of San Francisco.  She is 28 years old and married to 31 year-old Mauth.  The couple have four children and live in their own home.

Olimpia works very hard.  She is an optimistic woman who decided to start her own business.  For eight years she has been selling nationally-produced and imported clothes to suit her customers tastes.  She does her work with a lot of energy because she enjoys it.  It is easier for her to have her business near her home because it saves her time so that she can prepare breakfast and lunch for the whole family.  She considers the difficult part of her business to be not having the support she needs from her partner because he is engaged in other work and so she must make her sales independently.

The success of Olimpia's business lies in the good service she provides and the variety of merchandise that she offers her customers at reasonable prices.  With the support of this loan, she will travel to the city of Lima to buy a range of clothes wholesale.  Eventually, in order to improve her financial situation, she is planning to open a store in a shopping mall.

This will be Olimpia's eighth loan from MFP and she pledges to continue making her repayments on time.  This time she hopes that she will be able to count on your support so that she can continue making progress.  Olimpia will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy a range of summer clothing owing to the high temperatures in the rainforest region where she lives.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married mother of 9 children, three of whom are currently attending school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years in her hometown in western Kenya. Her farm is currently producing milk and eggs which are all sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family.

Betty has made her fourth loan request of 81,600 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that with the dairy cow she will acquire, her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. She faces the challenges of the high cost of artificial insemination and the high cost of animal feeds, which affects her production. She plans to acquire 3 dairy cows, a posho mill (used to grind maize into meal) and a motorcycle in the next 5 years to enable her to expand her farm.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Alfareras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Alfareras está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Losgia María de 40 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde  1999. Ella inicio con una pequeña paca de ropa en la actualidad compra y vende mayor cantidad en lo cual invertirá el crédito.
Ella tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales tiene a su cargo los dos menores de 12 y 11 años, y su meta es llegar a tener un tramo. 
Las otras integrantes son Odilia María comerciante de ropa usada desde hace 15 años y Francisca  quien es distribuidora de cajetas de leche, de masa, de coco, piñonate, coyolito etc.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Alfareras' group is made up of three hard-working, tenacious and entrepreneurial women.   The group's coordinator is 40 year-old Losgia María who has been selling clothes since 1999.  She started out with a small bundle of clothes.  She now buys and sells larger quantities and this is what she will invest her loan in.

Losgia has four children and the two youngest, who are 12 and 11, are still in her care.  Her goal is to eventually own a sales stall.

The other members of this group are Odilia María, who has been selling used clothing for 15 years; and Francisca, who is a wholesaler of 'cajeta de leche', 'cajeta de masa', 'cajeta de coco', 'piñonate', 'coyolito' etc. (all types of sweet treats).

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes

loans.name: Adégboyé

texts.fr:
Adégboyé est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Ils ont un enfant.
Adégboyé a travaillé comme informaticien depuis 2006. Il a une boutique pour le traitement de texte, des photocopies et scanner. 
Adégboyé a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter dune photocopieuse et une imprimante couleur.
texts.en:
Adégboyé, 33, is married to a petty trader. They have one child. 

Adégboyé has worked with computers since 2006. He has a shop where he prepares, photocopies, and scans texts. 

He has requested his third loan from WAGES so as to buy a photocopier and a color printer.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and a printer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more zippers, lace and a more advanced sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables: potatoes, squash, green beans, plantains, chiles and onions.

loans.name: Wilton

texts.en:
Wilton is 31 years old and single with no child. He runs a tailoring shop in Krootown, a Freetown neighborhood.

Wilton has been a tailor for five years and sells bamako, brillion, zip and thread lace at his shop. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenges to his business are inflation in material prices and electrical power supply.

Wilton has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more advanced sewing machines and other material items. Wilton says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings. In the future, he would like to open an African boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more advanced sewing machines.

loans.name: America Rosa

texts.es: La señora America se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza, entre otros productos, realiza esta labor en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad, américa es casada, su esposo trabaja como vendedor ambulante vendiendo control remoto para televisores, y  con ello ayuda en los ingresos familiares, ambos son muy trabajadores, tiene casa propia, los desafios que enfrenta america y su esposo, es la competencia que hay en zona, el dinero que esta solicitando, es para mejoramiento de vivienda comprar ladrillos,cemento,arenas,para  construir un cuarto mas en su casa, america como toda mujer luchadora tiene mucho sueños uno de ellos es tener un local propio donde ofrecer sus producto , america esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Señora America works selling cleaning supplies, among other products.  She does this work in a busy street in the city.  America is married, and her husband works as a street vendor selling remote controls for televisions, thereby helping with income for the family.  Both are hard workers, and they have their own home.  The challenge facing America and her husband is the competition that exists in the area.  

The money being requested is for home improvement.  It is to buy bricks, cement, and sand to build another room in their home.  America, like every struggling woman, has many dreams.  One of them is to have a separate space where she can offer her products.  America is very grateful for the confidence that is being shown in her.

loans.use: to improve her home, buying cement sand bricks among other things, for construction of a room in her home.

loans.name: Florecita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Florecita lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Argentina  de 40 años, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad. Ella se  dedica a la realización de cepillos para lavar pachas desde hace 14 años. Este negocio lo aprendió de su hermano el cual trabajaba en ello y poco a poco toda la familia se involucró.
Ella invertirá en materiales nailon, alambre, madera…etc. y su meta es iniciar otro negocio que sería el comercio de ropa.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Maricela del Carmen de 35 años quien vende frijoles cocidos y nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo, y María Isabel quien realiza cepillos de lavar ropa y cepillos de lustrar.
texts.en:
The Florecita ("Little Flower") group is composed of three hard-working, enterprising, women. 

One of them is Señora Rosa Argentina. She is 40 years old, and has 5 children, 2 of whom are of school age. For the past 14 years, she has dedicated her time to making brushes for washing baby bottles. She learned her business from her brother, who did the same work and who little by little got the whole family involved. She will invest in the necessary materials (nylon, wire, wood, etc.) and her goal is to start up another business, selling clothes. 

The other members of the group are Maricela del Carmen, age 35, who sells refried beans and nacatamales - a local dish based on cornmeal and pork - and María Isabel, who makes brushes for cleaning clothes and polishing shoes.

loans.use: en materiales nailon, alambre, madera…etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda De San Pedro Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "ESMERALDA D. SAN PEDRO" ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO D. MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 12 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA ANGELICA ES UNA D. LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, TIENE 41 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA LA SECUNDARIA, ES COMERCIANTE Y TIENE UN TOTAL D. 4 HIJOS (2 MUJERES Y 2 VARONES), ELLA SE DEDICA A LA REPARACION Y VENTA D. ELECTRODOMESTICOS Y LINEA BLANCA, EL CUAL INICIO HACE 21 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR REFACCIONES D. LINEA BLANCA. HASTA EL MOMENTO SUS CLIENTES SE SIENTEN CONTENTOS CON EL SERVICIO QUE LA SEÑORA OFRECE, ADEMAS D. QUE EL NEGOCIO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN UN LUGAR CENTRICO. AL MOMENTO D. SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE FELIZ Y MOTIVADA A CONTINUAR INVIRTIENDO. QUIERE ESTE PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIRLO EN REFACCIONES D. LINEA BLANCA PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO Y CUIDADO D. SU MERCANCIA. A FUTURO TIENE PLANEADO LLEGAR A TRABAJAR CON EQUIPOS INDUSTRIALES Y PODER CONSOLIDAR SU NEGOCIO PARA PODER DAR EMPLEO Y CAPACITAR A JOVENES QUE TENGAN GANAS D. SALIR ADELANTE. TAMBIEN DESEA AHORRAR DINERO PARA LA EDUCACION D. SUS HIJOS Y VERLOS COMO PROFESIONISTAS EN UN FUTURO.
texts.en:
This group called "Esmeralda D. San Pedro"  is located in the State of Mexico. The group is maD. up of 12 members 

Señora Angelica is one of the members of the group.  She is 41 years old, and has studied up to secondary level.  She is a business woman, and has a total of 4 children (2 male and 2 female).  She works repairing and selling household appliances and white goods, which she started doing 21 years ago.  She is requesting the loan to buy spare parts for white goods.  So far her clients are happy with the service that the Señora provides, plus the business is situated in a central location.

At the time of applying for this loan, she feels happy and motivated to continue investing.  She wants this loan to be able to invest it in spare parts for white goods, for the maintenance and care of her merchandise.  In the future, she has plans to get to work with industrial equipment and to be able to strengthen her business, so as to be able to proviD. employment and train young people who have a desire to get ahead. She also wants to save money for the education of her children, and sees them as future professionals.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for white goods (household appliances).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for making the dishes that she sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more carpentry materials.

loans.name: Ayda María

texts.es:
Ayda María una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y esforzada quien desde hace diez años inicio su pequeño negocio que consistía en una pequeña y modesta venta de chiverías. Ella conforme el tiempo y los préstamos surtió su negocio con granos básicos, pan, huevo, productos lácteos…etc.
Ayda invertirá el crédito en arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, carne, gaseosa, chiverías…etc.
texts.en:
Ayda María is a hard-working woman, enterprising and industrious.  Ten years ago she started her small business which consists of a small and modest level of snack sales. She pays on time and the loans have supplied her business with basic grains, bread, eggs, dairy...etc.

Ayda will invest the loan in rice, sugar, oil, beans, meat, soda, snacks...etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, meat, soda, snacks...etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing and textiles items.

loans.name: Yawa Dadignon

texts.fr:
Yawa Dadignon est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur. Ils ont deux enfants.  
Yawa Dadignon a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend de charbon de bois à son domicile Elle achète les produits à Kpalimé. Une personne l'aide avec son travail.
Yawa Dadignon a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 25 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Yawa Dadignon is a woman of 36. She is married to a welder and they have two children. 

She has worked as a petty trader since 2003. She sells charcoal at her house. She buys her goods in Kpalimé. One person helps her with her business. 

Yawa Dadignon has requested her second loan from WAGES to buy 25 sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, es mecánico de estructuras metálicas, él vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, su forma de trabajar en el taller es bajo contratos de proyectos, por ejemplo la remodelación de vivienda que incluye aquellas viviendas que serán vendidas, cambiar sus techos, puertas y ventanas, a parte también tiene sus propios clientes.
Por el momento necesita de financiamiento para un proyecto, con el que comprara material como hierro de varias medidas y grosor, láminas, pues estos son los principales para atender los trabajos, este préstamo le ayudara a solventar las necesidades de materiales,  también realizara los trabajos que están en los contratos.
Su objetivo es permanecer en el trabajo, ayudando a su familia y con la esperanza de mejorar cada día sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, is a builder of metal structures.  Juan lives with his wife and four children.  He gets his work through project contracts, for example: home remodeling including houses to be put on the market and new roofs, doors and windows.  He has his own clients as well.
For now, Juan needs the loan for a project.  With the loan, he will purchase iron of various size and thickness and sheet metal, as those are the principal materials he needs to work.  This loan will help him to pay for the needed materials.  He will also see to the works that are under contract.
Juan's goal is to keep working to help his family, and he hopes to improve his earnings each day.

loans.use: to purchase iron in various sizes and sheet metal.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 45 years old and married with six children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. A caring lady, Yasmeen prefers staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She takes care of her family and makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to them by fulfilling their needs.
