Her husband runs a grocery store in the market where he sells daily household items such as cooking oil, spices, lentils etc. to his clients at reasonable rates. People prefer his store over any other because of his good behavior and quality items for sale. 

Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand their grocery store business. With the loan, her husband will put more groceries into his store for sale. He has been running this store for the past 8 years and Yasmeen is hopeful that the loan investment will be proved beneficial for him and raise their family’s living standard. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Uzima Group

texts.fr:
Chantal est une commerçante âgée de 42ans qui habite au quartier Buyenzi en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  gère son restaurant depuis 12 un métier qu’elle a commence alors qu’elle faisait des habits, des produits cosmétiques et des souliers. Elle est mariée à Ibrahim, un chauffeur. Ils ont ensemble  8 enfants dont 3 étudient. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaires.
 Elle demande le crédit pour augmenter son capital et agrandir le volume des services offerts dans son restaurant pour  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle espère que son business va se développer pour lui permettre de subvenir a ses besoins essentiels et construire sa propre maison parce qu’elle a une parcelle. 
Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« UZIMA».
texts.en:
Chantal is a 42-year-old businesswoman living in the neighborhood of Buyenzi en Marie in Bujumbura. She has run her restaurant for 12 years, a business that she launched when she was a seamstress and sold cosmetics and shoes. She is married to Ibrahim, a driver. Together they have eight children, of whom three attend school. Chantal studied until sixth grade in elementary school.

She applies for a loan to increase her working capital in order to offer more services in her restaurant and make more profit. She hopes that her business will grow and enable her to provide for her basic needs and build her own house, since she has a plot of land.

Chantal is a member of Uzima Solidarity Group.

loans.use: to increase her working capital in order to offer more services in her restaurant.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  is a married woman with four children, two of whom go to school.  She resides in a rented house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include food and rent.   Mary sells bananas and works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last ten years.  She sells her bananas at the market on a retail basis.

She has requested a loan of 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas for her stall.  Her major challenge is transportation.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Rosalvina

texts.es: Rosalvina, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 56 años de edad es una mujer campechana y muy trabajadora, esta  casada  con Juan 61 años de edad y fruto de su amorío tienen  04 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa. Rosalvina, cree que todavía no alcanzo la cima para dejar de trabajar y por ello se esmera por continuar y ofrecer lo mejor a sus queridos hijos. Expresa que a su edad no es impedimento para poder  sobresalir y  poner  su creatividad en el negocio. Es así que se dedica en la venta de diferentes productos, razón por la cual su tienda lleva el nombre de multiservicios Rosalvina, donde ofrece el servicio de Fotocopias, anillados, espiralados, venta de cuadernos  y un stand de artículos personales y para el hogar. Menciona que al ofrecer variedad de mercadería le es más favorable porque sus clientes encuentran lo que necesitan en un solo lugar. Su negocio esta situado en su propio domicilio en el populoso distrito de Quimbiri, donde viene ofreciendo sus productos desde hace 11 años; le gusta  este negocio por que le favorece crecer  económicamente y a la vez socializarse con todo tipo de personas. Sus hijos son los pilares, para que su negocio sobresalga hacia delante. Los planes que tiene es abastecerse de mercadería  y no caer en la escasez. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y por lo cual necesita el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir creciendo, además se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito solicitado comprará  útiles de escritorio para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Rosalvina, who is a native of the city of Quimbiri, is 56 years old.  She is a straightforward woman and very hard-working.  She is married to 61 year old Juan, and they have 4 children, fruit of their love.  They all live together in their own home.  Rosalvina believes that she still hasn't reached the point of retiring.  And so she does her best to continue working and offering the best to her dear children.  She expressed that her age is no impediment to succeeding or putting creativity into her business. She makes her living selling different products, which is why her store is called "Multiservicios Rosalvina" (Rosalvina's Multi-Services).  Her store offers photocopy and spiral binding services, sells notebooks and has a stand for personal and household items.  She notes that offering a variety of merchandise is better for her because her customers can find everything they need in just one place.  Her business is located in her home, in the highly populated Quimbiri District.  She has been selling her products and services for 11 years.  Rosalvina likes her business because it allows her to grow economically and at the some time to socialize with all sorts of people.  Rosalvina's children are the pillars on which rest her desire for her business to succeed.  Her plans are to stock up with merchandise and not fall into shortage.  This will be Rosalvina's second loan with MFP, and she needs all of your help to keep growing.  In addition, she promises to comply with her repayment schedule.  With the requested loan, she will purchase office supplies to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pareja John de 29 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Yovana anteriormente laboraba como empleada domestica, pero siempre anhelaba tener su propio negocio. Con sus ahorros acumulados pudo abrir un bazar de venta de ropa, actualmente su puesto es muy concurrido por sus clientes por ofrecer prendas de primera calidad. Ella es una persona muy atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes cordialmente dispuesta a servirles en sus compras, para que así puedan estar satisfechos y retornen nuevamente. Su negocio es muy ordenado y apreciado por su clientela; su comercio lo realiza en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde la atención es de primera calidad, el trabajo lo cumple en compañía de su pareja donde vienen trabajando 06 años. Los proyectos que tiene en mente,  es alquilar un espacio más en el centro comercial para así mejorar y crecer económicamente. Este será su 12avo crédito, esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir creciendo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará prendas de vestir y para ello tiene que  viajar a la ciudad de lima, pues el comercio de esta mercadería es a bajo precio.
texts.en: Yovana, who is 24 years old, is a charismatic and hard-working woman.  She lives in a rented house together with her partner, 29-year old John, and their 3 dear children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life.  Yovana previously worked as a maid, but she always wished to have her own business.  With her accumulated savings, she was able to open a clothing bazaar.  Currently, her stand is very popular with her customers because she offers high quality clothing.  Yovana is a very attentive person and she always greets her customers cordially, ready to help them with their purchases.  This way, her customers are satisfied and come back again.  Yovana's business is very orderly and valued by her customers.  Her business is in the city of San Francisco, where the service is first rate.  She has worked in the company of her partner for the last 6 years.  The project she has in mind is to rent another space in the commercial district in order to improve and grow economically.  This will be her 12th loan, and she is very happy to know that she once again can count on the support of all of you to keep growing.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles (USD $725), she will purchase clothing.  To do so, Yovana needs to travel to the city of Lima, which where is the sale of this merchandise has a lower price.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children , three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She owns a food stall at  Wandegeya market and works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. 

Esther has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more fruits and  vegetables, like baskets of tomatoes, onions and bananas. Esther works from the market and sells to all categories of people. Her major challenges include transportation and perishability. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of tomatoes, onions and bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new cell phones and accessories such as face plates, chargers, cell phone holders and cell phone protectors.

loans.name: Riazan's Group

texts.en:
Riazan is 40 years old and married with four children. Her children stay at home and don’t do anything. Riazan unfortunately, couldn’t give them a proper education due to financial constraints. 

She is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She takes care of her children and fulfills their needs. 

Her husband operates a grocery store business. In his store, he sells daily household items such as lentils, spices, rice, etc. to his clients at reasonable rates. His business earns him good income every month which allows him to manage the household expenses. 

Riazan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband's business. Being the only breadwinner, his establishment in business is very necessary because the children are growing up now and their needs are also increasing. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity to offer more products to his clients and increase his profits. 

She is very hopeful that the loan will bring positive financial changes and improve the living standard of her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Riazan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: William Alonso

texts.es:
William, es empleado y propietario de una dulcería, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad,  tiene 9 años de ser empleado y el negocio de la dulcería lo inicio hace un año.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la dulcería como azúcar, canela, colorantes, con este préstamo tendrá mayor disponibilidad para elaborar la venta.
Para él, su objetivo es tener un local propio en el centro de la ciudad, que le permita crecer y generar mayores ventas.
texts.en:
William is a clerk and an owner of a sweet-shop.  He lives with his wife and their two children, who are 9 and 3 years old.  He has been a clerk for 9 years and he opened the sweet-shop one year ago.
William is requesting the loan to purchase materials for the sweet-shop such as sugar, cinnamon and food coloring.  With this loan, he will have greater availability to make sweets for sale.
William's goal is to have his own store in the city center, which would allow his business to grow and generate greater sales.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his sweet-shop such as sugar, cinnamon and food coloring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase bulk quantities of snacks, beverages, meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, basic grains, cereal, flour, cornmeal, margarine, butter, cooking oil, toilet paper, soap, personal hygiene products, and household cleaning products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children.  All of them go to school. She doesn't take care of  additional family members.  She sells vegetables at the market and works seven days a week.  She has been in the business for the last six years.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of boxes of tomatoes from the villages.  Margaret aspires to grow vegetables herself.  She resides in a rented house and does not have access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Yolisa

texts.es: Yoliza de 29 años de edad, convive con Román de 39, con quien tiene 3 hijos que les llena de satisfacción;  ellos viven en su casa propia  ubicada en el  distrito de Pichari. Perseverante y trabajadora desde niña, junto a sus queridos padres, inicio la actividad del negocio como ambulante. Con el tiempo juntó un buen capital lo cual la ayudó su propia  tienda de prendas de vestir. Yoliza esta  feliz  con el negocio que ella ejerce, por que gracias a ello es que puede darle una buena educación a sus tres menores hijos, quienes también lo apoyan en la venta. En un futuro desea tener una cadena de tiendas, pero para realizar este anhelado sueño debe esforzarse para obtener un buen capital. Es por esta razón que ella recurre a MFP a solicitar su segundo crédito, por el que se compromete a pagar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para cumplir con sus objetivos. Con los 2.000  nuevos soles ella adquirirá más prendas para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Yoliza is 29 years old and lives with 39 year-old Román.  They have three children who fill them with satisfaction.  They live in their own home which is located in Pichari district.

Persistent and hard-working since she was a girl, Yoliza started out in this business, alongside her beloved parents, as an itinerant vendor.  Over time, she gathered together a good sum of money which helped her to open her own clothes store.  Yoliza is happy with the business that she runs because, thanks to the business, she is able to provide her three dependent children, who support her in making her sales, with a good education.

In the future, Yoliza would like to own a chain of stores but, in order to achieve this dream, she must work hard in order to gather together a good sum of money.  For this reason, she came to MFP to request her second loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in helping her achieve her goals.

Yoliza will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to acquire more clothes with which to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña María del Socorro pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Ostinal.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo ₡600 000 (Seiscientos mil colones), ya que los miembros de la empresa necesitan respaldar mejor los documentos y brindar un mejor servicio a los socios de la empresa, por medio de la compra de dos computadores e impresoras.
Ella asegura que la demanda de crédito a aumentado muchísimo y que por eso es necesario invertir en tecnología para que la empresita crezca.
Doña María de Socorro asegura que está empresa ha apoyado efectivamente las necesidades de los miembros de la ECC, y da oportunidad de crecimiento y bienestar a los socios.
texts.en:
María del Socorro belongs to the Ostinal community credit enterprise (CCE) and is requesting a loan for 600,000 CRC. Membership has grown significantly, and the CCE needs to maintain good customer service by better documenting client information. María  hopes to do this by buying two computers and printers.

Demand for credit has grown so much that María believes the CCE must invest in technology to continue growing. She is confident that the organization has been effectively meeting the needs of its clients and providing its members with opportunities for growth and success.

loans.use: To purchase laptop and PC computers.

loans.name: Las Divinas De Ojo De Agua Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LAS DIVINAS DE OJO DE AGUA", PORQUE SON UNAS MUJERES DIVINAS Y ESTAN EN LA COMUNIDAD DE OJO DE AGUA EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES, LA SEÑORA MARGARITA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, TIENE 42 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL TERCER AÑO DE PRIMARIA, TIENE 2 HIJOS UNO DE 14 Y OTRO DE 16 AÑOS DE EDAD. LA SEÑORA QUIERE EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR SABANAS, COLCHAS, COBERTORES, COBIJAS Y COLCHAS. HACE TRES AÑOS INICIO UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EL CUAL CONSISTE EN SALIR A VENDER SU MERCANCIA (SABANAS, COBIJAS COLCHAS, COBERTORES, EDREDONES ETC). ELLA SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO YA QUE DEBIDO A LA TEMPORADA DE LLUVIAS INCREMENTARAN SUS VENTAS Y ES LA TEMPORADA EN LA QUE SU NEGOCIO LE DEJA MUY BUENAS GANANCIAS CON LAS CUALES QUIERE EMPESAR A CONSTRUIR UN LOCAL PARA FIJAR SU NEGOCIO, PARTE DE LAS GANANCIAS LAS UTILIZARA PARA LA EDUCACION DE SUS HIJOS Y PUEDAN TENER UN MEJOR FUTURO.
texts.en:
This group is called "LAS DIVINAS DE OJO DE AGUA" ("The Divine Women of Ojo de Agua"), because they are a few divine women and they live in the community of Ojo de Agua in the State of Mexico.  The group is made up of nine members.  Señora Margarita is the president of the group.  She is 42 years old, and has studied up to the third year of primary education.  She has two children, one aged 14 and another aged 16.

The Señora wants the loan in order to buy sheets, bedspreads, covers, blankets and bedspreads.  She started a small business three years ago, which consists of going out and selling her merchandise (sheets, blankets, bedspreads, covers, quilts, etc.)  She is looking for the loan to invest in her business, the sales of which increase due to the rainy season.  This is the season in which her business earns very good profits, with which she wants to start construction on a place to use as a setting for her business.  She will use part of the earnings for the education of her children, so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, covers,blankets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Iratwibutse I Group

texts.fr:
Esperance est une commerçante âgée de 28ans qui habite Gatumba en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (comme les choux,les oignons et tomates) depuis  2ans un métier qu’elle a commence alors qu’elle pratiquait le commerce ambulant des ustensiles de cuisine. Elle est mariée à Jean-Paul, un chauffeur. Ils ont ensemble  3 enfants qui étudient. Elle prend en charge 2 autres enfants de sa famille proche.Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaires.
Son crédit de 150,000frans burundais va contribuer a augmenter son capital et agrandir le volume des achats de produits alimentaires pour revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« IRATWIBUTSE I».
texts.en:
Espérance is a 28-year-old merchant living in the neighborhood of Gatumba in the municipality of Bujumbura. She has been selling foodstuff (like cabbages, onions and tomatoes) for two years, a business that she launched when she sold kitchen utensils from door to door. She is married to Jean-Paul, a driver. Together they have three children who attend school. She cares also for two children of her close relatives. Espérance studied until sixth grade in elementary school.

She will use her share of 150,000 Burundi francs in the group loan to increase her working capital in order to buy more food products for sale and make a large profit.

Espérance is a member of the community group of Iratwibutse I.

loans.use: to increase her working capital in order to buy more food products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide for his second crop of corn

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria de  31 años de edad convive con Mauro de 34 años, y fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hermosos niños, con quienes vive en su casa propia del distrito de Pichari. Ella tiene un taller de carpintería que juntamente con su esposo sacan adelante dicho taller, ya que en anteriores años ellos  laboraban en la agricultura, pero no le generaba la rentabilidad que deseaban. En la actualidad trabaja fabricando muebles que sus clientes previamente solicitan, por ello se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que le inspira mucha creatividad e innovación cuando quiere hacer un mueble de acuerdo a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Es por ello que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que lo otorga buenos resultados. En el futuro quiere implementar su carpintería adquiriendo herramientas innovadoras que lo puedan ayudar a fabricar más muebles en un tiempo record. Es por tal razón que recurre a MFP para solicitar un nuevo crédito para poder realizar su más ansiado anhelo. Este será su segundo crédito por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para desarrollar su negocio. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles Demetria comprará herramientas para trabajar con mas eficiencia.
texts.en:
31-year old Demetria lives with 34-year old Mauro and their four lovely children. They live in their own house in Pichari district. Demetria runs a carpentry workshop with her husband. Previously they worked on the land but this did not provide them with the income they wanted.

Now Demetria makes furniture that has been previously ordered by her customers. She is happy with this work as it allows her to be creative and innovative in accordance with the taste and preferences of her customers. The business is doing well and she is getting good results.

In the future Demetria wishes to expand the business and buy innovative tools which will allow her to make more furniture in record time. For this reason she approached Kiva partner MFP to ask for a new loan so she can achieve this long-awaited dream. This will be her second loan and she is greatly looking forward to help from donors so that she can develop her business. With the 2,000 soles Demetria will buy tools so that she can work more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy tools for her furniture-making workshop

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a married woman with six children, all of whom go to school. She does not care for additional family members. She operates a beauty salon in Kikoni, a Kampala suburb, and works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 8 years. 

Milly has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more weaves, oils and braids. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She resides in a rented house and has access to electricity but not piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family .

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La apreciable señora Carmen es una persona  responsable  y  muy  trabajadora que se dedica al comercio desde hace ya  hace  mas  de un año, ella  tiene   una  tienda  de  abarrotes  que   actualmente  la  tiene  en su  domicilio y   junto  a  su  esposo   atienden  su   negocio, en esta  ocasión  requieren  de nuestra ayuda para   realizar la compra  de mercancía    ya que  ellos  desean   invertir  en  un  mayor  numero de productos  para    poder   ofrecer a  sus  clientes un  mejor servicio,  estan  muy  agradecidos por   el  apoyo  brindado  para la realización de su proyecto   ya  que  este  negocio  representa  una de  las  maneras  en las  que  obtienen  sus ingresos   para  sacar  adelante   a  sus  tres  pequeños  los  cuales  son lo  mas importante  en su  vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is a responsible and hardworking woman who has run her business for more than a year. She has a grocery store which she currently runs from her home. Both she and her husband help with the store. 

They are now asking for our help so they can buy a wider variety of merchandise so they have a better range to offer their customers. They are very grateful for this support, as their store represents one of the ways they earn money to help their three young children get ahead in life. The children are the most important part of their lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: La Luna 2 Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LA LUNA 2", PORQUE ESTA UBICADO EN EL CERRO Y DESDE AHI SE PUEDE APRECIAR PERFECTAMENTE LA LUNA LO CUAL LES ENCANTA. LA SEÑORA VERONICA ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO, TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA SEXTO AÑO DE PRIMARIA, SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE ARTESANIAS COMO MANTELES Y SERVILLETAS BORDADAS, NEGOCIO QUE INICIO DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS. TIENE 2 HIJOS, UNO DE 15 Y 13 AÑOS DE EDAD. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA REINVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO YA QUE SE APROXIMA LA FERIA DEL PUEBLO Y ES CUANDO VENDE GRAN PARTE DE SUS CREACIONES. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE ENTUSIASMADA YA QUE PODRA INVERTIR EN TELAS, HILOS, AHUJAS, GANCHOS Y PLANTILLAS PARA LAS FIGURAS QUE PLASMARA EN SUS MANTELES; CON ESTO PLANEA HACER BASTANTES ARTICULOS PARA VENDER EN LA FERIA; CON LAS GANANCIAS OBTENIDAS QUIERE HACER MAS GRANDE SU NEGOCIO Y UTILIZARA PARTE DE ESTAS GANANCIAS PARA LA EDUCACION DE SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Luna 2" ("The Moon 2"), because they are located on a hillside and from there you can clearly see the moon which so enchants them.  Señora Veronica is the treasurer of the group.  She is 33 years old and has studied up to the sixth year of primary school.  She works in creating craftwork such as embroidered tablecloths and napkins, a business which she started 5 years ago.  She has 2 children, one aged 15 and one aged 13.

She is requesting the loan to reinvest in her business, because they are approaching the time of the village festival which is when she sells most of her creations.  At the time of applying for this loan she feels enthusiastic, and that she will be able to invest in fabrics, yarns, needles, hooks and patterns for the images she features on her tablecloths.  With this plan she will make plenty of articles to sell at the festival; with the profits obtained she wants to make her business bigger and she will use part of these profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to invest in fabrics, yarns, needles, hooks and patterns.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Commerçante de céréales (mil, mais, haricot) depuis 1995, Kossiwa s’approvisionne à Badou et revend à domicile et dans les différents marchés.  Son mari est chauffeur. Elle veut ce premier crédit pour renforcer son activité. Elle a 01 enfant.
texts.en: Kossiwa has been a merchant selling cereals (millet, corn and beans) since 1995. She gets her supplies in Badou and sells them out of her home and at the various markets in the neighborhood. Her husband is a driver. Kossiwa applies for her first loan to strengthen her activity. She is the mother of one child.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Mohamed est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse.
Mohamed a travaillé comme revendeur depuis 2007. Il vend des matériels d'électricité. Il achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Mohamed a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 2 douzaines de disjoncteurs originaux, 5 cartons d'ampoules ordinaires et 2 rouleaux de fil.
texts.en: Mohamed is a 28-year-old man. His wife is a retailer. Mohamed, too, has been a retailer since 2007. He sells electrical equipment. He gets his supplies at the Great Market in Lomé. Mohamed came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for his first loan to buy 2 dozens of original circuit-breakers, 5 boxes of standard bulbs and 2 rolls of cord.

loans.use: to buy electrical equipment.

loans.name: Amematuna

texts.fr:
Amematuna est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire en fonction. Ils ont deux enfants.  
Amematuna a travaillé comme couturière depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits vivriers dans une boutique à son domicile. Elle achète les produits aux marchés d'intérieur du pays. Une personne l'aide avec son travail.
Amematuna a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 4 sacs de mais, 2 sacs d'haricots, 1 sac d'arachides et 1 tas d'ignames.
texts.en:
Amematuna is 29 years old. She is married to a career soldier. They have two children.

Amematuna has been a seamstress since 2007. She sells food products out of her home-based store. She buys her supplies at the markets in inland cities of the country. She has hired someone to help her.

Amematuna came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her second loan to buy 4 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans, 1 sack of groundnuts and 1 pile of yams.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Iratwibutse 2 Group

texts.fr:
Angélique est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite Gatumba en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  fait le commerce ambulant des ustensiles de cuisine et articles de ménage depuis  2ans. Elle est mariée à Israël, un chauffeur. Ils ont ensemble  4 enfants qui étudient. Elle prend en charge 2 autres enfants de sa famille proche. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaires.
Son crédit de 180,000frans burundais va contribuer a augmenter son capital et agrandir le volume des achats des ustensiles de cuisine et articles ménagers a revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« IRATWIBUTSE II».
texts.en:
Angélique is a 29-year-old merchant who lives in Gatumba, in Bujumbura, the capital. She has been going door-to-door selling kitchen supplies and equipment for two years. She is married to Israël, a driver, and they have four children in school. She supports two other children from her extended family. She  has a 6th grade education. 

Angélique’s loan of 180,000 Burundi francs is going to help increase her capital and the volume of kitchen and household goods she can purchase to be sold, so as to make bigger profits. She is a member of the community group “IRATWIBUTSE II”.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy a greater volume of kitchen utensils and household goods to sell

loans.name: Kokui

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités (riz, sucre, huile végétale) depuis 2000, Kokui est mère de 03 enfants. Elle a 34ans et a pour époux conducteur de taxi. Madame s’approvisionne d’habitude au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique à DJIDJOLE. Ce troisième  prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises vu que son stock s’épuise pour vendre à sa clientèle.
texts.en: Selling staple goods (rice, sugar, vegetable oil) since 2000, Kokui is the mother of three children. She is 34 and her husband is a taxi driver. She usually buys her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé and sells them in her little store in DJIDJOLE. This third loan will serve to buy merchandise, in view of the fact that she is running low on goods to sell to her clientele.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad, el aprendió el oficio de la siembra hace 20 años, ya que ayudaba a su padre a realizar esta labor, su horario de trabajo es de 4:00am a 11:00am, él alquila terrenos para poder cultivar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprarse abono y fertilizantes para la milpa, con esta inversión tendrá una mejor cosecha, esperando que el clima le ayude para que todo el proceso sea exitoso.
Su objetivo es realizar una buena inversión con el préstamo, que al final del periodo su cultivo sea provechoso y le permita dar a su familia una seguridad alimenticia y con la comercialización de la cosecha también generar ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio is a farmer and he lives with his wife.  They have two children, 11 and 4 years old.  He learned to sow seed 20 years ago while helping his father do it.  His work hours are from 4:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.  He rents land to farm.
He is currently applying for a loan to purchase manure and fertilizers for corn.  His crop will be better due to this investment as long as the weather is favorable so that the whole process is successful.
His goal is to make a good investment with the loan.  He hopes his crops are profitable and they allow him to provide nourishment for his family and also generate income.

loans.use: purchase manure and fertililzaers for corn.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina de 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su menor hijo de 6 años de edad en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Dina  nunca olvidará aquellas tardes de su juventud, en las que observaba a sus abuelos a remover la tierra y a la vez poner las  semillas de cacao. Es por ello que de ahí en adelante apostó por la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, para así sacarle el jugo al legado de sus abuelos. Esto lo realizaba en su parcela, introduciendo nuevas técnicas de cultivo, y con el apoyo de su familia, además contaba con peones que contrataba para la temporada de cosecha. Actualmente el cacao tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello que se siente satisfecha por las ganancias que recibe al vender su producto en Centros de Acopio de su localidad. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 mil nuevos soles ella contratará peones para que le ayuden a limpiar su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
25 year-old Dina is a single mother who lives with her 6 year-old son, in a rental house, in Pichari district.  Dina will never forget the afternoons of her youth when she watched her grandparents turn over the soil and plant cacao seeds.  This is why she chose to work in farming, specifically growing cacao, in order to make the most of her grandparents' legacy.  She does this work on her own plot of land, introducing new growing techniques and with the support of her family.  She also hires laborers during the harvest season.

Cacao is currently in great demand both at a national and international level.  For this reason, Dina feels satisfied with the profits that she makes when she sells her product to the middlemen in her town.  This will be her second loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.

Dina will use these 2,000 Peruvian soles to hire laborers to help her weed her cacao plantings.

loans.use: to hire laborers to weed her cacao plantings

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités (riz, sucre, huile végétale) et des oignons depuis 2009, Kossiwa est mère de 01 enfant. Elle a 41ans et a pour époux maçon. Madame s’approvisionne d’habitude au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique (DIEU BENIT). Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises.
texts.en: Having sold staples (rice, sugar, vegetable oil) and onions since 2009, Kossiwa is the mother of one child. She is 41 and her husband is a mason. She usually buys her merchandise at the Grand Market in Lomé and sells her goods in her shop (DIEU BENIT). This loan will be used to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Nelson Adrian

texts.es:
La chatarra y los productos reciclables son los insumos para el negocio de Nelson Adrian, quien desde hace algún tiempo decidió recibirlos y transformarlos para la venta y así obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, este emprendedor inició su negocio hace algunos años en el municipio de Concordia de donde es oriundo pero con el propósito de abrir su mercado y mejorar su calidad de vida decidió mudarse para Santa Bárbara también al norte de Antioquia donde actualmente tienen su negocio. 
 
Nelson Adrian necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina para cortar el hierro, un soldador para abrochar su conocimiento y elaborar piezas metálicas, así como para comprar algunos productos reciclables.
texts.en:
Scrap and recyclable materials are the supplies for the business of Nelson Adrian, who some time ago decided to receive these things and transform them for sale.  In this way he gets the income he needs to cover his basic requirements.  This entrepreneur started his business a few years ago in the municipality of his native Concord, but in order to expand his market and improve his quality of life he decided to relocate to Santa Barbara, also in northern Antioquia, which is where he currently has his business.

Nelson Adrian needs a loan to buy a machine for cutting iron, a soldering iron for fastening and preparation of metal parts according to his knowledge, as well as to buy some recyclable materials.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un menuisier-maçon. Ils ont un enfant.  
Afi a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle vend de pagne et fait la couture. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une machine à coudre et de pagne.
texts.en:
Afi is a woman of 38. She is married to a carpenter/mason and they have one child. 
 
Afi has worked at selling goods since 1996. She sells lengths of African print cloth and does sewing. She buys her products at the Grand Market in Lomé.

Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy a sewing machine and African print cloth.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 13, 10, 5 años de edad y un sobrino de 5 años, el cual está a su cargo, ella administra el negocio desde hace un año, su horario de venta es de 6:00am a 2:00pm, fue por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de trabajar, compro mercadería y se instalo con el puesto de venta.
Ella actualmente necesita mercadería para surtir el negocio, solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en prendas de vestir como calcetines, ropa interior, blusas y ropa de niños, este financiamiento es muy importante para ella, pues es la única manera de crecer con su negocio, tratando de sus ganancias pagar las cuotas y comprando la alimentación para sus hijos.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente, crecer con clientela y ventas, además de velar por sus hijos y el sobrino, y sus necesidades más importantes.
texts.en:
Teresa is a clothing vendor, she lives with her husband and three children who are 13, 10, and 5 years old, and a 5 year-old nephew who is in her care.  She has been managing the business for a year, and her sales hours are from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm.  It was of her own initiative that she bought merchandise and set herself up with a a stall, because of the need to work.

She currently needs merchandise to supply the business.  She is applying for a loan and will invest it in clothing like socks, underwear, blouses and children's clothing.  This financing is very important to her, as it is the only way to grow her business.  She is trying to pay her expenses and buy food for her children from her profits.

Her goal is to work hard, to increase customers and sales, as well as to look out for her children and nephew and their most important needs

loans.use: to buy clothes: socks, underwear, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Yawoa Mawunya

texts.fr:
Yawoa Mawunya est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant.
Yawoa Maurinya a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vende de pure water et quelques produits d'alimentation générale(sucre, riz, tomate) à son domicile.
Yawoa Maurinya a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 100 sachets de pure water, 200 unités de détergents, 2 bidons d'huile de palme, 48 unités de savons, 2 paquets de cubes et 4 sacs de riz.
texts.en: Yawoa Mawunya is a 32-year-old woman. She is unmarried and has one child. She has been working as a retailer since 2009. She sells Pure Water and a few grocery items (sugar, rice, tomatoes) out of her house. Yawoa Mawunya has requested her first loan with WAGES in order to buy 100 pouches of Pure Water, 200 units of detergent, 2 containers of palm oil, 48 units of soap, 2 packets of bouillon cubes, and 4 sacks of rice.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 59 años de edad y como padre de seis hijos, Omar ha sido un luchador incansable que desde muy joven ha trabajado para salir adelante y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, aunque este emprendedor y algunos de sus hijos han trabajado en minas de carbón en Amagá-Antioquia, teniendo en cuenta que este es un trabajo inestable y riesgoso, decidió crear su propio negocio, una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar. 
 
Omar necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido y mejorar el inventario de su tienda ya que actualmente cuenta con poca variedad para ofrecerle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
At 59 years old and as a father of 6 children, Omar has been a tireless fighter since he was very young. He has worked to get ahead and to meet his family's basic needs. Even though this businessman and some of his sons have worked in the coal mines in Amagá-Antioqui, he kept in mind that that work is unstable and dangerous, and decided to start his own business, a store with basic grocery goods.

Omar needs a loan to to buy products to stock his store and improve his inventory, since right now he doesn't have much variety to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store.

loans.name: Yawoavi

texts.fr: Patronne d’un salon de coiffure (GOD IS WINNER), Yawoavi a 34ans et maman d’01 enfant. Elle désire satisfaire ses clientes en leur vendant des mèches pour les rendre encore plus belle. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et revend dans son salon. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et elle est à son cinquième prêt. Son mari est gendarme et ils ont un enfant.
texts.en: The owner of a hair salon (GOD IS WINNER), Yawoavi is a 34-year-old mother of one child. She would like to satisfy her customers by selling them hair extensions for making them even more beautiful. She gets her supplies at the Lomé market and resells them in her salon. Yawoavi is a previous client of WAGES and is now on her fifth loan. Her husband is a policeman, and they have one child.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda de 51 años de edad, casada con manolo de 52 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos, por quienes debe de sacrificarse. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Ella se dedica al negocio agrícola, en donde produce y comercializa café a un precio competitivo, incluso ya tiene mucha presencia en su localidad, y los resultados en cuanto a ventas son positivas, con respecto a los años anteriores. Esto es debido a la  buena atención hacia sus clientes. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones,  para que lo faciliten en la extracción de su producto final. Normalmente su producto de café los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad, y su rutina laboral es de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es construir su casa a base de material noble, con la finalidad de que le pueda brindar seguridad y felicidad a su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella  se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su negocio. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles podrá contratar peones para que se encarguen de limpiar y cuidar su parcela.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 51 years old and married to Manolo, age 52. They have 4 children that they make sacrifices for. Together, they live in their own house in the Pichari district. She has an agricultural business where she produces and sells coffee at a competitive price. Compared to prior years, she has developed a strong reputation in her area and because of her good customer service she is seeing strong sales. In general she works alongside her husband, but during the harvest season, she takes charge of hiring laborers to facilitate the harvest of their final products. Typically they sell their coffee in common areas in their own community from Monday to Saturday between 7am and 6pm.  

In the future, she plans to build a house made of strong materials so that she can provide security and happiness to her family. This is the second loan with MFP, and she promises to repay punctually. For this reason, she is hopes for each of your support to continue repaying her loan. With the 2,000 nuevos soles she will be able to hire the laborers she needs to clean and care for her crops.

loans.use: Hire laborers to help her care for her land

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is married with four children. Her eldest son has a sofa cover making & fitting business. The next to him has a mobile phone shop. The third does a job in a bakery and the youngest one studies in 7th standard. 

Khalida herself is a housewife as well as a businesswoman. Along with her household work, she sells bangles to her community ladies and for babies. Her collection of bangles is famous among her clients. Her income allows her to share the financial burden with her husband. 

Her husband is involved in fruit selling as well as a grocery store business. He sells fruit primarily and secondly, he gives time to his grocery store. Both of his businesses gives him good profits but now he wants to invest money in his grocery store business for its further expansion. 

Therefore, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for his grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his store for selling. 

Khalida is hopeful that her husband’s business will expand further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Leidy Yuliana

texts.es:
Desde muy pequeña Leydi Yuliana a recibido de su padre grandes consejos que le han permitido tener iniciativas de vida para su crecimiento personal, es por esto que desde hace 2 años Leydi creó su propio de negocio de venta de mercancía, con él ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida, además de poder estudiar y así tener mayores conocimientos para su vida laboral.

Ella se sueña con con un negocios mucho mas grande que le genere mas ingresos y así poder ayudarle a su padre para que él puede descansar y realizar otras actividades.
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Leydi Yuliana has gotten wise advise from her father that has allowed her to take initiative in her personal growth. It is because of this that Leydi created her own business 2 years ago selling merchandise. With this business she has been able to improve her quality of life, as well as being able to study and have greater knowledge for her working life.

She dreams of having a much larger business that will bring in more income so that she can help her father and he can rest and do other things.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Brissawé

texts.fr:
Brissawé est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est marié å un comptable. Ils ont deux enfants.
Brissawé a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle vend de pagne et de bazin de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé et au Mali.
Brissawé a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 10 paires de bazin riche.
texts.en:
Brissawé is a 38-year-old woman. She is married to an accountant. They have two children.
Brissawé has worked as a retailer since 1996. She sells pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth) and damask door-to-door. She buys her goods at the Grand Market in Lomé and in Mali.
Brissawé has requested her second loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) in order to buy 10 sets of damask of the "riche" variety.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth) and damask.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio, es agricultor, está casado, vive con su esposa y tienen 5 hijos de 14, 12, 7, 4 años y una bebe de 6 meses de nacida, él trabaja sembrando maíz, frijol y maicillo, desde joven se ha dedicado a los cultivos, pues fue un oficio inculcado por su padre, el horario de trabajo es de 6:00am a 11:00am, este trabajo le permite dar la alimentación a sus hijos.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz y maicillo, su propósito es tener los materiales para iniciar la tarea de postrera, tiene la esperanza de que el invierno no sea exceso de agua o que tenga tiempos secos, pues cualquier de estos fenómenos dañaría la cosecha.
Su objetivo es tener fuerzas para trabajar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, dándoles la oportunidad de estudiar, de alimentarse y crecer sanos, ya que su familia es muy numerosa requiere de mucho esfuerzo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a farmer.  He is married and lives with his wife; they have 5 children aged 14, 12, 7, and 4 years old and a baby of 6 months.  He works planting corn, beans and sorghum.  He has worked with crops since he was young, as it was a profession instilled in him by his father.  His working hours are from 6:00 am to 11:00 am, and this work allows him to feed his children.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for the planting of corn and sorghum.   The purpose is to have the materials to begin the task of the second season of planting of the year.  He holds hope that the winter won't bring too much rain or dry times, as either of these phenomena would damage the crop.

His goal is to have the strength to work and raise his children, giving them the opportunity to study, eat and grow healthily.  As his family is very large, it requires a lot of effort to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the planting of corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda de 26 años de edad convive con Apolonio de 30 años, fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Para Leonarda  la clave del éxito está en la responsabilidad, puntualidad y en el respeto hacía sus clientes. A pesar de su corta edad, decidió emprender una pequeña tienda de ventas de prendas de vestir, con la necesidad de cubrir sus gastos familiares. Ella sabe que es el primer paso para cosechar muchos triunfos durante su travesía, para ello ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes, y esto debido al buen servicio que ofrece a sus compradores. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia y de vez en cuando recibe la ayuda de su esposo. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad y a pesar de obtener buenas ganancias económicas, ella planea en un futuro próximo ampliar su  tienda, introduciendo nuevos productos para cautivar a sus clientes. Este será su segundo crédito con  MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivas obligaciones. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Leonarda, aged 26 cohabits with Apolonio who is 30 years old.   From this relationship they have two children with whom they live in their own home, located in the district of Pichari.  For Leonarda, the key to success is responsibility, punctuality and respect for her customers. 

Despite her young age, she decided to start a small shop selling clothing, with the need to cover her family expenses. She knows that this is the first step to achieve many successes during her journey, for she already has a good customer base, and this is because of the good service she offers to her buyers. Generally she works on her own account, and occasionally she receives help from her husband.  Her sales take place in the same location and despite getting good economic returns, she plans in the near future to expand her store, introducing new products to captivate her customers. 

This will be her second loan with MFP, the obligations of which she agrees to comply with.  With the 2,000 New Soles that she is requesting, she plans to invest it in the purchase of merchandise to stock up her clothing store.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Komlagan

texts.fr: Agé de 32ans, et marié à une revendeuse de mèches, Komlagan est revendeur de pièces détachées. Ce montant lui servira de s’approvisionner en marchandises au Grand Marché de Lomé et de revendre dans sa boutique. Une personne l’aide dans l’exécution de ses taches.
texts.en: Komlagan is 32 years old, married to a retailer of hair extensions, and sells spare parts. This loan will allow him to obtain his supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé and resell them at his store. One person helps him in carrying out his tasks.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Revendeur de boissons et des produits d’alimentation, Kodzo a crée sa boutique (ETS BIEN) en 2005. Sa conjointe est également revendeuse et ils ont 02 enfants. Il est à son second prêt il sera lui servira à acheter des marchandises.
texts.en: A retailer of drinks and food products, Kodzo started his store (ETS BIEN) in 2005. His wife is also a retailer and they have two children. He is on his second loan, which will serve to buy merchandise for the store.

loans.use: To buy canned drinks and biscuits.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Yamid

texts.es:
HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS JUAN YAMID TRABAJA LA MADERA CON ESTA LABOR HA PODIDO SOSTENER SU FAMILIA Y HA PODIDO DARLES UNA BUENA CALIDAD DE VIDA.

EL QUIERE TENER UNA MAQUINA NUEVA QUE LE FACILITE SU TRABAJO Y ADEMÁS ASI PODER OFRECER OTROS SERVICIOS PARA SUS CLIENTES, DE ESTA FORMA SE INCREMENTAN SUS INGRESOS Y ASI PODER MEJORAR CADA DÍA SU VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
For more than 10 years Juan Yamid has practiced woodworking. With this job he has been able to take care of his family and give them a good quality of life.

He wants to get a new machine that will make his job easier and so that he can offer his customers other services. This will increase his income and allow him to improve his life and that of his family every day.

loans.use: to buy a machine.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a married woman with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family.  She has a retail shop and works seven days a week. She has been in business for a long time.  

She has requested a loan of 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more merchandise, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap for her retail shop. Justine’s major business challenges are transportation and defaulters. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a mason. Nana has completed junior high school. She cooks food such as banku and rice, which she sells in Abura. Banku is a staple made from corn and it is normally eaten with okra stew. Nana serves the rice with tomato sauce.

Nana uses her income to assist her husband in the education of her children. She will use this loan to purchase bags of rice, tomatoes, fresh pepper, corn and other items to cook. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to build a restaurant. In the picture above, she is at the kitchen where she prepares the food before going to sell. At the time of the visit, she had finished selling for the day and so she demonstrated how the banku is prepared.

loans.use: to purchase rice, tomatoes, fresh pepper, corn and other items to cook.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has a talent for preparing embroidered dresses. She learned the skill of embroidery from her mother in her teenage years. Before her marriage, she took advantage of her skills and she has continued it after her marriage as well. 

She does this work for her family so they have a better standard of living. Her family respects her a lot for her caring behavior towards them.  Her husband is involved in an animal feed selling business. He sells animal feed to those who are involved in the livestock business. They are his regular customers.  

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animal feed in larger quantity for resale. Surriya is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband’s business will improve further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jorge Washington

texts.es:
Jorge Washington tiene 26 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, trabaja en tereenos de los padres. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos para la produccion de maiz y arroz.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. No enfrentan desafios muy immportantes. Su sueño es comprar terrenos propios para trabajar.

Le gusta salir a caminar con la familia y realizar compras en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jorge Washington is 26 years old, he is married and lives with his wife and children.  He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Province of Los Rios.  

This group is called SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, and it is located in the Sibimbe precinct which is part of the Ventanas Canton.  This group has 20 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice.

Jorge works in agriculture, planting corn and rice.  He works on his parents' land.  He makes purchase in Ventanas every month and sells at the market in the same locality.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of products for the farming of corn and rice.  The support from this loan would help him financially to meet his needs.  They are not facing any very important challenges. His dream is to buy his own land to work.

He likes to go for walks with his family and to make purchases in the market.

loans.use: to buy products for the farming of corn and rice.

loans.name: Etsa Agossi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits congelés, depuis 2010, Etsa a 02 enfants et son conjoint est comptable. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des ailes de poule, de dinde…  elle achète à Lomé et revend à son domicile. Elle a 26ans.
texts.en: A retailer of frozen goods since 2010, Etsa has two children and her husband is an accountant. She is seeking her first loan to buy chicken wings, turkey wings, etc. She buys her goods in Lomé and re-sells them at home. She is 26 years old.

loans.use: To buy frozen goods and various other items.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: In this picture, Maame is seen with different types of soaps that she sells in Ankaful-fie, a village near Abura in Cape Coast.  She has been in the soap business for 3 years. Maame plans to use this loan to increase the quantity of soaps she acquires for sale. As part of her business plans, she hopes to reinvest the profit into the business. Maame is married to a farmer and together they live with their 6 children.

loans.use: to buy more soaps to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy uniforms, shoes and educational materials for her children

loans.name: Nelia

texts.es: Nelia de 34 años de edad, casado con Emilio de 39, que fruto de esta relación  tienen 4 hermosos hijos, por los que Nelia trabaja arduamente. Nelia desde muy joven trabajaba en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, actividad que lo realiza en la casa de su madre. Para ella es muy importante este trabajo ya que así se genera  ingresos económicos para el sostén de su familia. Con el tiempo fue ahorrando capital que le sirvió para comprar su propio terreno, logrando construir su propia casa, acondicionando un espacio para su tienda. Por ahora anhela abrir su propia tienda para ello espera abastecerlo de variados productos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete hacer puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su negocio. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles adquirirá nuevos productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Nelia is 34 years old and married to Emilio, age 39. Their relationship resulted in four beautiful children, which is why Nelia works so hard. Ever since she was a young woman, Nelia has worked at a store selling basic necessities. She operates this business from her mother’s house. This business is very mportant to her because it generates income to sustain her family. Over time she saved enough capital to buy her own land, build a house of her own, and renovate a space for her store. Now she wants to open a store in her own space and hopes to stock it with different products.

This will be her second loan with MFP. Nelia promises to be punctual with her loan payments. She hopes to receive everyone’s support so that she can continue her business. This loan of 2000 PEN will be used to acquire new products to stock her store.

loans.use: to acquire merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: For the past 10 years, Aba has been cooking food for sale. She cooks foods like jollof rice (rice cooked in tomato sauce), plain rice and wakye (rice and beans). She also sells palm oil. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a security man. As part of her responsibilities, she helps to provide for the basic needs of her family. Aba will use the loan to purchase more rice, tomatoes and other items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans build a better place where she can sell. In this photograph, Aba is dishing out some of the cooked jollof.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, tomatoes and other items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 39ans, Komlan aime rendre belle toute personne. Il a ouvert  en 1999 son salon de couture et en même temps vend des produits de mercerie et des habits cousus. Il est papa de 02 enfants et sa femme est revendeuse. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des produits de mercerie. Il a une ambition devenir un couturier de renom.
texts.en: A young man aged 39, Komlan likes making everyone beautiful. He opened his dressmaking shop in 1999, and at the same time has been selling haberdashery items and sewn clothing. He is the father of two children and his wife is a retailer. He is seeking this loan to buy haberdashery goods. His ambition is to become a well-known designer.

loans.use: To buy fabric and pagnes (a type of West African cloth).

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has 4 children. She has been selling rice and other food items such as onions, garden eggs, etc. in Abura for 3 years. Her husband is a driver. To assist her husband, Ama provides food and clothing for the family's daily needs.  Ama is going to use this loan to purchase bags of rice and onions to resell. The profits from her business as a result of the loan will be used to build a store room.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and onions to resell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Married to a driver, Adjoa bakes bread for distribution at Ankaful-fie, a village near Abura. She has been in the bakery business for four years. She wishes to increase the quantities of bread supplied to her customers; a loan from Kiva will help her buy the ingredients to be used to bake to increase her sales. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional oven. She is standing close to the oven she uses to bake.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to be used in baking to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary  is a married woman with six children, three of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. Mary sells bananas. She has been in business for the last five years. Mary sells her bananas in the market.  She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more  bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Esi sells tubers of yams (as shown in the picture) in Abura, which she has done for six years. She also makes banku, which is made from maize. She is showing the corn dough she uses for the banku in her right hand. Esi uses her income to support her partner in the education of her children. The loan, when received, will be added to her initial capital for the sale of yams. Esi plans to plow the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: to add to her initial capital for the sale of yams.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la venta D. mariscos variados, vive con su esposo y su nieto D. 15 años D. edad, ella inicio el negocio hace 17 años, en el lugar D. residencia, cuenta con mucha experiencia pues este negocio ya que es el que le permitió crecer a sus hijos y educarlos, dándole las ganancias necesarias.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprarse pescado, calamar, langosta y camarones, con esta inversión aumentara su mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes, que los mariscos estén frescos para generar mayor atracción.
Las aspiraciones D. Rosa es aumentar sus ventas, que el negocio mejore cada día, poder ser puntual con los pagos D. este préstamo y contar con todo lo necesario en su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa sells a variety of seafood. She lives with her husband and 15-year-old grandson. Rosa started her business 17 years ago from her home. She has extensive experience in this business and it has allowed her to raise and educate her children using the profits she has earned.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy fish, squid, lobster, and shrimp. This investment will increase the inventory that she offers to her customers. By offering fresh seafood, she will be able to attract more customers.

Rosa aspires to increase her sales and improve her business each day so that she can submit her loan payments on time and acquire everything she needs for her home.

loans.use: to purchase fish, squid, lobster, and shrimp.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is divorced and has six children. Efua sells bags of charcoal and maize in Abura, which she has done for four years. She makes sure that the children are fed, educated and sheltered with the earnings she makes from her sales. 

A loan of 700 Ghana cedis, when received, would be invested in the purchase of bags of maize. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest for future growth. 

She is squatting close to a bag of maize.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of bags of maize.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia sells gari and oranges in Abura. She has received a junior-high education. She is married and has two children. Her spouse is a security man. Cynthia has been selling gari and oranges for just two years. She responsibly supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fruit to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Mr Kodjo est vendeur  et réparateur  d’appareils portables. Il a une entreprise nommée « OLIVE.COM » depuis 2007. Sa femme est revendeuse. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des portables afin de revendre. Il voulait ajouter d’autres activités complémentaires afin de mieux assurer l’avenir de ses futurs enfants.
texts.en: Mr Kodjo sells and repairs portable phones. He has had an enterprise he calls « OLIVE.COM » since 2007. His wife is a merchant. He is requesting this loan to buy cell phones to resell. He would like to add other complementary activities so as to assure the future of the children he hopes to have.

loans.use: to buy portable telephones.

loans.name: Ghafooran's Group

texts.en:
Ghafooran is 46 years old and married with two children. Both of her kids are enrolled in a school and getting an education. She is a supportive lady by nature. Besides her household work, she helps her husband in his dairy business.  

They both get up early in the morning, get milk from the buffalo and then her husband goes to the milk shops and community clients to sell the milk. He sells milk at reasonable rates, and that’s why he has good clients in the region. He has been in this profession for the past 20 years. In this number of years, he has got good reputation among his clients.  

Ghafooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo to increase the milk productivity and improve his sales. She is hopeful that another buffalo will not only be an asset for his business but also help him in improving their financial condition.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a sanitary officer. She trades in soft drinks as well as fries fish for sale (as seen in the picture above).  She has done this in Abura for 2 years. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the education of her children. Esi will use the loan to purchase additional fish to fry to meet the demands of her customers. As part of her future plans, she hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a peddler in oats, bowls and cooking utensils in Abura. She lives together with her husband and young child. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of bowls and utensils to sell. She desires to reinvest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: buy bowls and utensils

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is married and has 6 children. She makes soya kebab for sale in Abura (as shown in the picture). The kebab is made from soya beans. Her husband is a mason. Araba uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of their home. Araba will use this loan to puchase bags of soya beans to process into kebabs for sale. Her future plan for her business is to build a snack bar.

loans.use: buy soya beans to make kebabs for sale

loans.name: Nexaida

texts.es: Nexaida de 22 años de edad, convive con Richard de 25 años de edad quienes habitan en una casa alquilada. Por sus venas corre sangre de agricultor, ya que generalmente en su comunidad todos se dedican a dicha actividad. Actualmente se dedica a cultivar cacao, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus 4 hijos y durante el tiempo de cosecha tiene que contratar peones. Normalmente su producto lo vende en los Centros de Acopio, en la  localidad de Pichari. En adelante piensa comprar más terrenos, para así producir en grandes volúmenes y por consiguiente vender su producto a un  buen precio. El único inconveniente que ella tiene es que su parcela se encuentra en un lugar accidentado que no tiene acceso de movilidad y le es muy forzoso el  trasladar sus productos cosechados. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que realicen la limpieza de su parcela agrícola.
texts.en:
Nexaida is 22 years old and in a common-law marriage with Richard, age 25. They live in a rented house. The blood of a farmer runs through her veins since almost everyone in her community engages in agriculture. Nexaida currently grows cacao. Occasionally she has the help of her four children, but she must hire workers during the harvest season. She normally sells her products at the collection centers in the town of Pichari. Going forward, Nexaida plans to buy more land so that she can produce in greater volumes and continue selling her products at a good price. Her only challenge at the moment is a parcel of land that she owns that is located in a rugged area not accessible by vehicle. As a result, she is not able to transport her harvested products.

This will be her second loan with MFP. Nexaida promises to submit her payments on time. The loan of 2000 PEN will be used to hire workers to clear her parcel of farmland.

loans.use: to pay workers to clear her farmland.

loans.name: Ayisha

texts.en:
For the past 11 years, Ayisha has been selling wakye. Wakye (rice and beans cooked together) is served with tomato sauce, black pepper sauce, boiled eggs, macaroni, salad, wele, chicken and fish.  

Ayisha is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. Ayisha uses her income to assist her husband in the education of their children. Ayisha will use this loan to purchase rice and beans and other ingredients to cook food to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she plans to build a shop.

loans.use: buy ingredients to cook food for sale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has 4 children.  She operates a food station in Abura where she sells food such as fufu, banku, rice balls and others items.  She has had this business for 10 years. Her partner is a cleaner.   Aba uses her income to support her partner take care of their home. Aba will use this loan to purchase food items such as cassavas, plantains and others to cook and sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she plans to build a proper restaurant.

loans.use: buy food items to cook and sell

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en:
Kevina is a single mother of four children, all  of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of  additional family members.  She owns a restuarant  and works seven days a week.  She has been in business for the last nine years.  She works from her home and her neighbors are her customers. 

Kevina has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO to purchase more food items, like bunches of bananas, beef and rice. Kevina's major challenges are thieves and transportation of food staffs from the market to her home.  Kevina aspires to see her business grow big so that she can own a fully-stocked restaurant.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef and rice

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is standing close to the oven she uses to smoke fish. She is a widow taking care of 10 children. She wants to increase the quantity of smoked fish sold so she can take care of her children. The loan when received will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale.  Ekua plans to reinvest the new profits back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: buy fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Amivi est une femme âgée de 23 ans. Elle est célibataire.
Amivi a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des sachets plastiques de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Amivi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 30 balles de sachets plastiques.
texts.en:
Amivi is a woman of 23. She is single. 

Amivi has worked at selling goods since 2004. She sells plastic bags by walking from place to place. She buys her products in Lomé.

Amivi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy 30 bales of plastic bags.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags.

loans.name: Esia

texts.en: Esia is married and has 7 children. Her companion is a blacksmith. She sells yams, plantains and cassavas in Abura, which she has done for 5 years. Esia uses her income to assist her companion in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. Esia will use the loan to purchase more quantities of yams and plantains to sell.  She plans to reinvest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: buy yams and plantains

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: In the picture above, Araba is standing close to the traditionally built oven which she uses to smoke the fish for sale. She lives together with her spouse and has 5 children.  Her spouse is a mason.  Araba has been selling smoked fish for 15 years. She responsibly helps her husband take care of their  home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: buy fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un menuisier. Ils ont trois enfants.
Akossiwa a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des produits d'alimentation. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Akossiwa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 4 cartons de conserves, 6 pattes alimentaires et des autres produits d'alimentation.
Elle vend aussi de la boisson.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a woman of 39. She is married to a carpenter and they have three children. 

Akossiwa has worked at selling goods since 2005. She sells foodstuffs. She buys her products in Lomé.

Akossiwa has requested her third loan from WAGES to buy four cases of tinned goods, six cases of pasta, and other groceries. 

She also sells alcoholic beverages.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha  is a married woman with two children, both of whom go to school.  She doesn't take care of additional family members. She sells fruits and  vegetables at the market and works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years.  

Aisha has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO,  with which to buy more watermelon, oranges, mangoes, and tomatoes.  Her major business challenges include transportation and perishability.  She resides in a rented house and has access to electricity  but not piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like watermelon, tomatoes, oranges and mangoes

loans.name: Victoire Pétrina

texts.fr:
Victoire Petrina est une femme âgée de 46 ans. Elle est veuve avec un enfant.
Victorie Petrina a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des habits et chaussures de friperie au marché du Sanguera. Elle achète les produits au marché de Hédzranawoé.
