Here we meet 40 year-old Charito who lives with her common-law husband and has five children aged 24, 18, 14, 9 and 4.  Her children are currently attending university, high school, elementary school and nursery school.  Her husband is a radio engineer.

Our friend tells us that, in order to help her husband with the arduous task of supporting their household and covering their children's expenses, six years ago she set up a small store in her home where she sells all kinds of products.  On weekends, she travels to Santa Ana and Calderón parishes.  She makes the most of the fact that Saturdays and Sundays are market days in these areas and she sets up a small stall where she sells her merchandise.  She buys her products in the city of Guayaquil as she can buy a wider range of products there at lower prices.

Charito will use this loan to buy more products such as hairbands, cards, stuffed toys, costume jewelry, etc.  Charito is a founding member of her community bank.  She is the bank's treasurer and she likes it because she has been able to increase her business thanks to the loans that she has received.

Charito's goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy hairbands, cards, stuffed toys, etc.

loans.name: Amelia Rosa

texts.es: Amelia de 50 años vive en el Municipio de Soledad con su esposo y su hijo de 26 años y se dedica a la fabricación de productos de confecciones como vestidos, camisas blusas, cubrelechos y también vende mercancía que le traen desde Medellín, como jeans y camisetas. Su negocio funciona desde hace 10 años, cuando por sugerencia de su familia empezó confeccionando la ropa de ellos y con recursos propios adquirió una máquina sencilla, una plana y una fileteadora, con las que gradualmente fue creciendo. Ahora su negocio  es reconocido por su gran creatividad en la fabricación de sus prendas femeninas,  el buen servicio que presta a sus clientes, pues vende lo que le solicitan y también  le favorece su ubicación,  que le ayuda   a que las ventas se mantengan un buen volumen .  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mari Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  telas, e insumos para fabricar vestidos femeninos   encargados y también para comprar una maquina recubridora, con la cual   trabajará con un mejor acabado los  dobladillos de las camisetas,  a los ribetes o cintas al bies.  Su meta más adelante  es lograr adecuar en su nueva vivienda, un local como taller y punto comercial para diversificar su oferta y posicionarse en el mercado.
texts.en:
Amelia is 50 years old and lives in the town of Soledad, together with her husband and her 26 year-old son.  Her business is sewing products such as dresses, shirts, blouses and bedspreads.  She also sells merchandise which she receives from Medellín such as jeans and t-shirts.  Amelia has been in business for 10 years.  At her family's suggestion, she started making clothes for them and, with her own financial resources, she acquired a simple sewing machine, a flat machine and an overlock machine.  Her business gradually grew.  Now her business is well known owing to the great creativity that she displays in making women's clothes and the good service that she provides to her customers (she sells what her customers request).  Her location is also favorable and helps her sales to remain high.

This Kiva loan is Amelia's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy fabric and supplies for making women's dresses to order.  She will also buy a 'máquina recubridora' (a special machine used for hemming) which she will use to provide a better finish to the hems of her t-shirts, to edging or ribbons on the bias.  Her goal for the future is to set up a workshop and sales location in her new home so that she can diversify her offerings and position herself in the market.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies for making women's clothes.  She will also buy a 'máquina recubridora' (a special kind of sewing machine used for hemming)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 52 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eyner de 52 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Rosa el negocio de venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le ha ayudado a obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostener a su familia. A sus 20 años decidió salir de la casa de sus padres y hoy es una de las vendedoras de ropa más solicitadas de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 30 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Espera con el tiempo tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con más comodidad su mercadería. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de todos ustedes; además se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa, para así incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene para vender
texts.en:
52 year-old Rosa is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 52 year-old Eyner, and her five beloved children, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Rosa's clothing sales business has helped her to make the income that she needs to support her family.  At the age of 20, she decided to leave her parents' home and now she is one of the most requested clothes sellers in the city of Pucallpa.  What she most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers.  She has been in this business for 30 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to walk all day in search of customers.  Even so, she knows that this is her work and that she must do it.  In the future, Rosa would like to have a large store where she can sell her merchandise more comfortably.

This is Rosa's fourth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Rosa will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes so that she can increase the quantity of merchandise that she has available to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Jesus Flora

texts.es:
Jesus Flora tiene 31 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Jesus se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es seguir trbajando.

Le gusta ver television.
texts.en:
Jesus Flora is 31 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their two children in Ventanas Canton, in the province of Los Ríos.

Her community bank is called VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE and is located in Recinto Sibimbe in Ventanas Canton. The twenty members of the bank work in agriculture growing corn and rice.

Jesus too grows corn and rice. She buys her supplies in Ventanas each month and sells the produce in the local market.

She is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure. The money will help her to purchase these necessities. Sometimes she is faced with problems such as when her crops are attacked by insects. Jesus’s hope is to be able to continue her work. She enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a display case as well as the clothing and accessories ordered by her customers

loans.name: Christian Patricio

texts.es:
Christian Patricio tiene 25 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Christian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Christian Patricio is 25 years old and is married and lives with his wife and children. He lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

This communal bank is called VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe and is located in the Sibimbe precinct in the canton of Ventanas. The communal bank has 20 members all of whom work in short cycle agriculture planting corn and rice.

Christian works in short cycle agriculture growing corn and rice. He makes his purchases in Ventanas each month and sells his produce in the market of the same town.

He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure. The support from this loan will help economically supplement his needs. His dream is to continue working. He also likes sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como la subidita al cielo en el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen las socias  del Banco Comunal Subidita Al Cielo, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Manuela, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad y  estudia en universidad, el ya está comprometido pero aun vive en su casa junto a su mujer. El marido es taxista.
 
Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de artículos tanto personales como para el hogar (planchas, licuadoras, colchones, zapatos, teléfonos, etc.) a través de cartillas. También vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días en los momentos que está desocupada, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Nos cuenta que lleva  10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, zapatoa, ventiladores, planchas, licuadoras entre otras cosas que tiene pedido. Esta desde el principio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The members of the Community Bank Subidita al Cielo located in the neighbourhood of San Pablo in the town of Portoviejo meet every two weeks. It is a highly populated urban area.

42-year old Señora Manuela is a member of the bank. She is in a common-law relationship and has a grown son who is studying at university. He is engaged but still lives with his mother. Manuela’s husband is a taxi driver.

Manuela is a housewife who in order to have an income of her own sells items both for personal use and for the home (irons, blenders, mattresses, shoes, telephones etc). She also sells Avon beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories. She sells door-to-door and works every day when she has no other duties. Her customers buy on credit and then Manuela collects money every week. She has been doing this work for ten years and it is going well. 

The loan is to be used to buy perfumes, creams, shoes, fans, mattresses, blenders etc. for which she has orders. She has been a member of her bank since the beginning and enjoys it because it is easy to make the repayments. Manuela’s dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, shoes, fans, mattresses, blenders etc

loans.name: Danilse De Jesus

texts.es: Danilse vive en Soledad un municipio a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla donde se dedica a la fabricación de ropa en su negocio llamado “Confecciones Danilse” ella  es casada y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 21 y 23 años con los que sueña ver prósperos y exitosos.  Confecciones Danilse inició su negocio en el año 1991 al contraer matrimonio, para poder atender sus obligaciones familiares mientras generaba ingresos. Así fue como empezó con una máquina sencilla, una fileteadora  y una recubridora luego adicionó dos máquinas planas y con los financiamientos recibidos a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que hoy son 24,  ha logrado también agregar una bordadora, así como aumentar su capital de trabajo, pagar su vivienda totalmente y con ello incrementar su bienestar familiar . El credikiva es su financiamiento # 19, con el planea comprar telas para fabricar pantalones masculinos y camisas encargadas por sus nuevos clientes pues se propone aumentarlos, para generar una mayor rentabilidad que le permita lograr apoyar a sus hijos en su profesionalización y  construir el segundo piso de su vivienda, lo cual es su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Danilse lives in Soledad, a town which is located 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  There she has a dressmaking business called 'Confecciones Danilse'.  Danilse is married and has two children, aged 21 and 23, who she dreams of seeing prosper and succeed.

Danilse started her business in 1991, when she got married, so that she could attend to her family obligations whilst making income.  She started out with a simple sewing machine, an overlock machine and a 'recubridora' (a special machine used for hemming).  She then added two flat machines and, through the loans that she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she has also managed to add an embroidery machine.  In addition, she has increased her working capital, completely paid off her house and thereby improved her family's well-being.

This Kiva loan is Danilse's 19th loan.  She plans to use it to buy material for making men's pants and shirts ordered by her new customers.  She is planning to increase her number of customers in order to make better profits which will allow her to support her children in becoming professionals and also enable her to build a second level on her home.  This is her greatest challenge.

loans.use: to buy material for making men's pants and shirts to order

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
Maria es comerciante, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosmeticos, que durante veinte años, vende en donde comenzo con la venta de piñatas, electrodomestico, con capital propio que sus hijos dieron. 
Atraves de los años ha venido manteniendo y invirtiendo en su capital, con prestamo que Afodenic ha otorgado en siete ciclos, lo que para ella ha sido un éxito.
Hoy en dia tiene poca mercaderia y desea comprar, una docena de toallas de baño, sabanas, una docena de camisetas, bolsos grandes,camisones de dormir, perfumes entre otros encargos para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.Ya que tiene que cubrir sus gastos, basicos de la casa y gastos personales, teniendo la ayuda economica de sus hijos tambien.
texts.en:
Maria is a vendor and sells clothing and cosmetics.  She began selling piñatas and domestic appliances twenty years ago with capital her children gave her.

Over the years she has been able to maintain and invest her capital, and Afodenic has given her loans on seven occasions which have also contributed to her success.

She currently has only a little merchandise on hand and wants to buy a dozen bath towels, sheets, a dozen t-shirts, big bags, nightgowns, perfumes and other items that customers are ordering.  She has to cover household and personal expenses, and also receives some economical support from her children.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics to increase sales.

loans.name: Pochita

texts.es: Pochita de 32 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 47 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En su propia casa Pochita tiene un puesto de comida donde vende sus deliciosos platillos, el aroma que sale de sus ricos potajes es suficiente para atraer a los clientes, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general vende mucho durante toda la mañana. Tiene 3 años en este negocio, el cual le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea poner un restaurante, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos y así mejorar su ingresos económicos. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil atender a todas las personas que recurren a su puesto, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar la comida que vende.
texts.en:
Pochita is 32 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 47 year-old José, and her four beloved children, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Pochita has a food stall in her own home where she sells delicious meals.  The aroma that wafts from her delicious soups is enough to attract customers.  Her stall is very popular and she generally sells a lot throughout the whole morning.  Pochita has been in this business for three years and it has made her the money she needs to feed her children and pay for their education.  However, she feels that she will have more expenses in the future and will not have enough money to cover them.  For this reason, she would like to set up a restaurant where she can sell her delicious dishes more comfortably and also improve her income.  

Pochita enjoys chatting with her customers and enjoys her work but it is very difficult to serve all the people who come to her business.  However, she does not flag in her eagerness to get ahead in life and she is prepared to work very hard in order to achieve this.

This will be Pochita's twelfth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you.  Pochita will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more ingredients with which to prepare the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Leidy Laura

texts.es: Lady vende verdura, frutas y abarrotes en un punto comercial donde también tiene una miscelánea y comercializa accesorios, papelería  y detalles para toda ocasión, mediante sistemas de contado a sus clientes del barrio y de los alrededores de él y también cuenta con unos pocos clientes a los que les vende a crédito. Este negocio lo inició Lady  ayudando a su mamá en un restaurante que tenía en su casa  y cuando el punto se popularizó,  Lady  adicionó una frutera con pocos productos, a la que fue gradualmente agregando otros; así ha logrado sostenerse con una experiencia de 8 años, ha crecido  y ahora también surte con productos de la canasta familiar a tiendas aledañas a su negocio. Su sueño más adelante es convertirse en un autoservicio y adquirir su vivienda propia y este es justamente su más grande desafío. El credikiva es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en mayor volumen, frutas, verdura, abarrotes y variedades que surtirán su miscelánea,  para venderlos y obtener una rentabilidad no menor de un 25%.  Mientras Lady realiza un gran esfuerzo para lograr su sueño se mantiene muy contenta, porque genera ingresos para sostener  a sus dos hijos pequeños, que la inspiran a salir adelante  para propiciarles un futuro potencialmente exitoso.
texts.en:
Lady sells fruit, vegetables and groceries from a sales location where she also has a general store and sells accessories, stationery products and gifts for all occasions.  She sells, for cash, to neighborhood customers and also people from surrounding areas.  She also has a few customers to whom she sells on credit.

Lady started this business by helping her mom in a restaurant that she had in her home.  When the location became popular, Lady added a fruit stall with just a few products.  She gradually added more and more products.  She now has eight years experience in her business which has grown.  She now also supplies neighboring stores with basic household products.  Her dream for the future is to turn her business into a supermarket and acquire her own home.  This is her biggest challenge.

This Kiva loan is Lady's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy a larger volume of fruit, vegetables, groceries and other products that she will use to stock her general store.  She will sell these products and obtain a profitability of no less than 25%.  While Lady makes a big effort to achieve her dream, she remains very happy because she is making income with which she is able to support her two young children who inspire her to get ahead so that she can provide them with a potentially successful future.

loans.use: to buy a larger volume of fruit, vegetables, groceries and other products

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De San Ramón Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Los Emprendedores de San Ramón” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la comuna de La Cisterna, ciudad de Santiago. Sus principales negocios son de peluquería, artesanía en madera, venta de joyas, perfumería, chocolates y comida rápida.
Debbie integrante de éste grupo, en la foto se encuentra de pie, en el costado derecho, además viste de color negro y su cabello está tomado. 
Su negocio consiste en la venta de perfumes por catalogo y también compra directamente para abastecerse de mercadería. Sus clientes son frecuentes y van a su propio domicilio a comprar, ya que además ofrece su mercadería por internet. Su horario laboral es muy flexible. 
Con el crédito compró perfumes y estos además llevaban otros productos como cremas y shampoos.
Sus metas en su negocio, son tener un local establecido, específicamente un centro de belleza y estética. 
Debbie vive junto a su hijo de 2 años y sus sueños son obtener su casa propia y brindarle una educación de calidad a su hijo. 
Debbie agradecida del crédito de Fondo esperanza, ya que ha significado un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que con éste podrá invertir en él. Ella además está muy contenta con las reuniones y demás socios del grupo, ya que son muy unidos y organizados. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
The “Los Emprendedores de San Ramón” community bank consists of 19 entrepreneurs who live in La Cisterna, in the city of Santiago.  Their main businesses are hairdressing, making handicrafts from wood, selling jewelry, selling perfume, selling chocolate and selling fast food.

Debbie is a member of this group.  She is standing on the right-hand side of the photo wearing black and has her hair up.  Debbie's business is selling perfumes through a catalog and she also buys direct so that she can stock up with merchandise.  She has frequent customers and they come to her home to make their purchases.  She also offers her merchandise on the Internet.  Her working hours are very flexible.

Debbie used her loan to buy perfume and other products such as creams and shampoos.

Debbie's goal for her business is to own established premises, specifically a beauty and aesthetics salon.

Debbie lives together with her 2 year-old son and her dreams are to acquire her own home and provide her son with a good-quality education.

Debbie is grateful for the loan from Fondo Esperanza.  It is a great support for her business as she will be able to use it to invest in her business.  Debbie is also very happy with her community bank meetings and with the other members of her group as they are very united and organized.

La Cisterna is a community which is located in the central-south district of the Metropolitana region.  It is an essentially residential and commercial area.  It was originally a rural sector, consisting of large plots of land.  However, owing to its population growth and the subsequent arrival of services, it became a 100% urban sector.

loans.use: to buy perfume

loans.name: Merci

texts.es: Merci, de 40 años, es una  mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alcides de 48 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de abarrotes de Merci es una de las más visitadas de la ciudad de Pucallpa, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 6 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. En adelante espera ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es será su  séptimo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
40 year-old Merci is a very kind and unassuming woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 48 year-old Alcides, and her four beloved children, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Merci's grocery store is one of the busiest in the city of Pucallpa.  She opens her store very early in the morning and waits for her customers to come and buy the things they need.  Merci is a very cheerful and attentive saleswoman.  She always greets her customers with a smile and is ready to help them with their purchases.  What she most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers.  Merci has been in this business for six years and she considers the most difficult part of her work being having to stay in her store all day without being able to go out.  In the future, Merci hopes to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise so that she can offer her customers a better variety of products.

This will be Merci's seventh loan from MFP and she is prepared to make all of her repayments on time as she doesn't want to cause difficulties for her community bank where she is very well liked by her fellow members.  Merci will use the 2,500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Adelaida Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como la subidita al cielo en el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen las socias  del Banco Comunal Subidita Al Cielo, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Adelaida, tiene  57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace algunos años, sus otros hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella viven dos nietas de 8 y 6 años que son de su hijo fallecido, ellas estudian en escuela .El marido es comerciante de material para reciclar.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para ayudad a su esposo el mismo que se  dedica a la comprar y venta de embases tanto de plástico como de aluminio (reciclar), el se desplaza por toda la ciudad comprando estos embases en las casas, lo que más compra son los tarros de leche, una vez que ha conseguido suficientes de estos embases el los lleva hasta los depósitos y locales donde venden pintura para que estos los utilicen para la venta de la pintura, nos cuenta que su esposo lleva más de 10 años que  se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a esto ellos siguen adelante y no les falta para sus sustento diario.

Este crédito es para comprar embases plásticos, aluminio y hierro entre otras cosas que sirven para reciclaje, Esta desde el principio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho a su marido.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para que su marido realice el trabajo de una forma mas fácil.
texts.en:
In the sector know as Ascent to Heaven in the San Pablo neighborhood in the city of  Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank Subidita al Cielo [Ascent to Heaven] meet twice monthly.  It is in a very populated part of the city on the edge of the urban zone.  

Here lives Señora Adelaida.  She is 57 years old and is in a common law relationship from which she has seven children.  One of her children died several years ago and the others are older and independent.   Her son who passed away has two children ages 8 and 6 that live with her.  They both attend school.  Her husband works as a dealer of recycling materials.  

She is requesting a loan to help her husband who buys and sells plastic and aluminum containers (to recycle).  He travels around the city, house to house,  buying these containers.  He mostly buys milk cans.  Once he has enough of these he takes them to the places that fill and sell paint so that they can use them to sell the paint.  She tells us that her husband has been doing this for more than 10 years and thankfully, this has allowed them to get ahead and meet their daily needs.  

This loan will be use to purchase plastic, aluminum and iron containers for recycling.  She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning.  She likes the loans because they are a great help to her husband.  
 
Her dream is to buy a car to make her husband's job is easier.

loans.use: buy plastic, aluminum and iron containers.

loans.name: Aldina

texts.es:
La señora Aldina es socia del banco comunal Las Fresitas del Distrito De Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos.
Son 25 ciclos que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella brinda servicio de alquiler de habitaciones (cuartos), sus cobros son mensuales y este dinero le sirve para poder solventar los gastos de estudios de sus tres hijos que todavía están a su cargo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,700.00 nuevos soles comprará materiales de construcción para dar mejorar sus instalaciones: 3 cientos de madera, 6 bolsas de cemento, 10 planchas de calaminas, 1 kilo de clavos para calamina, 15 listones, 2 kilos de clavos de 3 pulgadas.
El sueldo que tiene su esposo les sirve para pagar los gastos básicos y la alimentación de su familia.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de poder tener su propio negocio y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que tengan una profesión y puedan valerse por sí mismos.
texts.en:
Señora Aldina is a member of the community bank called "Las Fresitas" ("The Wild Strawberries"), in Yarinacocha District, in the department of Ucayali .  She is 50 years old and married with six children.  The community bank has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 25 cycles.  

Señora Aldina provides a rental service for accommodation (rooms), the fees are charged monthly and this money is used to cover the costs of education for the three of their children who are still in their care.  With her new loan of 2700 New Soles, she will buy construction materials to improve her facilities: 300 boards of wood, 6 bags of cement, 10 corrugated sheets, 1 kilo of nails for the corrugated sheets, 15 slats, 2 kilos of 3 inch nails.

The salary that her husband earns is used to pay basic expenses and feeding their family.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to have her own business and to be able to help her children have a profession and be able to fend for themselves.

loans.use: to buy cement and corrugated sheets.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es la propietaria  de un negocio de tienda, que nació de una necesidad de doble vía, la primera fue la de generar ingresos para aumentar el bienestar de su familia y la segunda hace referencia a que la comunidad no lograba encontrar productos de la canasta familiar al detalle y en un sitio cercano a su casa.  Su sueño es convertirla en un granadero bien surtido para proveer a otras tiendas pequeñas, pero es consciente de que su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograr su sueño. Esta es la razón por la cual está entusiasmada con un credikiva, porque planea gradualmente aumentar su capital  y ofrecer buenos precios, que obtendrá haciendo compras de contado y en volumen, derivando de ello él éxito de esta inversión. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Ana hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará víveres e insumos de primera necesidad, para surtir su tienda con mercancías de mayor rotación, como aceite, arroz, azúcar, tubérculos, bebidas y refrescos y así comenzará a darle curso a su sueño.
texts.en:
Ana owns a store, which was born out of two needs: the first was to generate income so as to improve her family's wellbeing, while the second was to help her community, which did not have access to everyday products at a place near to home.

Her goal is to convert the shop into a well-stocked supplier to other small stores, but she knows that her working capital is insufficient for this at the moment.  This is why she is so happy about getting credit from Kiva.  It will help her plan to gradually increase her capital and offer good prices, which she can get with cash and volume purchases, and thereby make this investment successful.  This is her first loan with Kiva partner the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will buy provisions and everyday goods to stock her store with the quickest-selling merchandise, such as oil, rice, sugar, tubers, and drinks and thus put herself on the road to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy provisions and everyday goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto de 42 años, es un hombre muy amable y sencillo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Marilú de 25 años y su querida hija Darinka de 8 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días junto a su motocarro, Humberto sale en busca de clientes para transportar, su día comienza muy temprano por la mañana, ya que la experiencia de los años le ha demostrado que mientras más temprano trabaja más dinero lleva a su hogar y se queda hasta altas horas de la noche, llegando solo a su casa para dormir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros y hacerles más ameno el viaje, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar las largas noches de la ciudad de Pucallpa. En adelante espera juntar el  dinero necesario, para comprar un nuevo motocarro, con el cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos. Este será su décimo primer crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes ya que así podrá desarrollar su negocio. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, enviará su moto al técnico para darle un mantenimiento.
texts.en:
42 year-old Humberto is a very kind and unassuming man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 25 year-old Marilú, and his beloved 8 year-old daughter Darinka, who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Every day Humberto goes out in his car to find customers to transport.  His day starts very early in the morning since the experience that comes with years of working in this business has shown him that the earlier he starts work, the more money he takes home to his family.  He stays out working until late at night, only returning home to sleep.

What Humberto most enjoys about his work is chatting to his passengers and making their journey more pleasant.  He has been in this business for eight years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be having to endure long nights in the city of Pucallpa.  In the future, he hopes to be able to put together enough money to buy a new car so that he can improve his income.

This will be Humberto's eleventh loan from MFP and he hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you so that he can make progress in his business.  He will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to send his car to a mechanic to have it serviced.

loans.use: to send his car to be serviced

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del  BA. Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y  tiene dos hijos.  Estudió hasta 4to de secundaria.
Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos ciclos, su primer préstamo solicitado de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de carne vacuno y porcino.
Eugenia solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de seis degollados de corderos para venderlos en el mercado de Ilave.  En  el negocio le ayuda su esposo e hijos, también cuenta que su esposo trabaja en transporte de servicio urbano (es chofer).  
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes y una cortadora de carne.
Lo que le gusta de su BA. Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the "San Miguel Arcángel II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She studied up to the fourth year of high school.

Eugenia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two loan cycles.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling beef and pork.

Eugenia is requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles which she will invest in buying six [dead] lambs to sell in Ilave market.  Eugenia's husband and children help her in her business.  She tells us that her husband works as a driver, providing an urban transport service.

Eugenia's dream is to own a grocery store and a meat cutter.  What she likes most about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy six [dead] lambs

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 52 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Inés de 46 años y sus 3 queridos hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Francisco la crianza de animal vacuno,  es una actividad que le viene de familia, desde muy pequeño aprendió a realizar esta actividad, actualmente él realiza este trabajo y es muy bueno haciéndolo, ya que su reses son muy solicitados en las ferias de Pucallpa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pastear a sus animales y poder permanecer al aire libre. Lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para él es llevar su ganado degollado hasta el camal de Pucallpa. En adelante espera incrementar el número de animales que tiene para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y por tal espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Asimismo se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más forraje para engordar mejor a su ganado.
texts.en:
52 year-old Francisco is a very unassuming and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 46 year-old Inés, and his three beloved children, who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

For Francisco, raising cattle is an activity that comes from his family.  He learned the business when he was very young.  He currently carries out this business and is very good at it.  His cattle are very much in demand in the markets in Pucallpa.

What Francisco most enjoys about his work is pasturing his animals and being able to spend time out in the open air.  He has been in this business for 13 years and the most difficult part of his work is taking his herd to the slaughterhouse in Pucallpa.  In the future, he hopes to increase the number of animals that he owns so that he can improve his income.

This will be Francisco's second loan from MFP and he hopes to receive the support of each one of you.  For his part, he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments.  Francisco will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more fodder so that he can better fatten his herd.

loans.use: to buy more fodder with which to feed his animals

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene ocho hijos (5 independientes).  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Flavia trabaja junto con su esposo, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales caseros, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año. Su primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles comprará diez unidades de animales para su respectivo engorde por tres a cuatro meses.
Su sueño es tener una casa y tener animales mejorados para incrementar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Flavia is a member of the communal lender “San Miguel Arcángel II”, of El Collao, Puno, Peru.  She is 47, married and has 8 children (5 live independently).  She has not had the opportunity to study.  Flavia works with her husband buying, raising and selling domestic animals, and has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. A prior loan of S/. 500.00 was used to grow her business.  This loan of S/. 1500.00 will allow her to buy ten domestic animals to raise and re-sell in about 3-4 months time.  Flavia hopes one day to have her own house and expand her business.
She also enjoys the informational meetings provided by the communal lender.

loans.use: to buy and raise ten domestic animals

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Elsa de 52 años de edad vive en el barrio El Socorro de la ciudad de Cartagena, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 13 años,  para quienes sueña construir un futuro prometedor. En este ambiente de playa, brisa y mar, Elsa tiene un negocio de miscelánea que inició hace 6 años, donde vende productos para el hogar, accesorios femeninos, ropa, artículos plásticos, perfumería, papelería  y cosméticos, mediante el sistema de crédito y de contado, a clientes ubicados alrededor de su barrio, entre los que se encuentran amas de casa, jóvenes, empleados y estudiantes.    Elsa está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 2 años, en los cuales ha recibido 2 financiamientos, con los que ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio. Su meta es lograr mayor crecimiento, por eso acude a un  credikiva con el cual comprará  bolsos, accesorios y ropa, para surtir su negocio y responder a los requerimientos de su clientela rentable. Mientras trabaja persistentemente para lograr sus sueños, continua esmerándose por conseguir una recuperación de sus cuentas por cobrar inferior a 30 días.
texts.en:
Elsa, aged 52, lives in the El Socorro neighborhood in the city of Cartagena.  She lives with her two children, aged 9 and 13, for whom she dreams of building a promising future.  In this atmosphere of beach, breeze, and sea.  Elsa has a business that she began 6 years ago.  It is a miscellaneous business that sells household products, women's accessories, clothing, plastic items, perfumes, stationery and cosmetics.  The business takes credit and cash from customers located around the neighborhood; among them are housewives, young people, employees and students.  

Elsa has been linked to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 2 years during which she has received 2 rounds of funding.  With this, she has managed to increase her working capital and supply her business.  Her goal is to achieve greater growth, which is why she is coming for a Kiva loan with which to buy handbags, accessories and clothing to supply her business and meet the requirements of her customers profitably.  While working persistently to achieve her dreams, she continues to strive to achieve payment of accounts receivable in less than 30 days.

loans.use: to buy handbags, accessories and clothing to stock up her business.

loans.name: Rocio Aracely

texts.es:
Rocio de 49 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es soltera y tiene una tienda.

Comenzó trabajando con una de sus hermanas como ella cerro el negocio, entonces ella decidió establecerlo en otro lugar así fue progresando poco a poco. Labora sola de 8H00 am a 10H00 pm vendiendo víveres a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas mercadería para surtir su negocio. En un futuro desea terminar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rocio is 49 years old and lives in Primavera, Duran.  This is a settlement on the outskirts of the city which was originally established without official authorization.  There are several hills, streams and lakes which are still present as the remains of a broken ecology.  Rocio is single and owns a store.

Rocio started working with one of her sisters.  She closed her business and so Rocio decided to set herself up in another place and made gradual progress.  She works alone in her store from 8.00am to 10.00pm, selling food products to her customers.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy more merchandise with which to stock her business.  In the future, she would like to finish building her home.

loans.use: to buy drinks, rice and canned goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y  tiene un hijo.  Estudió educación secundaria.
En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de especerías y carne de cordero.  Trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace más de un año, su  primer  préstamo  solicitado  fue de   S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de carnes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 2300.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco animales ovinos, para luego degollar y venderlo a S/. 100.00 – 400.00 nuevos soles de acuerdo al tamaño y peso.  La señora nos cuenta que los compran en las localidades de Lloroco, Juli, Zepita, Camicachi, Acora e Ilave y lo vende en Puno y Arequipa.
Su sueño es tener una casa y carro para su traslado, eso le facilitaría mucho.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, capacitaciones respecto a los temas del negocio y el machismo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the “San Miguel Arcángel II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 31 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She has a high school level of education.

Elizabeth works in her business together with her husband.  She sells spices and lamb.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than one year.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that loan in her business selling meat.

With this new loan for 2,300 soles, she will buy five sheep which she will later slaughter and sell for 100 - 400 soles, according to size and weight.  She tells us that she buys her animals in the towns of Lloroco, Juli, Zepita, Camicachi, Acora and Ilave and makes her sales in Puno and Arequipa.

Elizabeth's dream is to own her own home and a car to move about in which would make things much easier for her.

What Elizabeth likes about her community bank are the meetings and the training sessions about business and 'machismo' (male chauvinism).

loans.use: to buy five sheep

loans.name: Catalina Hortencia

texts.es:
Catalina D. 42 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín D. Guayaquil. Es separada y tiene dos hijos D. 23 años que esta en L. universidad y D. 13 años que esta en colegio. Se dedica a L. venta D. comida.

Empezó hace 10 años atrás,  con L. venta D. un carro que hizo decidió abrir un comedor , y elL. antes era cocinera D. un restaurante. Labora en el comedor preparando los alimentos desD. las 6H00 am . Le dificulta en su sector L. delincuencia ya que un día unos clientes saliendo del local le robaron. Con L. ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales para su comedor como platos ventilador y cosas varias. En un futuro desea poner una sucursal en otro lugar para expandirse y tener mas ingreso y que su hija termine L. universidad.
texts.en:
Catalina is 42 years old and lives in a peri-urban area, in El Fortín, Guayaquil.  She is separated and has two children aged 23 and 13.  One of her children is at university and the other is in high school.  Catalina's business is selling meals.

Catalina started her business ten years ago.  She used to sell from a cart and then decided to open an eatery.  She previously used to work as a cook in a restaurant.  Catalina works in her eatery, preparing meals from 6.00am.  One of the problems she has in her neighborhood is crime.  One day some customers robbed her as they left her premises.

With the help of this loan, Catalina would like to buy supplies for her eatery such as plates, fans and other items.  In the future, she would like to set up a branch in another place so that she can expand and make more income.  She would also like her daughter to finish university.

loans.use: to buy plates and fans for her business

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer esforzada, que ha venido apoyando a su familia laborando y teniendo una pequeña pulperia, logrando asi ayudarse economicamente con los gastos. Su esposo labora como conductor y su pequeño hijo cursa la primaria.
Hoy en dia Martha solo esta laborando, ya que esta tiempo completo en el trabajo y no habia quien le atendiera su pulperia. Ya que anteriormente solo trabajaba medio tiempo.
Atraves de Afodenic ha mejorado su vivienda, pagando a plazo favorable, con el credito anterior logro la compra de un inodoro, metiendo aguas negras teniendo mejor higiene. Hoy en dia lograra poner piso y la compra del lavamanos. Sus planes a corto plazo es poner nuevamente su pulperia ya que le era rentable.
texts.en:
Martha is a hard-working woman. She has helped her family by working and starting a corner store. This has enabled to cover her expenses. Her husband works as a driver and her young son is in elementary school.

Currently, there is no one to run the corner store because Martha is working full time at her job. Previously she had only worked part-time at her job.

Through Afodenic she has improved her home, paying within a favorable time frame. With the prior loan she was able to purchase a toilet, is now able to dispose of sewage, and has better hygiene. Now she will be able to put in a floor and purchase a sink. 

Her short term plans are to reopen her corner store as it was profitable for her.

loans.use: to put in a new floor and purchase a sink.

loans.name: Diana Johanna

texts.es:
Diana de 25 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Se dedica la venta de comesticos.

Comenzó hace mas de tres años, su esposo la dejo con su hijo pequeño y ella como no tenia trabajo inicio vendiendo comesticos. Ella vende productos como perfumes para hombre y mujer sombras y cremas bajo pedidos. En algunas ocasiones le dificultad en sus ventas ya que tiene que salir y no tiene quien cuide a su hijo. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas mercadería como perfumes cremas y ademas adecuar su vivienda. En un futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa para darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Diana is 25 years old and lives in an urban area in Las Orquídeas (so named because there used to be a lot of orchids in this area), in Guayaquil.  Her business is selling cosmetics. 

Diana started her business more than three years ago when her husband abandoned her and her young son.  As she didn't have any work at the time, she started selling cosmetics.  Diana sells products such as perfume for men and women, eyeshadows and creams.  She sells her items to order.  On some occasions, she has problems in making her sales because she has to go out and doesn't have anybody to look after her son.  With the help of this loan, Diana would like to buy more merchandise such as perfume and creams.  She would also like to do some work on her home.  In the future, she would like to finish building her home so that she can provide her son with the best.

loans.use: to buy perfume and creams, and to carry out work on her home

loans.name: Nury

texts.es: En su negocio llamado “Productos por catálogos Nury C.”,  Nury su propietaria,  vende mediante guías especializadas cosméticos, perfumes, ropa femenina y adornos para el hogar mediante el sistema de distribución a crédito en un porcentaje del 80% y  el resto de  contado,  a clientes ubicados en el barrio donde habita en el municipio de soledad, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla y en esta ciudad vende también  a clientes fijos, que la conocen por su amable y oportuno servicio. En su negocio Nury cobra semanalmente y quincenalmente y adquiere una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 25%, que planea aumentar en la medida en que consiga obtener financiación con la que incrementaría su capital de trabajo. Este es justamente el motivo de recurrir a un credikiva, con el cual comprará de contado y obteniendo descuentos, cosméticos, accesorios, perfumería que tiene encargado por sus rentables clientes.  Nury inició su negocio apoyada por su madre, de quien adquirió una gran experiencia, que le ha ayudado a través del tiempo, cuando con sus recursos logró un capital propio para desarrollar su propio emprendimiento mediante la venta de los  productos mencionados. Su meta más adelante es ampliar su vivienda, haciendo un segundo piso  que le permita separar el ambiente familiar del productivo y lograr mayor descanso en cada espacio.
texts.en:
Nury is the owner of her own business called “Productos por catálogos Nury C.” (Nury C. Catalog Products).  She sells cosmetics, perfume, ladies' clothes and decorations for the home through specialized catalogs.  She sells 80% of her products on credit and the rest for cash, to customers in her neighborhood, in the town of Soledad which is 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  In this city she also sells to regular customers who know her for her kind and timely service.

In her business, Nury collects payment every week and every fortnight.  She has a profitability on her sales of 25% and she plans to increase this as she manages to obtain financing with which she will increase her working capital.  This is the reason she is requesting a Kiva loan.  She will use her loan to buy products for cash and thereby obtain discounts.  She will buy cosmetics, accessories and perfume that she has orders for from her profitable customers.

Nury started her business with the support of her mother, from whom she gained a lot of experience which has helped her over time.  She used her own  resources to put together her own capital and set up her own business selling the aforementioned products.

Nury's goal for the future is to expand her home, adding a second level which will allow her to separate her family area from her business area.  This will allow her to relax more in both spaces.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, accessories and perfume that she has orders for.  She will pay cash and thereby obtain discounts

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz  es costurera de formación, tiene 35 años, es una joven madre y debe cuidar de sus pequeños hijos. Juntos residen en una casa alquilada. Trabaja en su taller de costura desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la  elaboración y confección de prendas de vestir de diferentes medidas, tanto para niños como para adultos. Asimismo recibe  pequeños trabajos de costura como entallados de ropa, subidas de basta entre otras aplicaciones. Lo que llega a producir lo vende en su puesto de ventas y también en la feria comercial de su ciudad. Con la constancia y la calidad de acabado de su trabajo en la costura le permite mantener, crecer y establecerse en el mercado de su zona y a la vez la anima a continuar  mejorando su negocio. Se entero de los créditos que ofrece MFP desde hace varios años atrás por medio de sus vecinas y en la actualidad tiene dentro de su record crediticio 11 créditos  y considera que cada crédito es la oportunidad de incrementar y mejorar su negocio. Por tanto espera el apoyo de ustedes para que pueda continuar progresando. Pertenece a su banco comunal IDME, inicio con un préstamo mínimo y en la actualidad tiene la capacidad de afrontar montos mayores por la sostenibilidad de su negocio. En esta ocasión comprará telas al por mayor y demás implementos que necesita como hilos, botones, cierres, elásticos entre otros.
texts.en:
Liz is a dressmaker by training.  She is 35 years old and a young mother who must care for her small children.  They live together in a rental house.

Liz has been working in her sewing workshop for four years.  She makes clothes in different sizes: both children's and adults' clothes.  She also receives small sewing jobs such as taking in clothes, turning up hems, etc.  She sells what she produces from her sales location and also in the market in her city.  Through the constancy and the quality of the finishing touches she gives to her work, she is able to maintain her business and also grow and establish herself in the local market.  She is also encouraged to continue improving her business.

Liz found out about the loans that MFP offer several years ago from her neighbors and she has 11 loans in her loan record.  She believes that each loan affords her an opportunity to increase and improve her business.  She therefore hopes to receive your support so that she can continue making progress.

Liz belongs to the IDME community bank.  She started out with a minimal loan and currently has the ability to take on larger amounts owing to the sustainability of her business.  On this occasion, she will buy fabric wholesale and also other items that she needs such as threads, buttons, fasteners, pieces of elastic, etc.

loans.use: to buy threads, buttons, fasteners and pieces of elastic
